Hebrew: אִ֛ישׁ הָיָ֥ה בְאֶֽרֶץ־ע֖וּץ אִיּ֣וֹב שְׁמ֑וֹ וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֗וּא תָּ֧ם וְיָשָׁ֛ר וִירֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְסָ֥ר מֵרָֽע׃
Translated: There was a man in the land of Uz named Job. That man was blameless and upright; he feared God and shunned evil.
Transliteration: iysh hayah veerets-uts iyyvov shemvo vehayah haiysh hahu tam veyashar viyre Elohim vesar mera

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּ֥לְדוּ ל֛וֹ שִׁבְעָ֥ה בָנִ֖ים וְשָׁל֥וֹשׁ בָּנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Seven sons and three daughters were born to him;
Transliteration: vayivaledu lvo shiveah vaniym veshalvosh vanvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י מִ֠קְנֵ֠הוּ שִֽׁבְעַ֨ת אַלְפֵי־צֹ֜אן וּשְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת אַלְפֵ֣י גְמַלִּ֗ים וַחֲמֵ֨שׁ מֵא֤וֹת צֶֽמֶד־בָּקָר֙ וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אֲתוֹנ֔וֹת וַעֲבֻדָּ֖ה רַבָּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא גָּד֖וֹל מִכׇּל־בְּנֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated: his possessions were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen and five hundred she-asses, and a very large household. That man was wealthier than anyone in the East.
Transliteration: vayehiy mikenehu shiveat alefey-tson usheloshet alefey gemaliym vachamesh mevot tsemed-vakar vachamesh mevot atvonvot vaavudah ravah meod vayehiy haiysh hahu gadvol mikhׇl-veney-kedem

Hebrew: וְהָלְכ֤וּ בָנָיו֙ וְעָשׂ֣וּ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה בֵּ֖ית אִ֣ישׁ יוֹמ֑וֹ וְשָׁלְח֗וּ וְקָֽרְאוּ֙ לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אַחְיֹתֵיהֶ֔ם לֶאֱכֹ֥ל וְלִשְׁתּ֖וֹת עִמָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: It was the custom of his sons to hold feasts, each on his set day in his own home. They would invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.
Transliteration: vehalekhu vanayv veashu misheteh veyt iysh yvomvo veshalechu vekareu lisheloshet acheyoteyhem leekhol velishetvot imahem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כִּ֣י הִקִּ֩יפוּ֩ יְמֵ֨י הַמִּשְׁתֶּ֜ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֧ח אִיּ֣וֹב וַֽיְקַדְּשֵׁ֗ם וְהִשְׁכִּ֣ים בַּבֹּ֘קֶר֮ וְהֶעֱלָ֣ה עֹלוֹת֮ מִסְפַּ֣ר כֻּלָּם֒ כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר אִיּ֔וֹב אוּלַי֙ חָטְא֣וּ בָנַ֔י וּבֵרְכ֥וּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בִּלְבָבָ֑ם כָּ֛כָה יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אִיּ֖וֹב כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: When a round of feast days was over, Job would send word to them to sanctify themselves, and, rising early in the morning, he would make burnt offerings, one for each of them; for Job thought, “Perhaps my children have sinned and blasphemed God in their thoughts.” This is what Job always used to do.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy hikiyfu yemey hamisheteh vayishelach iyyvov vayekadeshem vehishekhiym vavoker veheelah olvot misefar khulam khiy amar iyyvov ulay chateu vanay uverekhu Elohim vilevavam khakhah yaasheh iyyvov khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּב֥וֹא גַֽם־הַשָּׂטָ֖ן בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: One day the divine beings presented themselves before the L<small>ORD</small>, and the Adversary came along with them.
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom vayavou veney haElohim lehiteyatsev al-yehovah vayavvo gam-hashatan vetvokham

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֖ן מֵאַ֣יִן תָּבֹ֑א וַיַּ֨עַן הַשָּׂטָ֤ן אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מִשּׁ֣וּט בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּמֵֽהִתְהַלֵּ֖ךְ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> said to the Adversary, “Where have you been?” The Adversary answered the L<small>ORD</small>, “I have been roaming all over the earth.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-hashatan meayiin tavo vayaan hashatan et-yehovah vayomar mishut vaarets umehitehalekhe vah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֔ן הֲשַׂ֥מְתָּ לִבְּךָ֖ עַל־עַבְדִּ֣י אִיּ֑וֹב כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין כָּמֹ֙הוּ֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֧ם וְיָשָׁ֛ר יְרֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְסָ֥ר מֵרָֽע׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> said to the Adversary, “Have you noticed My servant Job? There is no one like him on earth, a blameless and upright man who fears God and shuns evil!”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-hashatan hashameta livekha al-avediy iyyvov khiy eyn khamohu vaarets iysh tam veyashar yere Elohim vesar mera

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן הַשָּׂטָ֛ן אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַֽחִנָּ֔ם יָרֵ֥א אִיּ֖וֹב אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The Adversary answered the L<small>ORD</small>, “Does Job not have good reason to fear God?
Transliteration: vayaan hashatan et-yehovah vayomar hachinam yare iyyvov Elohim

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־[אַ֠תָּ֠ה] (את) שַׂ֣כְתָּ בַעֲד֧וֹ וּבְעַד־בֵּית֛וֹ וּבְעַ֥ד כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ מִסָּבִ֑יב מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יָדָיו֙ בֵּרַ֔כְתָּ וּמִקְנֵ֖הוּ פָּרַ֥ץ בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Why, it is You who have fenced him round, him and his household and all that he has. You have blessed his efforts so that his possessions spread out in the land.
Transliteration: halo-[atah] (t) shakheta vaadvo uvead-veytvo uvead khׇl-asher-lvo misaviyv maasheh yadayv verakheta umikenehu farats vaarets

Hebrew: וְאוּלָם֙ שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֣א יָֽדְךָ֔ וְגַ֖ע בְּכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ אִם־לֹ֥א עַל־פָּנֶ֖יךָ יְבָרְכֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: But lay Your hand upon all that he has and he will surely blaspheme You to Your face.”
Transliteration: veulam shelach-na yadekha vega vekhׇl-asher-lvo im-lo al-faneykha yevarekhekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֗ן הִנֵּ֤ה כׇל־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ רַ֣ק אֵלָ֔יו אַל־תִּשְׁלַ֖ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וַיֵּצֵא֙ הַשָּׂטָ֔ן מֵעִ֖ם פְּנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> replied to the Adversary, “See, all that he has is in your power; only do not lay a hand on him.” The Adversary departed from the presence of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-hashatan hineh khׇl-asher-lvo veyadekha rak elayv al-tishelach yadekha vayetse hashatan meim feney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י הַיּ֑וֹם וּבָנָ֨יו וּבְנֹתָ֤יו אֹֽכְלִים֙ וְשֹׁתִ֣ים יַ֔יִן בְּבֵ֖ית אֲחִיהֶ֥ם הַבְּכֽוֹר׃
Translated: One day, as his sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother,
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom uvanayv uvenotayv okheliym veshotiym yayiin veveyt achiyhem havekhvor

Hebrew: וּמַלְאָ֛ךְ בָּ֥א אֶל־אִיּ֖וֹב וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַבָּקָר֙ הָי֣וּ חֹֽרְשׁ֔וֹת וְהָאֲתֹנ֖וֹת רֹע֥וֹת עַל־יְדֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: a messenger came to Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the she-asses were grazing alongside them
Transliteration: umaleakhe va el-iyyvov vayomar havakar hayu choreshvot vehaatonvot rovot al-yedeyhem

Hebrew: וַתִּפֹּ֤ל שְׁבָא֙ וַתִּקָּחֵ֔ם וְאֶת־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים הִכּ֣וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃
Translated: when Sabeans attacked them and carried them off, and put the boys to the sword; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
Transliteration: vatifol sheva vatikachem veet-haneariym hikhu lefiy-charev vaimaletah rak-aniy levadiy lehagiyd lakhe

Hebrew: ע֣וֹד ׀ זֶ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֗ר וְזֶה֮ בָּ֣א וַיֹּאמַר֒ אֵ֣שׁ אֱלֹהִ֗ים נָֽפְלָה֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַתִּבְעַ֥ר בַּצֹּ֛אן וּבַנְּעָרִ֖ים וַתֹּֽאכְלֵ֑ם וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃
Translated: This one was still speaking when another came and said, “God’s fire fell from heaven, took hold of the sheep and the boys, and burned them up; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
Transliteration: vod zeh medaver vezeh va vayomar esh Elohim nafelah min-hashamayiim vativear vatson uvaneariym vatokhelem vaimaletah rak-aniy levadiy lehagiyd lakhe

Hebrew: ע֣וֹד ׀ זֶ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֗ר וְזֶה֮ בָּ֣א וַיֹּאמַר֒ כַּשְׂדִּ֞ים שָׂ֣מוּ ׀ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה רָאשִׁ֗ים וַֽיִּפְשְׁט֤וּ עַל־הַגְּמַלִּים֙ וַיִּקָּח֔וּם וְאֶת־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים הִכּ֣וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃
Translated: This one was still speaking when another came and said, “A Chaldean formation of three columns made a raid on the camels and carried them off and put the boys to the sword; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
Transliteration: vod zeh medaver vezeh va vayomar khashediym shamu sheloshah rashiym vayifeshetu al-hagemaliym vayikachum veet-haneariym hikhu lefiy-charev vaimaletah rak-aniy levadiy lehagiyd lakhe

Hebrew: עַ֚ד זֶ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֔ר וְזֶ֖ה בָּ֣א וַיֹּאמַ֑ר בָּנֶ֨יךָ וּבְנוֹתֶ֤יךָ אֹֽכְלִים֙ וְשֹׁתִ֣ים יַ֔יִן בְּבֵ֖ית אֲחִיהֶ֥ם הַבְּכֽוֹר׃
Translated: This one was still speaking when another came and said, “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother
Transliteration: ad zeh medaver vezeh va vayomar vaneykha uvenvoteykha okheliym veshotiym yayiin veveyt achiyhem havekhvor

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֩ ר֨וּחַ גְּדוֹלָ֜ה בָּ֣אָה ׀ מֵעֵ֣בֶר הַמִּדְבָּ֗ר וַיִּגַּע֙ בְּאַרְבַּע֙ פִּנּ֣וֹת הַבַּ֔יִת וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים וַיָּמ֑וּתוּ וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃
Translated: when suddenly a mighty wind came from the wilderness. It struck the four corners of the house so that it collapsed upon the young people and they died; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
Transliteration: vehineh rucha gedvolah vaah meever hamidevar vayiga veareva finvot havayiit vayifol al-haneariym vayamutu vaimaletah rak-aniy levadiy lehagiyd lakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קׇם אִיּוֹב֙ וַיִּקְרַ֣ע אֶת־מְעִל֔וֹ וַיָּ֖גׇז אֶת־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיִּפֹּ֥ל אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: Then Job arose, tore his robe, cut off his hair, and threw himself on the ground and worshiped.
Transliteration: vayakׇm iyyvov vayikera et-meilvo vayagׇz et-roshvo vayifol aretsah vayishetachu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ עָרֹ֨ם יָצָ֜תִי מִבֶּ֣טֶן אִמִּ֗י וְעָרֹם֙ אָשׁ֣וּב שָׁ֔מָּה יְהֹוָ֣ה נָתַ֔ן וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה לָקָ֑ח יְהִ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה מְבֹרָֽךְ׃
Translated: He said, “Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return there; the L<small>ORD</small> has given, and the L<small>ORD</small> has taken away; blessed be the name of the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayomer arom yatsatiy miveten imiy vearom ashuv shamah yehovah natan vayhovah lakach yehiy shem yehovah mevorakhe

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־זֹ֖את לֹא־חָטָ֣א אִיּ֑וֹב וְלֹא־נָתַ֥ן תִּפְלָ֖ה לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: For all that, Job did not sin nor did he cast reproach on God.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-zot lo-chata iyyvov velo-natan tifelah lelohiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּב֤וֹא גַֽם־הַשָּׂטָן֙ בְּתֹכָ֔ם לְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב עַל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: One day the divine beings presented themselves before the L<small>ORD</small>. The Adversary came along with them to present himself before the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom vayavou veney haElohim lehiteyatsev al-yehovah vayavvo gam-hashatan vetokham lehiteyatsev al-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֔ן אֵ֥י מִזֶּ֖ה תָּבֹ֑א וַיַּ֨עַן הַשָּׂטָ֤ן אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מִשֻּׁ֣ט בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּמֵֽהִתְהַלֵּ֖ךְ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> said to the Adversary, “Where have you been?” The Adversary answered the L<small>ORD</small>, “I have been roaming all over the earth.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-hashatan ey mizeh tavo vayaan hashatan et-yehovah vayomar mishut vaarets umehitehalekhe vah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֗ן הֲשַׂ֣מְתָּ לִבְּךָ֮ אֶל־עַבְדִּ֣י אִיּוֹב֒ כִּי֩ אֵ֨ין כָּמֹ֜הוּ בָּאָ֗רֶץ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֧ם וְיָשָׁ֛ר יְרֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְסָ֣ר מֵרָ֑ע וְעֹדֶ֙נּוּ֙ מַחֲזִ֣יק בְּתֻמָּת֔וֹ וַתְּסִיתֵ֥נִי ב֖וֹ לְבַלְּע֥וֹ חִנָּֽם׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> said to the Adversary, “Have you noticed My servant Job? There is no one like him on earth, a blameless and upright man who fears God and shuns evil. He still keeps his integrity; so you have incited Me against him to destroy him for no good reason.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-hashatan hashameta livekha el-avediy iyyvov khiy eyn khamohu vaarets iysh tam veyashar yere Elohim vesar mera veodenu machaziyk vetumatvo vatesiyteniy vvo levalevo chinam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן הַשָּׂטָ֛ן אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר ע֣וֹר בְּעַד־ע֗וֹר וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָאִ֔ישׁ יִתֵּ֖ן בְּעַ֥ד נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: The Adversary answered the L<small>ORD</small>, “Skin for skin—all that a man has he will give up for his life.
Transliteration: vayaan hashatan et-yehovah vayomar vor vead-vor vekhol asher laiysh yiten vead nafeshvo

Hebrew: אוּלָם֙ שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֣א יָֽדְךָ֔ וְגַ֥ע אֶל־עַצְמ֖וֹ וְאֶל־בְּשָׂר֑וֹ אִם־לֹ֥א אֶל־פָּנֶ֖יךָ יְבָרְכֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: But lay a hand on his bones and his flesh, and he will surely blaspheme You to Your face.”
Transliteration: ulam shelach-na yadekha vega el-atsemvo veel-vesharvo im-lo el-faneykha yevarekhekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֖ן הִנּ֣וֹ בְיָדֶ֑ךָ אַ֖ךְ אֶת־נַפְשׁ֥וֹ שְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated: So the L<small>ORD</small> said to the Adversary, “See, he is in your power; only spare his life.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-hashatan hinvo veyadekha akhe et-nafeshvo shemor

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ הַשָּׂטָ֔ן מֵאֵ֖ת פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּ֤ךְ אֶת־אִיּוֹב֙ בִּשְׁחִ֣ין רָ֔ע מִכַּ֥ף רַגְל֖וֹ (עד) [וְעַ֥ד] קׇדְקֳדֽוֹ׃
Translated: The Adversary departed from the presence of the L<small>ORD</small> and inflicted a severe inflammation on Job from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head.
Transliteration: vayetse hashatan meet feney yehovah vayakhe et-iyyvov vishechiyn ra mikhaf ragelvo (d) [vead] kׇdekodvo

Hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ חֶ֔רֶשׂ לְהִתְגָּרֵ֖ד בּ֑וֹ וְה֖וּא יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּתוֹךְ־הָאֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: He took a potsherd to scratch himself as he sat in ashes.
Transliteration: vayikach-lvo cheresh lehitegared vvo vehu yoshev vetvokhe-haefer

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ עֹדְךָ֖ מַחֲזִ֣יק בְּתֻמָּתֶ֑ךָ בָּרֵ֥ךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים וָמֻֽת׃
Translated: His wife said to him, “You still keep your integrity! Blaspheme God and die!”
Transliteration: vatomer lvo ishetvo odekha machaziyk vetumatekha varekhe Elohim vamut

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֗יהָ כְּדַבֵּ֞ר אַחַ֤ת הַנְּבָלוֹת֙ תְּדַבֵּ֔רִי גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַטּ֗וֹב נְקַבֵּל֙ מֵאֵ֣ת הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְאֶת־הָרָ֖ע לֹ֣א נְקַבֵּ֑ל בְּכׇל־זֹ֛את לֹא־חָטָ֥א אִיּ֖וֹב בִּשְׂפָתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: But he said to her, “You talk as any shameless woman might talk! Should we accept only good from God and not accept evil?” For all that, Job said nothing sinful.
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha khedaver achat hanevalvot tedaveriy gam et-hatvov nekavel meet haElohim veet-hara lo nekavel vekhׇl-zot lo-chata iyyvov vishefatayv {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֞וּ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת ׀ רֵעֵ֣י אִיּ֗וֹב אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֣ה הַזֹּאת֮ הַבָּ֣אָה עָלָיו֒ וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֔וֹ אֱלִיפַ֤ז הַתֵּֽימָנִי֙ וּבִלְדַּ֣ד הַשּׁוּחִ֔י וְצוֹפַ֖ר הַנַּֽעֲמָתִ֑י וַיִּוָּעֲד֣וּ יַחְדָּ֔ו לָב֥וֹא לָנֽוּד־ל֖וֹ וּֽלְנַחֲמֽוֹ׃
Translated: When Job’s three friends heard about all these calamities that had befallen him, each came from his home—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They met together to go and console and comfort him.
Transliteration: vayishemeu sheloshet reey iyyvov et khׇl-haraah hazot havaah alayv vayavou iysh mimekomvo eliyfaz hateymaniy uviledad hashuchiy vetsvofar hanaamatiy vayivaadu yachedav lavvo lanud-lvo ulenachamvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֤ם מֵֽרָחוֹק֙ וְלֹ֣א הִכִּירֻ֔הוּ וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ קוֹלָ֖ם וַיִּבְכּ֑וּ וַֽיִּקְרְעוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מְעִל֔וֹ וַיִּזְרְק֥וּ עָפָ֛ר עַל־רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם הַשָּׁמָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: When they saw him from a distance, they could not recognize him, and they broke into loud weeping; each one tore his robe and threw dust into the air onto his head.
Transliteration: vayisheu et-eyneyhem merachvok velo hikhiyruhu vayisheu kvolam vayivekhu vayikereu iysh meilvo vayizereku afar al-rasheyhem hashamayemah

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֤וּ אִתּוֹ֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעַ֣ת לֵיל֑וֹת וְאֵין־דֹּבֵ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ דָּבָ֔ר כִּ֣י רָא֔וּ כִּי־גָדַ֥ל הַכְּאֵ֖ב מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: They sat with him on the ground seven days and seven nights. None spoke a word to him for they saw how very great was his suffering.
Transliteration: vayeshevu itvo laarets shiveat yamiym veshiveat leylvot veeyn-dover elayv davar khiy rau khiy-gadal hakheev meod

Hebrew: אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן פָּתַ֤ח אִיּוֹב֙ אֶת־פִּ֔יהוּ וַיְקַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־יוֹמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Afterward, Job began to speak and cursed the day of his birth.
Transliteration: acharey-khen fatach iyyvov et-fiyhu vayekalel et-yvomvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job spoke up and said:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: יֹ֣אבַד י֭וֹם אִוָּ֣לֶד בּ֑וֹ וְהַלַּ֥יְלָה אָ֝מַ֗ר הֹ֣רָה גָֽבֶר׃
Translated:
Perish the day on which I was born,
And the night it was announced,
“A male has been conceived!”
Transliteration: yovad yvom ivaled vvo vehalayelah amar horah gaver

Hebrew: הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֗וּא יְֽהִ֫י־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ אַֽל־יִדְרְשֵׁ֣הוּ אֱל֣וֹהַּ מִמַּ֑עַל וְאַל־תּוֹפַ֖ע עָלָ֣יו נְהָרָֽה׃
Translated:
May that day be darkness;
May God above have no concern for it;
May light not shine on it;
Transliteration: hayyvom hahu yehiy-choshekhe al-yidereshehu elvoha mimaal veal-tvofa alayv neharah

Hebrew: יִגְאָלֻ֡הוּ חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְ֭צַלְמָוֶת תִּשְׁכׇּן־עָלָ֣יו עֲנָנָ֑ה יְ֝בַעֲתֻ֗הוּ כִּֽמְרִ֥ירֵי יֽוֹם׃
Translated:
May darkness and deep gloom reclaim it;
May a pall lie over it;
May what blackens the day terrify it.
Transliteration: yigealuhu choshekhe vetsalemavet tishekhׇn-alayv ananah yevaatuhu khimeriyrey yvom

Hebrew: הַלַּ֥יְלָה הַהוּא֮ יִקָּחֵ֢ה֫וּ אֹ֥פֶל אַל־יִ֭חַדְּ בִּימֵ֣י שָׁנָ֑ה בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר יְ֝רָחִ֗ים אַל־יָבֹֽא׃
Translated:
May obscurity carry off that night;
May it not be counted among the days of the year;
May it not appear in any of its months;
Transliteration: halayelah hahu yikache֢hu ofel al-yichade viymey shanah vemisefar yerachiym al-yavo

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה הַלַּ֣יְלָה הַ֭הוּא יְהִ֣י גַלְמ֑וּד אַל־תָּב֖וֹא רְנָנָ֣ה בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
May that night be desolate;
May no sound of joy be heard in it;
Transliteration: hineh halayelah hahu yehiy galemud al-tavvo renanah vvo

Hebrew: יִקְּבֻ֥הוּ אֹֽרְרֵי־י֑וֹם הָ֝עֲתִידִ֗ים עֹרֵ֥ר לִוְיָתָֽן׃
Translated:
May those who cast spells upon the day damn it,
Those prepared to disable Leviathan;
Transliteration: yikevuhu orerey-yvom haatiydiym orer liveyatan

Hebrew: יֶחְשְׁכוּ֮ כּוֹכְבֵ֢י נִ֫שְׁפּ֥וֹ יְקַו־לְא֥וֹר וָאַ֑יִן וְאַל־יִ֝רְאֶ֗ה בְּעַפְעַפֵּי־שָֽׁחַר׃
Translated:
May its twilight stars remain dark;
May it hope for light and have none;
May it not see the glimmerings of the dawn—
Transliteration: yecheshekhu khvokheve֢y nishefvo yekav-levor vaayiin veal-yireeh veafeafey-shachar

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א סָ֭גַר דַּלְתֵ֣י בִטְנִ֑י וַיַּסְתֵּ֥ר עָ֝מָ֗ל מֵעֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
Because it did not block my mother’s womb,
And hide trouble from my eyes.
Transliteration: khiy lo sagar daletey viteniy vayaseter amal meeynay

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה לֹּ֣א מֵרֶ֣חֶם אָמ֑וּת מִבֶּ֖טֶן יָצָ֣אתִי וְאֶגְוָֽע׃
Translated:
Why did I not die at birth,
Expire as I came forth from the womb?
Transliteration: lamah lo merechem amut miveten yatsatiy veegeva

Hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ קִדְּמ֣וּנִי בִרְכָּ֑יִם וּמַה־שָּׁ֝דַ֗יִם כִּ֣י אִינָֽק׃
Translated:
Why were there knees to receive me,
Or breasts for me to suck?
Transliteration: madua kidemuniy virekhayiim umah-shadayiim khiy iynak

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה שָׁכַ֣בְתִּי וְאֶשְׁק֑וֹט יָ֝שַׁ֗נְתִּי אָ֤ז ׀ יָנ֬וּחַֽ לִֽי׃
Translated: For now would I be lying in repose, asleep and at rest,
Transliteration: khiy-atah shakhavetiy veeshekvot yashanetiy az yanucha liy

Hebrew: עִם־מְ֭לָכִים וְיֹ֣עֲצֵי אָ֑רֶץ הַבֹּנִ֖ים חֳרָב֣וֹת לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated: With the world’s kings and counselors who rebuild ruins for themselves,
Transliteration: im-melakhiym veyoatsey arets havoniym choravvot lamvo

Hebrew: א֣וֹ עִם־שָׂ֭רִים זָהָ֣ב לָהֶ֑ם הַֽמְמַלְאִ֖ים בָּתֵּיהֶ֣ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: Or with nobles who possess gold and who fill their houses with silver.
Transliteration: vo im-shariym zahav lahem hamemaleiym vateyhem khasef

Hebrew: א֤וֹ כְנֵ֣פֶל טָ֭מוּן לֹ֣א אֶהְיֶ֑ה כְּ֝עֹלְלִ֗ים לֹא־רָ֥אוּ אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Or why was I not like a buried stillbirth,
Like babies who never saw the light?
Transliteration: vo khenefel tamun lo eheyeh kheoleliym lo-rau vor

Hebrew: שָׁ֣ם רְ֭שָׁעִים חָ֣דְלוּ רֹ֑גֶז וְשָׁ֥ם יָ֝נ֗וּחוּ יְגִ֣יעֵי כֹֽחַ׃
Translated:
There the wicked cease from troubling;
There rest those whose strength is spent.
Transliteration: sham reshaiym chadelu rogez vesham yanuchu yegiyey khocha

Hebrew: יַ֭חַד אֲסִירִ֣ים שַׁאֲנָ֑נוּ לֹ֥א שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ ק֣וֹל נֹגֵֽשׂ׃
Translated:
Prisoners are wholly at ease;
They do not hear the taskmaster’s voice.
Transliteration: yachad asiyriym shaananu lo shameu kvol nogesh

Hebrew: קָטֹ֣ן וְ֭גָדוֹל שָׁ֣ם ה֑וּא וְ֝עֶ֗בֶד חׇפְשִׁ֥י מֵאֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated:
Small and great alike are there,
And the slave is free of his master.
Transliteration: katon vegadvol sham hu veeved chׇfeshiy meadonayv

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה יִתֵּ֣ן לְעָמֵ֣ל א֑וֹר וְ֝חַיִּ֗ים לְמָ֣רֵי נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Why does He give light to the sufferer
And life to the bitter in spirit;
Transliteration: lamah yiten leamel vor vechayiym lemarey nafesh

Hebrew: הַֽמְחַכִּ֣ים לַמָּ֣וֶת וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וַֽ֝יַּחְפְּרֻ֗הוּ מִמַּטְמוֹנִֽים׃
Translated:
To those who wait for death but it does not come,
Who search for it more than for treasure,
Transliteration: hamechakhiym lamavet veeynenu vayacheferuhu mimatemvoniym

Hebrew: הַשְּׂמֵחִ֥ים אֱלֵי־גִ֑יל יָ֝שִׂ֗ישׂוּ כִּ֣י יִמְצְאוּ־קָֽבֶר׃
Translated:
Who rejoice to exultation,
And are glad to reach the grave;
Transliteration: hashemechiym eley-giyl yashiyshu khiy yimetseu-kaver

Hebrew: לְ֭גֶבֶר אֲשֶׁר־דַּרְכּ֣וֹ נִסְתָּ֑רָה וַיָּ֖סֶךְ אֱל֣וֹהַּ בַּעֲדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
To the man who has lost his way,
Whom God has hedged about?
Transliteration: legever asher-darekhvo nisetarah vayasekhe elvoha vaadvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לִפְנֵ֣י לַ֭חְמִי אַנְחָתִ֣י תָבֹ֑א וַֽיִּתְּכ֥וּ כַ֝מַּ֗יִם שַׁאֲגֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
My groaning serves as my bread;
My roaring pours forth as water.
Transliteration: khiy-lifeney lachemiy anechatiy tavo vayitekhu khamayiim shaagotay

Hebrew: כִּ֤י פַ֣חַד פָּ֭חַדְתִּי וַיֶּאֱתָיֵ֑נִי וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָ֝גֹ֗רְתִּי יָ֣בֹא לִֽי׃
Translated:
For what I feared has overtaken me;
What I dreaded has come upon me.
Transliteration: khiy fachad fachadetiy vayeetaeiniy vaasher yagoretiy yavo liy

Hebrew: לֹ֤א שָׁלַ֨וְתִּי ׀ וְלֹ֖א שָׁקַ֥טְתִּי וְֽלֹא־נָ֗חְתִּי וַיָּ֥בֹא רֹֽגֶז׃ {פ}
Translated:
I had no repose, no quiet, no rest,
And trouble came.
Transliteration: lo shalavetiy velo shakatetiy velo-nachetiy vayavo rogez {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּימָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan eliyfaz hateymaniy vayomar

Hebrew: הֲנִסָּ֬ה דָבָ֣ר אֵלֶ֣יךָ תִּלְאֶ֑ה וַעְצֹ֥ר בְּ֝מִלִּ֗ין מִ֣י יוּכָֽל׃
Translated:
If one ventures a word with you, will it be too much?
But who can hold back his words?
Transliteration: hanisah davar eleykha tileeh vaetsor vemiliyn miy yukhal

Hebrew: הִ֭נֵּה יִסַּ֣רְתָּ רַבִּ֑ים וְיָדַ֖יִם רָפ֣וֹת תְּחַזֵּֽק׃
Translated:
See, you have encouraged many;
You have strengthened failing hands.
Transliteration: hineh yisareta raviym veyadayiim rafvot techazek

Hebrew: כּ֭וֹשֵׁל יְקִימ֣וּן מִלֶּ֑יךָ וּבִרְכַּ֖יִם כֹּרְע֣וֹת תְּאַמֵּֽץ׃
Translated:
Your words have kept him who stumbled from falling;
You have braced knees that gave way.
Transliteration: khvoshel yekiymun mileykha uvirekhayiim khorevot teamets

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עַתָּ֨ה ׀ תָּב֣וֹא אֵלֶ֣יךָ וַתֵּ֑לֶא תִּגַּ֥ע עָ֝דֶ֗יךָ וַתִּבָּהֵֽל׃
Translated:
But now that it overtakes you, it is too much;
It reaches you, and you are unnerved.
Transliteration: khiy atah tavvo eleykha vatele tiga adeykha vativahel

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א יִ֭רְאָתְךָ כִּסְלָתֶ֑ךָ תִּ֝קְוָתְךָ֗ וְתֹ֣ם דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Is not your piety your confidence,
Your integrity your hope?
Transliteration: halo yireatekha khiselatekha tikevatekha vetom derakheykha

Hebrew: זְכׇר־נָ֗א מִ֤י ה֣וּא נָקִ֣י אָבָ֑ד וְ֝אֵיפֹ֗ה יְשָׁרִ֥ים נִכְחָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Think now, what innocent man ever perished?
Where have the upright been destroyed?
Transliteration: zekhׇr-na miy hu nakiy avad veeyfoh yeshariym nikhechadu

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָ֭אִיתִי חֹ֣רְשֵׁי אָ֑וֶן וְזֹרְעֵ֖י עָמָ֣ל יִקְצְרֻֽהוּ׃
Translated:
As I have seen, those who plow evil
And sow mischief reap them.
Transliteration: khaasher raiytiy choreshey aven vezoreey amal yiketseruhu

Hebrew: מִנִּשְׁמַ֣ת אֱל֣וֹהַּ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ וּמֵר֖וּחַ אַפּ֣וֹ יִכְלֽוּ׃
Translated:
They perish by a blast from God,
Are gone at the breath of His nostrils.
Transliteration: minishemat elvoha yovedu umerucha afvo yikhelu

Hebrew: שַׁאֲגַ֣ת אַ֭רְיֵה וְק֣וֹל שָׁ֑חַל וְשִׁנֵּ֖י כְפִירִ֣ים נִתָּֽעוּ׃
Translated:
The lion may roar, the cub may howl,
But the teeth of the king of beasts are broken.
Transliteration: shaagat areeih vekvol shachal veshiney khefiyriym nitau

Hebrew: לַ֭יִשׁ אֹבֵ֣ד מִבְּלִי־טָ֑רֶף וּבְנֵ֥י לָ֝בִ֗יא יִתְפָּרָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
The lion perishes for lack of prey,
And its whelps are scattered.
Transliteration: layiish oved miveliy-taref uveney laviy yitefaradu

Hebrew: וְ֭אֵלַי דָּבָ֣ר יְגֻנָּ֑ב וַתִּקַּ֥ח אׇ֝זְנִ֗י שֵׁ֣מֶץ מֶֽנְהֽוּ׃
Translated:
A word came to me in stealth;
My ear caught a whisper of it.
Transliteration: veelay davar yegunav vatikach ׇzeniy shemets menehu

Hebrew: בִּ֭שְׂעִפִּים מֵחֶזְיֹנ֣וֹת לָ֑יְלָה בִּנְפֹ֥ל תַּ֝רְדֵּמָ֗ה עַל־אֲנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
In thought-filled visions of the night,
When deep sleep falls on men,
Transliteration: visheifiym mechezeyonvot layelah vinefol taredemah al-anashiym

Hebrew: פַּ֣חַד קְ֭רָאַנִי וּרְעָדָ֑ה וְרֹ֖ב עַצְמוֹתַ֣י הִפְחִֽיד׃
Translated:
Fear and trembling came upon me,
Causing all my bones to quake with fright.
Transliteration: fachad keraaniy ureadah verov atsemvotay hifechiyd

Hebrew: וְ֭רוּחַ עַל־פָּנַ֣י יַחֲלֹ֑ף תְּ֝סַמֵּ֗ר שַׂעֲרַ֥ת בְּשָׂרִֽי׃
Translated:
A wind passed by me,
Making the hair of my flesh bristle.
Transliteration: verucha al-fanay yachalof tesamer shaarat veshariy

Hebrew: יַעֲמֹ֤ד ׀ וְֽלֹא־אַכִּ֬יר מַרְאֵ֗הוּ תְּ֭מוּנָה לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָ֑י דְּמָמָ֖ה וָק֣וֹל אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
It halted; its appearance was strange to me;
A form loomed before my eyes;
I heard a murmur, a voice,
Transliteration: yaamod velo-akhiyr mareehu temunah leneged eynay demamah vakvol eshema

Hebrew: הַ֭אֱנוֹשׁ מֵאֱל֣וֹהַּ יִצְדָּ֑ק אִ֥ם מֵ֝עֹשֵׂ֗הוּ יִטְהַר־גָּֽבֶר׃
Translated:
“Can mortals be acquitted by God?
Can man be cleared by his Maker?
Transliteration: haenvosh meelvoha yitsedak im meoshehu yitehar-gaver

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן בַּ֭עֲבָדָיו לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ין וּ֝בְמַלְאָכָ֗יו יָשִׂ֥ים תׇּהֳלָֽה׃
Translated:
If He cannot trust His own servants,
And casts reproach on His angels,
Transliteration: hen vaavadayv lo yaamiyn uvemaleakhayv yashiym tׇholah

Hebrew: אַ֤ף ׀ שֹׁכְנֵ֬י בָֽתֵּי־חֹ֗מֶר אֲשֶׁר־בֶּעָפָ֥ר יְסוֹדָ֑ם יְ֝דַכְּא֗וּם לִפְנֵי־עָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
How much less those who dwell in houses of clay,
Whose origin is dust,
Who are crushed like the moth,
Transliteration: af shokheney vatey-chomer asher-veafar yesvodam yedakheum lifeney-ash

Hebrew: מִבֹּ֣קֶר לָעֶ֣רֶב יֻכַּ֑תּוּ מִבְּלִ֥י מֵ֝שִׂ֗ים לָנֶ֥צַח יֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Shattered between daybreak and evening,
Perishing forever, unnoticed.
Transliteration: mivoker laerev yukhatu miveliy meshiym lanetsach yovedu

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־נִסַּ֣ע יִתְרָ֣ם בָּ֑ם יָ֝מ֗וּתוּ וְלֹ֣א בְחׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Their cord is pulled up
And they die, and not with wisdom.”
Transliteration: halo-nisa yiteram vam yamutu velo vechׇkhemah

Hebrew: קְֽרָא־נָ֭א הֲיֵ֣שׁ עוֹנֶ֑ךָּ וְאֶל־מִ֖י מִקְּדֹשִׁ֣ים תִּפְנֶֽה׃
Translated:
Call now! Will anyone answer you?
To whom among the holy beings will you turn?
Transliteration: kera-na haeish vonekha veel-miy mikedoshiym tifeneh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לֶ֭אֱוִיל יַהֲרׇג־כָּ֑עַשׂ וּ֝פֹתֶ֗ה תָּמִ֥ית קִנְאָֽה׃
Translated:
Vexation kills the fool;
Passion slays the simpleton.
Transliteration: khiy-leeviyl yaharׇg-khaash ufoteh tamiyt kineah

Hebrew: אֲֽנִי־רָ֭אִיתִי אֱוִ֣יל מַשְׁרִ֑ישׁ וָאֶקּ֖וֹב נָוֵ֣הוּ פִתְאֹֽם׃
Translated:
I myself saw a fool who had struck roots;
Impulsively, I cursed his home:
Transliteration: aniy-raiytiy eviyl masheriysh vaekvov navehu fiteom

Hebrew: יִרְחֲק֣וּ בָנָ֣יו מִיֶּ֑שַׁע וְיִֽדַּכְּא֥וּ בַ֝שַּׁ֗עַר וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
May his children be far from success;
May they be oppressed in the gate with none to deliver them;
Transliteration: yirechaku vanayv miyesha veyidakheu vashaar veeyn matsiyl

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר קְצִיר֨וֹ ׀ רָ֘עֵ֤ב יֹאכֵ֗ל וְאֶֽל־מִצִּנִּ֥ים יִקָּחֵ֑הוּ וְשָׁאַ֖ף צַמִּ֣ים חֵילָֽם׃
Translated:
May the hungry devour his harvest,
Carrying it off in baskets;
May the thirsty swallow their wealth.
Transliteration: asher ketsiyrvo raev yokhel veel-mitsiniym yikachehu veshaaf tsamiym cheylam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־יֵצֵ֣א מֵעָפָ֣ר אָ֑וֶן וּ֝מֵאֲדָמָ֗ה לֹא־יִצְמַ֥ח עָמָֽל׃
Translated:
Evil does not grow out of the soil,
Nor does mischief spring from the ground;
Transliteration: khiy lo-eitse meafar aven umeadamah lo-yitsemach amal

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָ֭דָם לְעָמָ֣ל יוּלָּ֑ד וּבְנֵי־רֶ֝֗שֶׁף יַגְבִּ֥יהוּ עֽוּף׃
Translated:
For man is born to [do] mischief,
Just as sparks fly upward.
Transliteration: khiy-adam leamal yulad uveney-reshef yageviyhu uf

Hebrew: אוּלָ֗ם אֲ֭נִי אֶדְרֹ֣שׁ אֶל־אֵ֑ל וְאֶל־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים אָשִׂ֥ים דִּבְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
But I would resort to God;
I would lay my case before God,
Transliteration: ulam aniy ederosh el-el veel-Elohimm ashiym diveratiy

Hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֣ה גְ֭דֹלוֹת וְאֵ֣ין חֵ֑קֶר נִ֝פְלָא֗וֹת עַד־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
Who performs great deeds which cannot be fathomed,
Wondrous things without number;
Transliteration: osheh gedolvot veeyn cheker nifelavot ad-eyn misefar

Hebrew: הַנֹּתֵ֣ן מָ֭טָר עַל־פְּנֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְשֹׁ֥לֵֽחַ מַ֝֗יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י חוּצֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Who gives rain to the earth,
And sends water over the fields;
Transliteration: hanoten matar al-feney-arets vesholecha mayiyim al-feney chutsvot

Hebrew: לָשׂ֣וּם שְׁפָלִ֣ים לְמָר֑וֹם וְ֝קֹדְרִ֗ים שָׂ֣גְבוּ יֶֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
Who raises the lowly up high,
So that the dejected are secure in victory;
Transliteration: lashum shefaliym lemarvom vekoderiym shagevu yesha

Hebrew: מֵ֭פֵר מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת עֲרוּמִ֑ים וְֽלֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֥נָה יְ֝דֵיהֶ֗ם תֻּֽשִׁיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Who thwarts the designs of the crafty,
So that their hands cannot gain success;
Transliteration: mefer macheshevvot arumiym velo-taashenah yedeyhem tushiyah

Hebrew: לֹכֵ֣ד חֲכָמִ֣ים בְּעׇרְמָ֑ם וַעֲצַ֖ת נִפְתָּלִ֣ים נִמְהָֽרָה׃
Translated:
Who traps the clever in their own wiles;
The plans of the crafty go awry.
Transliteration: lokhed chakhamiym veׇremam vaatsat nifetaliym nimeharah

Hebrew: יוֹמָ֥ם יְפַגְּשׁוּ־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וְ֝כַלַּ֗יְלָה יְֽמַשְׁשׁ֥וּ בַֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
By day they encounter darkness,
At noon they grope as in the night.
Transliteration: yvomam yefageshu-choshekhe vekhalayelah yemasheshu vatsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣שַׁע מֵ֭חֶרֶב מִפִּיהֶ֑ם וּמִיַּ֖ד חָזָ֣ק אֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
But He saves the needy from the sword of their mouth,
From the clutches of the strong.
Transliteration: vayosha mecherev mifiyhem umiyad chazak eveyvon

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֣י לַדַּ֣ל תִּקְוָ֑ה וְ֝עֹלָ֗תָה קָ֣פְצָה פִּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
So there is hope for the wretched;
The mouth of wrongdoing is stopped.
Transliteration: vatehiy ladal tikevah veolatah kafetsah fiyha

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה אַשְׁרֵ֣י אֱ֭נוֹשׁ יוֹכִחֶ֣נּוּ אֱל֑וֹהַּ וּמוּסַ֥ר שַׁ֝דַּ֗י אַל־תִּמְאָֽס׃
Translated:
See how happy is the man whom God reproves;
Do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.
Transliteration: hineh asherey envosh yvokhichenu elvoha umusar shaday al-timeas

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ה֣וּא יַכְאִ֣יב וְיֶחְבָּ֑שׁ יִ֝מְחַ֗ץ וְיָדָ֥ו תִּרְפֶּֽינָה׃
Translated:
He injures, but He binds up;
He wounds, but His hands heal.
Transliteration: khiy hu yakheiyv veyechevash yimechats veyadav tirefeynah

Hebrew: בְּשֵׁ֣שׁ צָ֭רוֹת יַצִּילֶ֑ךָּ וּבְשֶׁ֓בַע ׀ לֹֽא־יִגַּ֖ע בְּךָ֣ רָֽע׃
Translated:
He will deliver you from six troubles;
In seven no harm will reach you:
Transliteration: veshesh tsarvot yatsiylekha uvesheva lo-yiga vekha ra

Hebrew: בְּֽ֭רָעָב פָּדְךָ֣ מִמָּ֑וֶת וּ֝בְמִלְחָמָ֗ה מִ֣ידֵי חָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
In famine He will redeem you from death,
In war, from the sword.
Transliteration: veraav fadekha mimavet uvemilechamah miydey charev

Hebrew: בְּשׁ֣וֹט לָ֭שׁוֹן תֵּחָבֵ֑א וְֽלֹא־תִירָ֥א מִ֝שֹּׁ֗ד כִּ֣י יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
You will be sheltered from the scourging tongue;
You will have no fear when violence comes.
Transliteration: veshvot lashvon techave velo-tiyra mishod khiy yavvo

Hebrew: לְשֹׁ֣ד וּלְכָפָ֣ן תִּשְׂחָ֑ק וּֽמֵחַיַּ֥ת הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ אַל־תִּירָֽא׃
Translated:
You will laugh at violence and starvation,
And have no fear of wild beasts.
Transliteration: leshod ulekhafan tishechak umechayat haarets al-tiyra

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עִם־אַבְנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֣ה בְרִיתֶ֑ךָ וְחַיַּ֥ת הַ֝שָּׂדֶ֗ה הׇשְׁלְמָה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
For you will have a pact with the rocks in the field,
And the beasts of the field will be your allies.
Transliteration: khiy im-aveney hashadeh veriytekha vechayat hashadeh hׇshelemah-lakhe

Hebrew: וְֽ֭יָדַעְתָּ כִּֽי־שָׁל֣וֹם אׇהֳלֶ֑ךָ וּֽפָקַדְתָּ֥ נָ֝וְךָ֗ וְלֹ֣א תֶחֱטָֽא׃
Translated:
You will know that all is well in your tent;
When you visit your wife you will never fail.
Transliteration: veyadaeta khiy-shalvom ׇholekha ufakadeta navekha velo techeta

Hebrew: וְֽ֭יָדַעְתָּ כִּֽי־רַ֣ב זַרְעֶ֑ךָ וְ֝צֶאֱצָאֶ֗יךָ כְּעֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You will see that your offspring are many,
Your descendants like the grass of the earth.
Transliteration: veyadaeta khiy-rav zareekha vetseetsaeykha kheeshev haarets

Hebrew: תָּב֣וֹא בְכֶ֣לַח אֱלֵי־קָ֑בֶר כַּעֲל֖וֹת גָּדִ֣ישׁ בְּעִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
You will come to the grave in ripe old age,
As shocks of grain are taken away in their season.
Transliteration: tavvo vekhelach eley-kaver khaalvot gadiysh veitvo

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־זֹ֖את חֲקַרְנ֥וּהָ כֶּֽן־הִ֑יא שְׁ֝מָעֶ֗נָּה וְאַתָּ֥ה דַֽע־לָֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
See, we have inquired into this and it is so;
Hear it and accept it.
Transliteration: hineh-zot chakarenuha khen-hiy shemaenah veatah da-lakhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: ל֗וּ שָׁק֣וֹל יִשָּׁקֵ֣ל כַּעְשִׂ֑י (והיתי) [וְ֝הַוָּתִ֗י] בְּֽמֹאזְנַ֥יִם יִשְׂאוּ־יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
If my anguish were weighed,
My full calamity laid on the scales,
Transliteration: lu shakvol yishakel khaeshiy (vhyty) [vehavatiy] vemozenayiim yisheu-yachad

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עַתָּ֗ה מֵח֣וֹל יַמִּ֣ים יִכְבָּ֑ד עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן דְּבָרַ֥י לָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
It would be heavier than the sand of the sea;
That is why I spoke recklessly.
Transliteration: khiy-atah mechvol yamiym yikhevad al-khen devaray lau

Hebrew: כִּ֤י חִצֵּ֪י שַׁדַּ֡י עִמָּדִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֲ֭מָתָם שֹׁתָ֣ה רוּחִ֑י בִּעוּתֵ֖י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יַעַרְכֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
For the arrows of the Almighty are in me;
My spirit absorbs their poison;
God’s terrors are arrayed against me.
Transliteration: khiy chitsey shaday imadiy asher chamatam shotah ruchiy viutey elvoha yaarekhuniy

Hebrew: הֲיִֽנְהַק־פֶּ֥רֶא עֲלֵי־דֶ֑שֶׁא אִ֥ם יִגְעֶה־שּׁ֝֗וֹר עַל־בְּלִילֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Does a wild ass bray when he has grass?
Does a bull bellow over his fodder?
Transliteration: hayinehak-fere aley-deshe im yigeeh-shvor al-veliylvo

Hebrew: הֲיֵאָכֵ֣ל תָּ֭פֵל מִבְּלִי־מֶ֑לַח אִם־יֶשׁ־טַ֝֗עַם בְּרִ֣יר חַלָּמֽוּת׃
Translated:
Can what is tasteless be eaten without salt?
Does mallow juice have any flavor?
Transliteration: haeiakhel tafel miveliy-melach im-yesh-taam veriyr chalamut

Hebrew: מֵאֲנָ֣ה לִנְגּ֣וֹעַ נַפְשִׁ֑י הֵ֝֗מָּה כִּדְוֵ֥י לַחְמִֽי׃
Translated:
I refuse to touch them;
They are like food when I am sick.
Transliteration: meanah linegvoa nafeshiy hemah khidevey lachemiy

Hebrew: מִֽי־יִ֭תֵּן תָּב֣וֹא שֶׁאֱלָתִ֑י וְ֝תִקְוָתִ֗י יִתֵּ֥ן אֱלֽוֹהַּ׃
Translated:
Would that my request were granted,
That God gave me what I wished for;
Transliteration: miy-yiten tavvo sheelatiy vetikevatiy yiten elvoha

Hebrew: וְיֹאֵ֣ל אֱ֭לוֹהַּ וִידַכְּאֵ֑נִי יַתֵּ֥ר יָ֝ד֗וֹ וִיבַצְּעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Would that God consented to crush me,
Loosed His hand and cut me off.
Transliteration: veyoel elvoha viydakheeniy yater yadvo viyvatseeniy

Hebrew: וּ֥תְהִי־ע֨וֹד ׀ נֶ֘חָ֤מָתִ֗י וַאֲסַלְּדָ֣ה בְ֭חִילָה לֹ֣א יַחְמ֑וֹל כִּי־לֹ֥א כִ֝חַ֗דְתִּי אִמְרֵ֥י קָדֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
Then this would be my consolation,
As I writhed in unsparing pains:
That I did not suppress my words against the Holy One.
Transliteration: utehiy-vod nechamatiy vaasaledah vechiylah lo yachemvol khiy-lo khichadetiy imerey kadvosh

Hebrew: מַה־כֹּחִ֥י כִֽי־אֲיַחֵ֑ל וּמַה־קִּ֝צִּ֗י כִּֽי־אַאֲרִ֥יךְ נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
What strength have I, that I should endure?
How long have I to live, that I should be patient?
Transliteration: mah-khochiy khiy-ayachel umah-kitsiy khiy-aariykhe nafeshiy

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֣חַ אֲבָנִ֣ים כֹּחִ֑י אִֽם־בְּשָׂרִ֥י נָחֽוּשׁ׃
Translated:
Is my strength the strength of rock?
Is my flesh bronze?
Transliteration: im-khocha avaniym khochiy im-veshariy nachush

Hebrew: הַאִ֬ם אֵ֣ין עֶזְרָתִ֣י בִ֑י וְ֝תֻשִׁיָּ֗ה נִדְּחָ֥ה מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Truly, I cannot help myself;
I have been deprived of resourcefulness.
Transliteration: haim eyn ezeratiy viy vetushiyah nidechah mimeniy

Hebrew: לַמָּ֣ס מֵרֵעֵ֣הוּ חָ֑סֶד וְיִרְאַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י יַעֲזֽוֹב׃
Translated:
A friend owes loyalty to one who fails,
Though he forsakes the fear of the Almighty;
Transliteration: lamas mereehu chased veyireat shaday yaazvov

Hebrew: אַ֭חַי בָּגְד֣וּ כְמוֹ־נָ֑חַל כַּאֲפִ֖יק נְחָלִ֣ים יַעֲבֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
My comrades are fickle, like a wadi,
Like a bed on which streams once ran.
Transliteration: achay vagedu khemvo-nachal khaafiyk nechaliym yaavoru

Hebrew: הַקֹּדְרִ֥ים מִנִּי־קָ֑רַח עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ יִתְעַלֶּם־שָֽׁלֶג׃
Translated:
They are dark with ice;
Snow obscures them;
Transliteration: hakoderiym miniy-karach aleymvo yitealem-shaleg

Hebrew: בְּעֵ֣ת יְזֹרְב֣וּ נִצְמָ֑תוּ בְּ֝חֻמּ֗וֹ נִדְעֲכ֥וּ מִמְּקוֹמָֽם׃
Translated:
But when they thaw, they vanish;
In the heat, they disappear where they are.
Transliteration: veet yezorevu nitsematu vechumvo nideakhu mimekvomam

Hebrew: יִ֭לָּ֣פְתוּ אׇרְח֣וֹת דַּרְכָּ֑ם יַעֲל֖וּ בַתֹּ֣הוּ וְיֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Their course twists and turns;
They run into the desert and perish.
Transliteration: yilafetu ׇrechvot darekham yaalu vatohu veyovedu

Hebrew: הִ֭בִּיטוּ אׇרְח֣וֹת תֵּמָ֑א הֲלִיכֹ֥ת שְׁ֝בָ֗א קִוּוּ־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Caravans from Tema look to them;
Processions from Sheba count on them.
Transliteration: hiviytu ׇrechvot tema haliykhot sheva kiuu-lamvo

Hebrew: בֹּ֥שׁוּ כִֽי־בָטָ֑ח בָּ֥אוּ עָ֝דֶ֗יהָ וַיֶּחְפָּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
They are disappointed in their hopes;
When they reach the place, they stand aghast.
Transliteration: voshu khiy-vatach vau adeyha vayechefaru

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה הֱיִ֣יתֶם לֹ֑א תִּֽרְא֥וּ חֲ֝תַ֗ת וַתִּירָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
So you are as nothing:
At the sight of misfortune, you take fright.
Transliteration: khiy-atah heyiytem lo tireu chatat vatiyrau

Hebrew: הֲֽכִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי הָ֣בוּ לִ֑י וּ֝מִכֹּחֲכֶ֗ם שִׁחֲד֥וּ בַעֲדִֽי׃
Translated:
Did I say to you, “I need your gift;
Pay a bribe for me out of your wealth;
Transliteration: hakhiy-amaretiy havu liy umikhochakhem shichadu vaadiy

Hebrew: וּמַלְּט֥וּנִי מִיַּד־צָ֑ר וּמִיַּ֖ד עָרִיצִ֣ים תִּפְדּֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
Deliver me from the clutches of my enemy;
Redeem me from violent men”?
Transliteration: umaletuniy miyad-tsar umiyad ariytsiym tifeduniy

Hebrew: ה֭וֹרוּנִי וַאֲנִ֣י אַחֲרִ֑ישׁ וּמַה־שָּׁ֝גִ֗יתִי הָבִ֥ינוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
Teach me; I shall be silent;
Tell me where I am wrong.
Transliteration: hvoruniy vaaniy achariysh umah-shagiytiy haviynu liy

Hebrew: מַה־נִּמְרְצ֥וּ אִמְרֵי־יֹ֑שֶׁר וּמַה־יּוֹכִ֖יחַ הוֹכֵ֣חַ מִכֶּֽם׃
Translated:
How trenchant honest words are;
But what sort of reproof comes from you?
Transliteration: mah-nimeretsu imerey-yosher umah-yyvokhiycha hvokhecha mikhem

Hebrew: הַלְהוֹכַ֣ח מִלִּ֣ים תַּחְשֹׁ֑בוּ וּ֝לְר֗וּחַ אִמְרֵ֥י נֹאָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Do you devise words of reproof,
But count a hopeless man’s words as wind?
Transliteration: halehvokhach miliym tacheshovu ulerucha imerey noash

Hebrew: אַף־עַל־יָת֥וֹם תַּפִּ֑ילוּ וְ֝תִכְר֗וּ עַֽל־רֵיעֲכֶֽם׃
Translated:
You would even cast lots over an orphan,
Or barter away your friend.
Transliteration: af-al-yatvom tafiylu vetikheru al-reyakhem

Hebrew: וְ֭עַתָּה הוֹאִ֣ילוּ פְנוּ־בִ֑י וְעַל־פְּ֝נֵיכֶ֗ם אִם־אֲכַזֵּֽב׃
Translated:
Now be so good as to face me;
I will not lie to your face.
Transliteration: veatah hvoiylu fenu-viy veal-feneykhem im-akhazev

Hebrew: שֽׁוּבוּ־נָ֭א אַל־תְּהִ֣י עַוְלָ֑ה (ושבי) [וְשׁ֥וּבוּ] ע֝֗וֹד צִדְקִי־בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Relent! Let there not be injustice;
Relent! I am still in the right.
Transliteration: shuvu-na al-tehiy avelah (vshvy) [veshuvu] vod tsidekiy-vah

Hebrew: הֲיֵשׁ־בִּלְשׁוֹנִ֥י עַוְלָ֑ה אִם־חִ֝כִּ֗י לֹא־יָבִ֥ין הַוּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Is injustice on my tongue?
Can my palate not discern evil?
Transliteration: haeish-vileshvoniy avelah im-chikhiy lo-yaviyn hauvot

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־צָבָ֣א לֶֽאֱנ֣וֹשׁ (על) [עֲלֵי־]אָ֑רֶץ וְכִימֵ֖י שָׂכִ֣יר יָמָֽיו׃
Translated:
Truly man has a term of service on earth;
His days are like those of a hireling—
Transliteration: halo-tsava leenvosh (l) [aley-]arets vekhiymey shakhiyr yamayv

Hebrew: כְּעֶ֥בֶד יִשְׁאַף־צֵ֑ל וּ֝כְשָׂכִ֗יר יְקַוֶּ֥ה פׇעֳלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Like a slave who longs for [evening’s] shadows,
Like a hireling who waits for his wage.
Transliteration: kheeved yisheaf-tsel ukheshakhiyr yekaveh fׇolvo

Hebrew: כֵּ֤ן הׇנְחַ֣לְתִּי לִ֭י יַרְחֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וְלֵיל֥וֹת עָ֝מָ֗ל מִנּוּ־לִֽי׃
Translated:
So have I been allotted months of futility;
Nights of misery have been apportioned to me.
Transliteration: khen hׇnechaletiy liy yarechey-shave veleylvot amal minu-liy

Hebrew: אִם־שָׁכַ֗בְתִּי וְאָמַ֗רְתִּי מָתַ֣י אָ֭קוּם וּמִדַּד־עָ֑רֶב וְשָׂבַ֖עְתִּי נְדֻדִ֣ים עֲדֵי־נָֽשֶׁף׃
Translated:
When I lie down, I think,
“When shall I rise?”
Night drags on,
And I am sated with tossings till morning twilight.
Transliteration: im-shakhavetiy veamaretiy matay akum umidad-arev veshavaetiy nedudiym adey-nashef

Hebrew: לָ֘בַ֤שׁ בְּשָׂרִ֣י רִ֭מָּה (וגיש) [וְג֣וּשׁ] עָפָ֑ר עוֹרִ֥י רָ֝גַ֗ע וַיִּמָּאֵֽס׃
Translated:
My flesh is covered with maggots and clods of earth;
My skin is broken and festering.
Transliteration: lavash veshariy rimah (vgysh) [vegush] afar voriy raga vayimaes

Hebrew: יָמַ֣י קַ֭לּוּ מִנִּי־אָ֑רֶג וַ֝יִּכְל֗וּ בְּאֶ֣פֶס תִּקְוָֽה׃
Translated:
My days fly faster than a weaver’s shuttle,
And come to their end without hope.
Transliteration: yamay kalu miniy-areg vayikhelu veefes tikevah

Hebrew: זְ֭כֹר כִּי־ר֣וּחַ חַיָּ֑י לֹא־תָשׁ֥וּב עֵ֝ינִ֗י לִרְא֥וֹת טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Consider that my life is but wind;
I shall never see happiness again.
Transliteration: zekhor khiy-rucha chayay lo-tashuv eyniy lirevot tvov

Hebrew: לֹא־תְ֭שׁוּרֵנִי עֵ֣ין רֹ֑אִי עֵינֶ֖יךָ בִּ֣י וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃
Translated:
The eye that gazes on me will not see me;
Your eye will seek me, but I shall be gone.
Transliteration: lo-teshureniy eyn roiy eyneykha viy veeyneniy

Hebrew: כָּלָ֣ה עָ֭נָן וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ כֵּ֥ן יוֹרֵ֥ד שְׁ֝א֗וֹל לֹ֣א יַעֲלֶֽה׃
Translated:
As a cloud fades away,
So whoever goes down to Sheol does not come up;
Transliteration: khalah anan vayelakhe khen yvored shevol lo yaaleh

Hebrew: לֹא־יָשׁ֣וּב ע֣וֹד לְבֵית֑וֹ וְלֹא־יַכִּירֶ֖נּוּ ע֣וֹד מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He returns no more to his home;
His place does not know him.
Transliteration: lo-yashuv vod leveytvo velo-yakhiyrenu vod mekomvo

Hebrew: גַּם־אֲנִי֮ לֹ֤א אֶחֱשׇׂ֫ךְ־פִּ֥י אֲֽ֭דַבְּרָה בְּצַ֣ר רוּחִ֑י אָ֝שִׂ֗יחָה בְּמַ֣ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
On my part, I will not speak with restraint;
I will give voice to the anguish of my spirit;
I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Transliteration: gam-aniy lo echeshׇkhe-fiy adaverah vetsar ruchiy ashiychah vemar nafeshiy

Hebrew: הֲֽיָם־אָ֭נִי אִם־תַּנִּ֑ין כִּֽי־תָשִׂ֖ים עָלַ֣י מִשְׁמָֽר׃
Translated:
Am I the sea or the Dragon,
That You have set a watch over me?
Transliteration: hayam-aniy im-taniyn khiy-tashiym alay mishemar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי תְּנַחֲמֵ֣נִי עַרְשִׂ֑י יִשָּׂ֥א בְ֝שִׂיחִ֗י מִשְׁכָּבִֽי׃
Translated:
When I think, “My bed will comfort me,
My couch will share my sorrow,”
Transliteration: khiy-amaretiy tenachameniy areshiy yisha veshiychiy mishekhaviy

Hebrew: וְחִתַּתַּ֥נִי בַחֲלֹמ֑וֹת וּֽמֵחֶזְיֹנ֥וֹת תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃
Translated:
You frighten me with dreams,
And terrify me with visions,
Transliteration: vechitataniy vachalomvot umechezeyonvot tevaataniy

Hebrew: וַתִּבְחַ֣ר מַחֲנָ֣ק נַפְשִׁ֑י מָ֝֗וֶת מֵעַצְמוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
Till I prefer strangulation,
Death, to my wasted frame.
Transliteration: vativechar machanak nafeshiy mavet meatsemvotay

Hebrew: מָ֭אַסְתִּי לֹא־לְעֹלָ֣ם אֶחְיֶ֑ה חֲדַ֥ל מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי כִּי־הֶ֥בֶל יָמָֽי׃
Translated:
I am sick of it.
I shall not live forever;
Let me be, for my days are a breath.
Transliteration: maasetiy lo-leolam echeyeh chadal mimeniy khiy-hevel yamay

Hebrew: מָֽה־אֱ֭נוֹשׁ כִּ֣י תְגַדְּלֶ֑נּוּ וְכִֽי־תָשִׁ֖ית אֵלָ֣יו לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
What is man, that You make much of him,
That You fix Your attention upon him?
Transliteration: mah-envosh khiy tegadelenu vekhiy-tashiyt elayv livekha

Hebrew: וַתִּפְקְדֶ֥נּוּ לִבְקָרִ֑ים לִ֝רְגָעִ֗ים תִּבְחָנֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
You inspect him every morning,
Examine him every minute.
Transliteration: vatifekedenu livekariym liregaiym tivechanenu

Hebrew: כַּ֭מָּה לֹא־תִשְׁעֶ֣ה מִמֶּ֑נִּי לֹֽא־תַ֝רְפֵּ֗נִי עַד־בִּלְעִ֥י רֻקִּֽי׃
Translated:
Will You not look away from me for a while,
Let me be, till I swallow my spittle?
Transliteration: khamah lo-tisheeh mimeniy lo-tarefeniy ad-vileiy rukiy

Hebrew: חָטָ֡אתִי מָ֤ה אֶפְעַ֨ל ׀ לָךְ֮ נֹצֵ֢ר הָ֫אָדָ֥ם לָ֤מָה שַׂמְתַּ֣נִי לְמִפְגָּ֣ע לָ֑ךְ וָאֶהְיֶ֖ה עָלַ֣י לְמַשָּֽׂא׃
Translated:
If I have sinned, what have I done to You,
Watcher of men?
Why make of me Your target,
And a burden to myself?
Transliteration: chatatiy mah efeal lakhe notse֢r haadam lamah shametaniy lemifega lakhe vaeheyeh alay lemasha

Hebrew: וּמֶ֤ה ׀ לֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א פִשְׁעִי֮ וְתַעֲבִ֢יר אֶת־עֲוֺ֫נִ֥י כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה לֶעָפָ֣ר אֶשְׁכָּ֑ב וְשִׁ֖חַרְתַּ֣נִי וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Why do You not pardon my transgression
And forgive my iniquity?
For soon I shall lie down in the dust;
When You seek me, I shall be gone.
Transliteration: umeh lo-tisha fisheiy vetaavi֢yr et-avoniy khiy-atah leafar eshekhav veshicharetaniy veeyneniy {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשּׁוּחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan viledad hashuchiy vayomar

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֥ן תְּמַלֶּל־אֵ֑לֶּה וְר֥וּחַ כַּ֝בִּ֗יר אִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
How long will you speak such things?
Your utterances are a mighty wind!
Transliteration: ad-an temalel-eleh verucha khaviyr imerey-fiykha

Hebrew: הַ֭אֵל יְעַוֵּ֣ת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְאִם־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י יְעַוֵּת־צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
Will God pervert the right?
Will the Almighty pervert justice?
Transliteration: hael yeavet mishefat veim-shaday yeavet-tsedek

Hebrew: אִם־בָּנֶ֥יךָ חָֽטְאוּ־ל֑וֹ וַֽ֝יְשַׁלְּחֵ֗ם בְּיַד־פִּשְׁעָֽם׃
Translated:
If your sons sinned against Him,
He dispatched them for their transgression.
Transliteration: im-vaneykha chateu-lvo vayeshalechem veyad-fisheam

Hebrew: אִם־אַ֭תָּה תְּשַׁחֵ֣ר אֶל־אֵ֑ל וְאֶל־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י תִּתְחַנָּֽן׃
Translated:
But if you seek God
And supplicate the Almighty,
Transliteration: im-atah teshacher el-el veel-shaday titechanan

Hebrew: אִם־זַ֥ךְ וְיָשָׁ֗ר אָ֥֫תָּה כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה יָעִ֣יר עָלֶ֑יךָ וְ֝שִׁלַּ֗ם נְוַ֣ת צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
If you are blameless and upright,
He will protect you,
And grant well-being to your righteous home.
Transliteration: im-zakhe veyashar atah khiy-atah yaiyr aleykha veshilam nevat tsidekekha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה רֵאשִׁיתְךָ֣ מִצְעָ֑ר וְ֝אַחֲרִֽיתְךָ֗ יִשְׂגֶּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
Though your beginning be small,
In the end you will grow very great.
Transliteration: vehayah reshiytekha mitsear veachariytekha yishegeh meod

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שְׁאַל־נָ֭א לְדֹ֣ר רִישׁ֑וֹן וְ֝כוֹנֵ֗ן לְחֵ֣קֶר אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Ask the generation past,
Study what their fathers have searched out—
Transliteration: khiy-sheal-na ledor riyshvon vekhvonen lecheker avvotam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תְמ֣וֹל אֲ֭נַחְנוּ וְלֹ֣א נֵדָ֑ע כִּ֤י צֵ֖ל יָמֵ֣ינוּ עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For we are of yesterday and know nothing;
Our days on earth are a shadow—
Transliteration: khiy-temvol anachenu velo neda khiy tsel yameynu aley-arets

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם י֭וֹרוּךָ יֹ֣אמְרוּ לָ֑ךְ וּ֝מִלִּבָּ֗ם יוֹצִ֥אוּ מִלִּֽים׃
Translated:
Surely they will teach you and tell you,
Speaking out of their understanding.
Transliteration: halo-hem yvorukha yomeru lakhe umilivam yvotsiu miliym

Hebrew: הֲיִֽגְאֶה־גֹּ֭מֶא בְּלֹ֣א בִצָּ֑ה יִשְׂגֶּה־אָ֥חוּ בְלִי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Can papyrus thrive without marsh?
Can rushes grow without water?
Transliteration: hayigeeh-gome velo vitsah yishegeh-achu veliy-mayiim

Hebrew: עֹדֶ֣נּוּ בְ֭אִבּוֹ לֹ֣א יִקָּטֵ֑ף וְלִפְנֵ֖י כׇל־חָצִ֣יר יִיבָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
While still tender, not yet plucked,
They would wither before any other grass.
Transliteration: odenu veivvo lo yikatef velifeney khׇl-chatsiyr yiyvash

Hebrew: כֵּ֗ן אׇ֭רְחוֹת כׇּל־שֹׁ֣כְחֵי אֵ֑ל וְתִקְוַ֖ת חָנֵ֣ף תֹּאבֵֽד׃
Translated:
Such is the fate of all who forget God;
The hope of the impious man comes to naught—
Transliteration: khen ׇrechvot khׇl-shokhechey el vetikevat chanef toved

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־יָק֥וֹט כִּסְל֑וֹ וּבֵ֥ית עַ֝כָּבִ֗ישׁ מִבְטַחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Whose confidence is a thread of gossamer,
Whose trust is a spider’s web.
Transliteration: asher-yakvot khiselvo uveyt akhaviysh mivetachvo

Hebrew: יִשָּׁעֵ֣ן עַל־בֵּ֭יתוֹ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲמֹ֑ד יַחֲזִ֥יק בּ֝֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א יָקֽוּם׃
Translated:
He leans on his house—it will not stand;
He seizes hold of it, but it will not hold.
Transliteration: yishaen al-veytvo velo yaamod yachaziyk vvo velo yakum

Hebrew: רָטֹ֣ב ה֭וּא לִפְנֵי־שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וְעַ֥ל גַּ֝נָּת֗וֹ יֹנַקְתּ֥וֹ תֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
He stays fresh even in the sun;
His shoots spring up in his garden;
Transliteration: ratov hu lifeney-shamesh veal ganatvo yonaketvo tetse

Hebrew: עַל־גַּ֭ל שׇׁרָשָׁ֣יו יְסֻבָּ֑כוּ בֵּ֖ית אֲבָנִ֣ים יֶחֱזֶֽה׃
Translated:
His roots are twined around a heap,
They take hold of a house of stones.
Transliteration: al-gal shׇrashayv yesuvakhu veyt avaniym yechezeh

Hebrew: אִם־יְבַלְּעֶ֥נּוּ מִמְּקֹמ֑וֹ וְכִ֥חֶשׁ בּ֝֗וֹ לֹ֣א רְאִיתִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
When he is uprooted from his place,
It denies him, [saying,]
“I never saw you.”
Transliteration: im-yevaleenu mimekomvo vekhichesh vvo lo reiytiykha

Hebrew: הֶן־ה֭וּא מְשׂ֣וֹשׂ דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּ֝מֵעָפָ֗ר אַחֵ֥ר יִצְמָֽחוּ׃
Translated:
Such is his happy lot;
And from the earth others will grow.
Transliteration: hen-hu meshvosh darekhvo umeafar acher yitsemachu

Hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֭ל לֹ֣א יִמְאַס־תָּ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יַ֝חֲזִ֗יק בְּיַד־מְרֵעִֽים׃
Translated:
Surely God does not despise the blameless;
He gives no support to evildoers.
Transliteration: hen-el lo yimeas-tam velo-yachaziyk veyad-mereiym

Hebrew: עַד־יְמַלֵּ֣ה שְׂח֣וֹק פִּ֑יךָ וּשְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ תְרוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
He will yet fill your mouth with laughter,
And your lips with shouts of joy.
Transliteration: ad-yemaleh shechvok fiykha ushefateykha teruah

Hebrew: שֹׂנְאֶ֥יךָ יִלְבְּשׁוּ־בֹ֑שֶׁת וְאֹ֖הֶל רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֵינֶֽנּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your enemies will be clothed in disgrace;
The tent of the wicked will vanish.
Transliteration: shoneeykha yileveshu-voshet veohel reshaiym eynenu {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: אׇ֭מְנָם יָדַ֣עְתִּי כִי־כֵ֑ן וּמַה־יִּצְדַּ֖ק אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עִם־אֵֽל׃
Translated:
Indeed I know that it is so:
Man cannot win a suit against God.
Transliteration: ׇmenam yadaetiy khiy-khen umah-yitsedak envosh im-el

Hebrew: אִם־יַ֭חְפֹּץ לָרִ֣יב עִמּ֑וֹ לֹֽא־יַ֝עֲנֶ֗נּוּ אַחַ֥ת מִנִּי־אָֽלֶף׃
Translated:
If he insisted on a trial with Him,
He would not answer one charge in a thousand.
Transliteration: im-yachefots lariyv imvo lo-yaanenu achat miniy-alef

Hebrew: חֲכַ֣ם לֵ֭בָב וְאַמִּ֣יץ כֹּ֑חַ מִֽי־הִקְשָׁ֥ה אֵ֝לָ֗יו וַיִּשְׁלָֽם׃
Translated:
Wise of heart and mighty in power—
Who ever challenged Him and came out whole?—
Transliteration: chakham levav veamiyts khocha miy-hikeshah elayv vayishelam

Hebrew: הַמַּעְתִּ֣יק הָ֭רִים וְלֹ֣א יָדָ֑עוּ אֲשֶׁ֖ר הֲפָכָ֣ם בְּאַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Him who moves mountains without their knowing it,
Who overturns them in His anger;
Transliteration: hamaetiyk hariym velo yadau asher hafakham veafvo

Hebrew: הַמַּרְגִּ֣יז אֶ֭רֶץ מִמְּקוֹמָ֑הּ וְ֝עַמּוּדֶ֗יהָ יִתְפַּלָּצֽוּן׃
Translated:
Who shakes the earth from its place,
Till its pillars quake;
Transliteration: hamaregiyz erets mimekvomah veamudeyha yitefalatsun

Hebrew: הָאֹמֵ֣ר לַ֭חֶרֶס וְלֹ֣א יִזְרָ֑ח וּבְעַ֖ד כּוֹכָבִ֣ים יַחְתֹּֽם׃
Translated:
Who commands the sun not to shine;
Who seals up the stars;
Transliteration: haomer lacheres velo yizerach uvead khvokhaviym yachetom

Hebrew: נֹטֶ֣ה שָׁמַ֣יִם לְבַדּ֑וֹ וְ֝דוֹרֵ֗ךְ עַל־בָּ֥מֳתֵי יָֽם׃
Translated:
Who by Himself spread out the heavens,
And trod on the back of the sea;
Transliteration: noteh shamayiim levadvo vedvorekhe al-vamotey yam

Hebrew: עֹֽשֶׂה־עָ֭שׁ כְּסִ֥יל וְכִימָ֗ה וְחַדְרֵ֥י תֵמָֽן׃
Translated:
Who made the Bear and Orion,
Pleiades, and the chambers of the south wind;
Transliteration: osheh-ash khesiyl vekhiymah vechaderey teman

Hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֣ה גְ֭דֹלוֹת עַד־אֵ֣ין חֵ֑קֶר וְ֝נִפְלָא֗וֹת עַד־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
Who performs great deeds which cannot be fathomed,
And wondrous things without number.
Transliteration: osheh gedolvot ad-eyn cheker venifelavot ad-eyn misefar

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן יַעֲבֹ֣ר עָ֭לַי וְלֹ֣א אֶרְאֶ֑ה וְ֝יַחֲלֹ֗ף וְֽלֹא־אָבִ֥ין לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He passes me by—I do not see Him;
He goes by me, but I do not perceive Him.
Transliteration: hen yaavor alay velo ereeh veyachalof velo-aviyn lvo

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן יַ֭חְתֹּף מִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ מִי־יֹאמַ֥ר אֵ֝לָ֗יו מַֽה־תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated:
He snatches away—who can stop Him?
Who can say to Him, “What are You doing?”
Transliteration: hen yachetof miy yeshiyvenu miy-yomar elayv mah-taasheh

Hebrew: אֱ֭לוֹהַּ לֹא־יָשִׁ֣יב אַפּ֑וֹ תַּחְתָּ֥ו שָׁ֝חֲח֗וּ עֹ֣זְרֵי רָֽהַב׃
Translated:
God does not restrain His anger;
Under Him Rahab’s helpers sink down.
Transliteration: elvoha lo-yashiyv afvo tachetav shachachu ozerey rahav

Hebrew: אַ֭ף כִּֽי־אָנֹכִ֣י אֶעֱנֶ֑נּוּ אֶבְחֲרָ֖ה דְבָרַ֣י עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
How then can I answer Him,
Or choose my arguments against Him?
Transliteration: af khiy-anokhiy eenenu evecharah devaray imvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִם־צָ֭דַקְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶעֱנֶ֑ה לִ֝מְשֹׁפְטִ֗י אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃
Translated:
Though I were in the right, I could not speak out,
But I would plead for mercy with my judge.
Transliteration: asher im-tsadaketiy lo eeneh limeshofetiy etechanan

Hebrew: אִם־קָרָ֥אתִי וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֑נִי לֹֽא־אַ֝אֲמִ֗ין כִּֽי־יַאֲזִ֥ין קוֹלִֽי׃
Translated:
If I summoned Him and He responded,
I do not believe He would lend me His ear.
Transliteration: im-karatiy vayaaneniy lo-aamiyn khiy-yaaziyn kvoliy

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־בִּשְׂעָרָ֥ה יְשׁוּפֵ֑נִי וְהִרְבָּ֖ה פְצָעַ֣י חִנָּֽם׃
Translated:
For He crushes me for a hair;
He wounds me much for no cause.
Transliteration: asher-vishearah yeshufeniy vehirevah fetsaay chinam

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִ֭תְּנֵנִי הָשֵׁ֣ב רוּחִ֑י כִּ֥י יַ֝שְׂבִּעַ֗נִי מַמְּרֹרִֽים׃
Translated:
He does not let me catch my breath,
But sates me with bitterness.
Transliteration: lo-yiteneniy hashev ruchiy khiy yashevianiy mameroriym

Hebrew: אִם־לְכֹ֣חַ אַמִּ֣יץ הִנֵּ֑ה וְאִם־לְ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט מִ֣י יוֹעִידֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
If a trial of strength—He is the strong one;
If a trial in court—who will summon Him for me?
Transliteration: im-lekhocha amiyts hineh veim-lemishefat miy yvoiydeniy

Hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭צְדָּק פִּ֣י יַרְשִׁיעֵ֑נִי תׇּֽם־אָ֝֗נִי וַֽיַּעְקְשֵֽׁנִי׃
Translated:
Though I were innocent,
My mouth would condemn me;
Though I were blameless, He would prove me crooked.
Transliteration: im-etsedak fiy yareshiyeniy tׇm-aniy vayaekesheniy

Hebrew: תׇּֽם־אָ֭נִי לֹֽא־אֵדַ֥ע נַפְשִׁ֗י אֶמְאַ֥ס חַיָּֽי׃
Translated:
I am blameless—I am distraught;
I am sick of life.
Transliteration: tׇm-aniy lo-eda nafeshiy emeas chayay

Hebrew: אַחַ֗ת הִ֥֫יא עַל־כֵּ֥ן אָמַ֑רְתִּי תָּ֥ם וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע ה֣וּא מְכַלֶּֽה׃
Translated:
It is all one; therefore I say,
“He destroys the blameless and the guilty.”
Transliteration: achat hiy al-khen amaretiy tam verasha hu mekhaleh

Hebrew: אִם־שׁ֭וֹט יָמִ֣ית פִּתְאֹ֑ם לְמַסַּ֖ת נְקִיִּ֣ם יִלְעָֽג׃
Translated:
When suddenly a scourge brings death,
He mocks as the innocent fail.
Transliteration: im-shvot yamiyt fiteom lemasat nekiyim yileag

Hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ ׀ נִתְּנָ֬ה בְֽיַד־רָשָׁ֗ע פְּנֵֽי־שֹׁפְטֶ֥יהָ יְכַסֶּ֑ה אִם־לֹ֖א אֵפ֣וֹא מִי־הֽוּא׃
Translated:
The earth is handed over to the wicked one;
He covers the eyes of its judges.
If it is not He, then who?
Transliteration: erets nitenah veyad-rasha feney-shofeteyha yekhaseh im-lo efvo miy-hu

Hebrew: וְיָמַ֣י קַ֭לּוּ מִנִּי־רָ֑ץ בָּ֝רְח֗וּ לֹא־רָא֥וּ טוֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
My days fly swifter than a runner;
They flee without seeing happiness;
Transliteration: veyamay kalu miniy-rats varechu lo-rau tvovah

Hebrew: חָ֭לְפוּ עִם־אֳנִיּ֣וֹת אֵבֶ֑ה כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר יָט֥וּשׂ עֲלֵי־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated:
They pass like reed-boats,
Like an eagle swooping onto its prey.
Transliteration: chalefu im-oniyyvot eveh khenesher yatush aley-okhel

Hebrew: אִם־אׇ֭מְרִי אֶשְׁכְּחָ֣ה שִׂיחִ֑י אֶעֶזְבָ֖ה פָנַ֣י וְאַבְלִֽיגָה׃
Translated:
If I say, “I will forget my complaint;
Abandon my sorrow and be diverted,”
Transliteration: im-ׇmeriy eshekhechah shiychiy eezevah fanay veaveliygah

Hebrew: יָגֹ֥רְתִּי כׇל־עַצְּבֹתָ֑י יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּי־לֹ֥א תְנַקֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
I remain in dread of all my suffering;
I know that You will not acquit me.
Transliteration: yagoretiy khׇl-atsevotay yadaetiy khiy-lo tenakeniy

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֥י אֶרְשָׁ֑ע לָמָּה־זֶּ֝֗ה הֶ֣בֶל אִיגָֽע׃
Translated:
It will be I who am in the wrong;
Why then should I waste effort?
Transliteration: anokhiy eresha lamah-zeh hevel iyga

Hebrew: אִם־הִתְרָחַ֥צְתִּי (במו) [בְמֵי־]שָׁ֑לֶג וַ֝הֲזִכּ֗וֹתִי בְּבֹ֣ר כַּפָּֽי׃
Translated:
If I washed with soap,
Cleansed my hands with lye,
Transliteration: im-hiterachatsetiy (vmv) [vemey-]shaleg vahazikhvotiy vevor khafay

Hebrew: אָ֭ז בַּשַּׁ֣חַת תִּטְבְּלֵ֑נִי וְ֝תִעֲב֗וּנִי שַׂלְמוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
You would dip me in muck
Till my clothes would abhor me.
Transliteration: az vashachat titeveleniy vetiavuniy shalemvotay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לֹא־אִ֣ישׁ כָּמ֣וֹנִי אֶעֱנֶ֑נּוּ נָב֥וֹא יַ֝חְדָּ֗ו בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
He is not a man, like me, that I can answer Him,
That we can go to law together.
Transliteration: khiy-lo-iysh khamvoniy eenenu navvo yachedav vamishefat

Hebrew: לֹ֣א יֵשׁ־בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ מוֹכִ֑יחַ יָשֵׁ֖ת יָד֣וֹ עַל־שְׁנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
No arbiter is between us
To lay his hand on us both.
Transliteration: lo eish-veyneynu mvokhiycha yashet yadvo al-sheneynu

Hebrew: יָסֵ֣ר מֵעָלַ֣י שִׁבְ<big>ט֑</big>וֹ וְ֝אֵמָת֗וֹ אַֽל־תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃
Translated:
If He would only take His rod away from me
And not let His terror frighten me,
Transliteration: yaser mealay shive<big>t</big>vo veematvo al-tevaataniy

Hebrew: אֲֽ֭דַבְּרָה וְלֹ֣א אִירָאֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֥י לֹא־כֵ֥ן אָ֝נֹכִ֗י עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated:
Then I would speak out without fear of Him;
For I know myself not to be so.
Transliteration: adaverah velo iyraenu khiy lo-khen anokhiy imadiy

Hebrew: נָֽקְטָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֗י בְּחַ֫יָּ֥י אֶעֶזְבָ֣ה עָלַ֣י שִׂיחִ֑י אֲ֝דַבְּרָ֗ה בְּמַ֣ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
I am disgusted with life;
I will give rein to my complaint,
Speak in the bitterness of my soul.
Transliteration: naketah nafeshiy vechayay eezevah alay shiychiy adaverah vemar nafeshiy

Hebrew: אֹמַ֣ר אֶל־אֱ֭לוֹהַּ אַל־תַּרְשִׁיעֵ֑נִי ה֝וֹדִיעֵ֗נִי עַ֣ל מַה־תְּרִיבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
I say to God, “Do not condemn me;
Let me know what You charge me with.
Transliteration: omar el-elvoha al-tareshiyeniy hvodiyeniy al mah-teriyveniy

Hebrew: הֲט֤וֹב לְךָ֨ ׀ כִּֽי־תַעֲשֹׁ֗ק כִּֽי־תִ֭מְאַס יְגִ֣יעַ כַּפֶּ֑יךָ וְעַל־עֲצַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים הוֹפָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated:
Does it benefit You to defraud,
To despise the toil of Your hands,
While smiling on the counsel of the wicked?
Transliteration: hatvov lekha khiy-taashok khiy-timeas yegiya khafeykha veal-atsat reshaiym hvofaeta

Hebrew: הַעֵינֵ֣י בָשָׂ֣ר לָ֑ךְ אִם־כִּרְא֖וֹת אֱנ֣וֹשׁ תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
Do You have the eyes of flesh?
Is Your vision that of mere men?
Transliteration: haeyney vashar lakhe im-khirevot envosh tireeh

Hebrew: הֲכִימֵ֣י אֱנ֣וֹשׁ יָמֶ֑יךָ אִם־שְׁ֝נוֹתֶ֗יךָ כִּ֣ימֵי גָֽבֶר׃
Translated:
Are Your days the days of a mortal,
Are Your years the years of a man,
Transliteration: hakhiymey envosh yameykha im-shenvoteykha khiymey gaver

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תְבַקֵּ֥שׁ לַעֲוֺנִ֑י וּֽלְחַטָּאתִ֥י תִדְרֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
That You seek my iniquity
And search out my sin?
Transliteration: khiy-tevakesh laavoniy ulechatatiy tidervosh

Hebrew: עַֽל־דַּ֭עְתְּךָ כִּֽי־לֹ֣א אֶרְשָׁ֑ע וְאֵ֖ין מִיָּדְךָ֣ מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
You know that I am not guilty,
And that there is none to deliver from Your hand.
Transliteration: al-daetekha khiy-lo eresha veeyn miyadekha matsiyl

Hebrew: יָדֶ֣יךָ עִ֭צְּבוּנִי וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֑וּנִי יַ֥חַד סָ֝בִ֗יב וַֽתְּבַלְּעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
“Your hands shaped and fashioned me,
Then destroyed every part of me.
Transliteration: yadeykha itsevuniy vayaashuniy yachad saviyv vatevaleeniy

Hebrew: זְכׇר־נָ֭א כִּי־כַחֹ֣מֶר עֲשִׂיתָ֑נִי וְֽאֶל־עָפָ֥ר תְּשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Consider that You fashioned me like clay;
Will You then turn me back into dust?
Transliteration: zekhׇr-na khiy-khachomer ashiytaniy veel-afar teshiyveniy

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א כֶ֭חָלָב תַּתִּיכֵ֑נִי וְ֝כַגְּבִנָּ֗ה תַּקְפִּיאֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
You poured me out like milk,
Congealed me like cheese;
Transliteration: halo khechalav tatiykheniy vekhagevinah takefiyeniy

Hebrew: ע֣וֹר וּ֭בָשָׂר תַּלְבִּישֵׁ֑נִי וּֽבַעֲצָמ֥וֹת וְ֝גִידִ֗ים תְּשֹׂכְכֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
You clothed me with skin and flesh
And wove me of bones and sinews;
Transliteration: vor uvashar taleviysheniy uvaatsamvot vegiydiym teshokhekheniy

Hebrew: חַיִּ֣ים וָ֭חֶסֶד עָשִׂ֣יתָ עִמָּדִ֑י וּ֝פְקֻדָּתְךָ֗ שָֽׁמְרָ֥ה רוּחִֽי׃
Translated:
You bestowed on me life and care;
Your providence watched over my spirit.
Transliteration: chayiym vachesed ashiyta imadiy ufekudatekha shamerah ruchiy

Hebrew: וְ֭אֵלֶּה צָפַ֣נְתָּ בִלְבָבֶ֑ךָ יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּי־זֹ֥את עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Yet these things You hid in Your heart;
I know that You had this in mind:
Transliteration: veeleh tsafaneta vilevavekha yadaetiy khiy-zot imakhe

Hebrew: אִם־חָטָ֥אתִי וּשְׁמַרְתָּ֑נִי וּ֝מֵעֲוֺנִ֗י לֹ֣א תְנַקֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
To watch me when I sinned
And not clear me of my iniquity;
Transliteration: im-chatatiy ushemaretaniy umeavoniy lo tenakeniy

Hebrew: אִם־רָשַׁ֡עְתִּי אַלְלַ֬י לִ֗י וְ֭צָדַקְתִּי לֹא־אֶשָּׂ֣א רֹאשִׁ֑י שְׂבַ֥ע קָ֝ל֗וֹן וּרְאֵ֥ה עׇנְיִֽי׃
Translated:
Should I be guilty—the worse for me!
And even when innocent, I cannot lift my head;
So sated am I with shame,
And drenched in my misery.
Transliteration: im-rashaetiy alelay liy vetsadaketiy lo-esha roshiy sheva kalvon ureeh ׇneyiy

Hebrew: וְ֭יִגְאֶה כַּשַּׁ֣חַל תְּצוּדֵ֑נִי וְ֝תָשֹׁ֗ב תִּתְפַּלָּא־בִֽי׃
Translated:
It is something to be proud of to hunt me like a lion,
To show Yourself wondrous through me time and again!
Transliteration: veyiigeeh khashachal tetsudeniy vetashov titefala-viy

Hebrew: תְּחַדֵּ֬שׁ עֵדֶ֨יךָ ׀ נֶגְדִּ֗י וְתֶ֣רֶב כַּ֭עַשְׂךָ עִמָּדִ֑י חֲלִיפ֖וֹת וְצָבָ֣א עִמִּֽי׃
Translated:
You keep sending fresh witnesses against me,
Letting Your vexation with me grow.
I serve my term and am my own replacement.
Transliteration: techadesh edeykha negediy veterev khaashekha imadiy chaliyfvot vetsava imiy

Hebrew: וְלָ֣מָּה מֵ֭רֶחֶם הֹצֵאתָ֑נִי אֶ֝גְוַ֗ע וְעַ֣יִן לֹֽא־תִרְאֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
“Why did You let me come out of the womb?
Better had I expired before any eye saw me,
Transliteration: velamah merechem hotsetaniy egeva veayiin lo-tireeniy

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־הָיִ֣יתִי אֶהְיֶ֑ה מִ֝בֶּ֗טֶן לַקֶּ֥בֶר אוּבָֽל׃
Translated:
Had I been as though I never was,
Had I been carried from the womb to the grave.
Transliteration: khaasher lo-hayiytiy eheyeh miveten lakever uval

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־מְעַ֣ט יָמַ֣י (יחדל) [וַחֲדָ֑ל] (ישית) [וְשִׁ֥ית] מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי וְאַבְלִ֥יגָה מְּעָֽט׃
Translated:
My days are few, so desist!
Leave me alone, let me be diverted a while
Transliteration: halo-meat yamay (ychdl) [vachadal] (yshyt) [veshiyt] mimeniy veaveliygah meat

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֣רֶם אֵ֭לֵךְ וְלֹ֣א אָשׁ֑וּב אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Before I depart—never to return—
For the land of deepest gloom;
Transliteration: veterem elekhe velo ashuv el-erets choshekhe vetsalemavet

Hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ עֵפָ֨תָה ׀ כְּמ֥וֹ אֹ֗פֶל צַ֭לְמָוֶת וְלֹ֥א סְדָרִ֗ים וַתֹּ֥פַע כְּמוֹ־אֹֽפֶל׃ {פ}
Translated:
A land whose light is darkness,
All gloom and disarray,
Whose light is like darkness.”
Transliteration: erets efatah khemvo ofel tsalemavet velo sedariym vatofa khemvo-ofel {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן צֹפַ֥ר הַֽנַּעֲמָתִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Zophar the Naamathite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan tsofar hanaamatiy vayomar

Hebrew: הֲרֹ֣ב דְּ֭בָרִים לֹ֣א יֵעָנֶ֑ה וְאִם־אִ֖ישׁ שְׂפָתַ֣יִם יִצְדָּֽק׃
Translated:
Is a multitude of words unanswerable?
Must a loquacious person be right?
Transliteration: harov devariym lo eianeh veim-iysh shefatayiim yitsedak

Hebrew: בַּ֭דֶּיךָ מְתִ֣ים יַחֲרִ֑ישׁוּ וַ֝תִּלְעַ֗ג וְאֵ֣ין מַכְלִֽם׃
Translated:
Your prattle may silence men;
You may mock without being rebuked,
Transliteration: vadeykha metiym yachariyshu vatileag veeyn makhelim

Hebrew: וַ֭תֹּאמֶר זַ֣ךְ לִקְחִ֑י וּ֝בַ֗ר הָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
And say, “My doctrine is pure,
And I have been innocent in Your sight.”
Transliteration: vatomer zakhe likechiy uvar hayiytiy veeyneykha

Hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן אֱל֣וֹהַּ דַּבֵּ֑ר וְיִפְתַּ֖ח שְׂפָתָ֣יו עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
But would that God might speak,
And talk to you Himself.
Transliteration: veulam miy-yiten elvoha daver veyifetach shefatayv imakhe

Hebrew: וְיַגֶּד־לְךָ֨ ׀ תַּ֥עֲלֻמ֣וֹת חׇכְמָה֮ כִּֽי־כִפְלַ֢יִם לְֽת֫וּשִׁיָּ֥ה וְדַ֡ע כִּֽי־יַשֶּׁ֥ה לְךָ֥ אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ מֵעֲוֺנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
He would tell you the secrets of wisdom,
For there are many sides to sagacity;
And know that God has overlooked for you some of your iniquity.
Transliteration: veyaged-lekha taalumvot chׇkhemah khiy-khifelayiim letushiyah veda khiy-yasheh lekha elvoha meavonekha

Hebrew: הַחֵ֣קֶר אֱל֣וֹהַּ תִּמְצָ֑א אִ֤ם עַד־תַּכְלִ֖ית שַׁדַּ֣י תִּמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
Would you discover the mystery of God?
Would you discover the limit of the Almighty?
Transliteration: hacheker elvoha timetsa im ad-takheliyt shaday timetsa

Hebrew: גׇּבְהֵ֣י שָׁ֭מַיִם מַה־תִּפְעָ֑ל עֲמֻקָּ֥ה מִ֝שְּׁא֗וֹל מַה־תֵּדָֽע׃
Translated:
Higher than heaven—what can you do?
Deeper than Sheol—what can you know?
Transliteration: gׇvehey shamayim mah-tifeal amukah mishevol mah-teda

Hebrew: אֲרֻכָּ֣ה מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִדָּ֑הּ וּ֝רְחָבָ֗ה מִנִּי־יָֽם׃
Translated:
Its measure is longer than the earth
And broader than the sea.
Transliteration: arukhah meerets midah urechavah miniy-yam

Hebrew: אִם־יַחֲלֹ֥ף וְיַסְגִּ֑יר וְ֝יַקְהִ֗יל וּמִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Should He pass by, or confine,
Or call an assembly, who can stop Him?
Transliteration: im-yachalof veyasegiyr veyakehiyl umiy yeshiyvenu

Hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא יָדַ֣ע מְתֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וַיַּרְא־אָ֝֗וֶן וְלֹ֣א יִתְבּוֹנָֽן׃
Translated:
For He knows deceitful men;
When He sees iniquity, does He not discern it?
Transliteration: khiy-hu yada metey-shave vayare-aven velo yitevvonan

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ נָ֭בוּב יִלָּבֵ֑ב וְעַ֥יִר פֶּ֝֗רֶא אָדָ֥ם יִוָּלֵֽד׃
Translated:
A hollow man will get understanding,
When a wild ass is born a man.
Transliteration: veiysh navuv yilavev veayiir fere adam yivaled

Hebrew: אִם־אַ֭תָּה הֲכִינ֣וֹתָ לִבֶּ֑ךָ וּפָרַשְׂתָּ֖ אֵלָ֣יו כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
But if you direct your mind,
And spread forth your hands toward Him—
Transliteration: im-atah hakhiynvota livekha ufarasheta elayv khafeykha

Hebrew: אִם־אָ֣וֶן בְּ֭יָדְךָ הַרְחִיקֵ֑הוּ וְאַל־תַּשְׁכֵּ֖ן בְּאֹהָלֶ֣יךָ עַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
If there is iniquity with you, remove it,
And do not let injustice reside in your tent—
Transliteration: im-aven veyadekha harechiykehu veal-tashekhen veohaleykha avelah

Hebrew: כִּי־אָ֤ז ׀ תִּשָּׂ֣א פָנֶ֣יךָ מִמּ֑וּם וְהָיִ֥יתָ מֻ֝צָ֗ק וְלֹ֣א תִירָֽא׃
Translated:
Then, free of blemish, you will hold your head high,
And, when in straits, be unafraid.
Transliteration: khiy-az tisha faneykha mimum vehayiyta mutsak velo tiyra

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה עָמָ֣ל תִּשְׁכָּ֑ח כְּמַ֖יִם עָבְר֣וּ תִזְכֹּֽר׃
Translated:
You will then put your misery out of mind,
Consider it as water that has flowed past.
Transliteration: khiy-atah amal tishekhach khemayiim averu tizekhor

Hebrew: וּֽ֭מִצׇּהֳרַיִם יָק֣וּם חָ֑לֶד תָּ֝עֻ֗פָה כַּבֹּ֥קֶר תִּהְיֶֽה׃
Translated:
Life will be brighter than noon;
You will shine, you will be like the morning.
Transliteration: umitsׇhorayim yakum chaled taufah khavoker tiheyeh

Translated:
You will be secure, for there is hope,
And, entrenched, you will rest secure;
Transliteration: uvatacheta khiy-eish tikevah vechafareta lavetach tishekhav

Hebrew: וְֽ֭רָבַצְתָּ וְאֵ֣ין מַחֲרִ֑יד וְחִלּ֖וּ פָנֶ֣יךָ רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
You will lie down undisturbed;
The great will court your favor.
Transliteration: veravatseta veeyn machariyd vechilu faneykha raviym

Hebrew: וְעֵינֵ֥י רְשָׁעִ֗ים תִּ֫כְלֶ֥ינָה וּ֭מָנוֹס אָבַ֣ד מִנְהֶ֑ם וְ֝תִקְוָתָ֗ם מַֽפַּֽח־נָֽפֶשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated:
But the eyes of the wicked pine away;
Escape is cut off from them;
They have only their last breath to look forward to.
Transliteration: veeyney reshaiym tikheleynah umanvos avad minehem vetikevatam mafach-nafesh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: אׇ֭מְנָם כִּ֣י אַתֶּם־עָ֑ם וְ֝עִמָּכֶ֗ם תָּמ֥וּת חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Indeed, you are the [voice of] the people,
And wisdom will die with you.
Transliteration: ׇmenam khiy atem-am veimakhem tamut chׇkhemah

Hebrew: גַּם־לִ֤י לֵבָ֨ב ׀ כְּֽמוֹכֶ֗ם לֹא־נֹפֵ֣ל אָנֹכִ֣י מִכֶּ֑ם וְאֶת־מִי־אֵ֥ין כְּמוֹ־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated:
But I, like you, have a mind,
And am not less than you.
Who does not know such things?
Transliteration: gam-liy levav khemvokhem lo-nofel anokhiy mikhem veet-miy-eyn khemvo-eleh

Hebrew: שְׂחֹ֤ק לְרֵעֵ֨הוּ ׀ אֶהְיֶ֗ה קֹרֵ֣א לֶ֭אֱלוֹהַּ וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֑הוּ שְׂ֝ח֗וֹק צַדִּ֥יק תָּמִֽים׃
Translated:
I have become a laughingstock to my friend—
“One who calls to God and is answered,
Blamelessly innocent”—a laughingstock.
Transliteration: shechok lereehu eheyeh kore leelvoha vayaanehu shechvok tsadiyk tamiym

Hebrew: לַפִּ֣יד בּ֭וּז לְעַשְׁתּ֣וּת שַׁאֲנָ֑ן נָ֝כ֗וֹן לְמ֣וֹעֲדֵי רָֽגֶל׃
Translated:
In the thought of the complacent there is contempt for calamity;
It is ready for those whose foot slips.-
Transliteration: lafiyd vuz leashetut shaanan nakhvon lemvoadey ragel

Hebrew: יִשְׁלָ֤יוּ אֹהָלִ֨ים ׀ לְשֹׁ֥דְדִ֗ים וּֽ֭בַטֻּחוֹת לְמַרְגִּ֣יזֵי אֵ֑ל לַאֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵבִ֖יא אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Robbers live untroubled in their tents,
And those who provoke God are secure,
Those whom God’s hands have produced.
Transliteration: yishelayu ohaliym leshodediym uvatuchvot lemaregiyzey el laasher heviy elvoha veyadvo

Hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם שְׁאַל־נָ֣א בְהֵמ֣וֹת וְתֹרֶ֑ךָּ וְע֥וֹף הַ֝שָּׁמַ֗יִם וְיַגֶּד־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
But ask the beasts, and they will teach you;
The birds of the sky, they will tell you,
Transliteration: veulam sheal-na vehemvot vetorekha vevof hashamayiim veyaged-lakhe

Hebrew: א֤וֹ שִׂ֣יחַ לָאָ֣רֶץ וְתֹרֶ֑ךָּ וִיסַפְּר֥וּ לְ֝ךָ֗ דְּגֵ֣י הַיָּֽם׃
Translated:
Or speak to the earth, it will teach you;
The fish of the sea, they will inform you.
Transliteration: vo shiycha laarets vetorekha viysaferu lekha degey hayam

Hebrew: מִ֭י לֹא־יָדַ֣ע בְּכׇל־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֥י יַד־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עָ֣שְׂתָה זֹּֽאת׃
Translated:
Who among all these does not know
That the hand of the LORD has done this?
Transliteration: miy lo-yada vekhׇl-eleh khiy yad-yehovah ashetah zot

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּ֭יָדוֹ נֶ֣פֶשׁ כׇּל־חָ֑י וְ֝ר֗וּחַ כׇּל־בְּשַׂר־אִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
In His hand is every living soul
And the breath of all mankind.
Transliteration: asher veyadvo nefesh khׇl-chay verucha khׇl-veshar-iysh

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־אֹ֭זֶן מִלִּ֣ין תִּבְחָ֑ן וְ֝חֵ֗ךְ אֹ֣כֶל יִטְעַם־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Truly, the ear tests arguments
As the palate tastes foods.
Transliteration: halo-ozen miliyn tivechan vechekhe okhel yiteam-lvo

Hebrew: בִּישִׁישִׁ֥ים חׇכְמָ֑ה וְאֹ֖רֶךְ יָמִ֣ים תְּבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
Is wisdom in the aged
And understanding in the long-lived?
Transliteration: viyshiyshiym chׇkhemah veorekhe yamiym tevunah

Hebrew: עִ֭מּוֹ חׇכְמָ֣ה וּגְבוּרָ֑ה ל֝֗וֹ עֵצָ֥ה וּתְבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
With Him are wisdom and courage;
His are counsel and understanding.
Transliteration: imvo chׇkhemah ugevurah lvo etsah utevunah

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן יַ֭הֲרוֹס וְלֹ֣א יִבָּנֶ֑ה יִסְגֹּ֥ר עַל־אִ֝֗ישׁ וְלֹ֣א יִפָּתֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
Whatever He tears down cannot be rebuilt;
Whomever He imprisons cannot be set free.
Transliteration: hen yaharvos velo yivaneh yisegor al-iysh velo yifatecha

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן יַעְצֹ֣ר בַּמַּ֣יִם וְיִבָ֑שׁוּ וִ֝ישַׁלְּחֵ֗ם וְיַ֖הַפְכוּ־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
When He holds back the waters, they dry up;
When He lets them loose, they tear up the land.
Transliteration: hen yaetsor vamayiim veyivashu viyshalechem veyahafekhu-arets

Hebrew: עִ֭מּוֹ עֹ֣ז וְתוּשִׁיָּ֑ה ל֝֗וֹ שֹׁגֵ֥ג וּמַשְׁגֶּֽה׃
Translated:
With Him are strength and resourcefulness;
Erring and causing to err are from Him.
Transliteration: imvo oz vetushiyah lvo shogeg umashegeh

Hebrew: מוֹלִ֣יךְ יוֹעֲצִ֣ים שׁוֹלָ֑ל וְֽשֹׁפְטִ֥ים יְהוֹלֵֽל׃
Translated:
He makes counselors go about naked
And causes judges to go mad.
Transliteration: mvoliykhe yvoatsiym shvolal veshofetiym yehvolel

Hebrew: מוּסַ֣ר מְלָכִ֣ים פִּתֵּ֑חַ וַיֶּאְסֹ֥ר אֵ֝ז֗וֹר בְּמׇתְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
He undoes the belts of kings,
And fastens loincloths on them.
Transliteration: musar melakhiym fitecha vayeesor ezvor vemׇteneyhem

Hebrew: מוֹלִ֣יךְ כֹּהֲנִ֣ים שׁוֹלָ֑ל וְאֵ֖תָנִ֣ים יְסַלֵּֽף׃
Translated:
He makes priests go about naked,
And leads temple-servants astray.
Transliteration: mvoliykhe khohaniym shvolal veetaniym yesalef

Hebrew: מֵסִ֣יר שָׂ֭פָה לְנֶאֱמָנִ֑ים וְטַ֖עַם זְקֵנִ֣ים יִקָּֽח׃
Translated:
He deprives trusty men of speech,
And takes away the reason of elders.
Transliteration: mesiyr shafah leneemaniym vetaam zekeniym yikach

Hebrew: שׁוֹפֵ֣ךְ בּ֭וּז עַל־נְדִיבִ֑ים וּמְזִ֖יחַ אֲפִיקִ֣ים רִפָּֽה׃
Translated:
He pours disgrace upon great men,
And loosens the belt of the mighty.
Transliteration: shvofekhe vuz al-nediyviym umeziycha afiykiym rifah

Hebrew: מְגַלֶּ֣ה עֲ֭מֻקוֹת מִנִּי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וַיֹּצֵ֖א לָא֣וֹר צַלְמָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
He draws mysteries out of the darkness,
And brings obscurities to light.
Transliteration: megaleh amukvot miniy-choshekhe vayotse lavor tsalemavet

Hebrew: מַשְׂגִּ֣יא לַ֭גּוֹיִם וַֽיְאַבְּדֵ֑ם שֹׁטֵ֥חַ לַ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם וַיַּנְחֵֽם׃
Translated:
He exalts nations, then destroys them;
He expands nations, then leads them away.
Transliteration: mashegiy lagvoyim vayeavedem shotecha lagvoyim vayanechem

Hebrew: מֵסִ֗יר לֵ֭ב רָאשֵׁ֣י עַם־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַ֝יַּתְעֵ֗ם בְּתֹ֣הוּ לֹא־דָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
He deranges the leaders of the people,
And makes them wander in a trackless waste.
Transliteration: mesiyr lev rashey am-haarets vayateem vetohu lo-darekhe

Hebrew: יְמַֽשְׁשׁוּ־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ וְלֹא־א֑וֹר וַ֝יַּתְעֵ֗ם כַּשִּׁכּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
They grope without light in the darkness;
He makes them wander as if drunk.
Transliteration: yemasheshu-choshekhe velo-vor vayateem khashikhvor

Hebrew: הֶן־כֹּ֭ל רָאֲתָ֣ה עֵינִ֑י שָֽׁמְעָ֥ה אׇ֝זְנִ֗י וַתָּ֥בֶן לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
My eye has seen all this;
My ear has heard and understood it.
Transliteration: hen-khol raatah eyniy shameah ׇzeniy vataven lah

Hebrew: כְּֽ֭דַעְתְּכֶם יָדַ֣עְתִּי גַם־אָ֑נִי לֹֽא־נֹפֵ֖ל אָנֹכִ֣י מִכֶּֽם׃
Translated:
What you know, I know also;
I am not less than you.
Transliteration: khedaetekhem yadaetiy gam-aniy lo-nofel anokhiy mikhem

Hebrew: אוּלָ֗ם אֲ֭נִי אֶל־שַׁדַּ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְהוֹכֵ֖חַ אֶל־אֵ֣ל אֶחְפָּֽץ׃
Translated:
Indeed, I would speak to the Almighty;
I insist on arguing with God.
Transliteration: ulam aniy el-shaday adaver vehvokhecha el-el echefats

Hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם אַתֶּ֥ם טֹפְלֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר רֹפְאֵ֖י אֱלִ֣ל כֻּלְּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
But you invent lies;
All of you are quacks.
Transliteration: veulam atem tofeley-shaker rofeey elil khulekhem

Hebrew: מִי־יִ֭תֵּן הַחֲרֵ֣שׁ תַּחֲרִישׁ֑וּן וּתְהִ֖י לָכֶ֣ם לְחׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
If you would only keep quiet
It would be considered wisdom on your part.
Transliteration: miy-yiten hacharesh tachariyshun utehiy lakhem lechׇkhemah

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֥א תוֹכַחְתִּ֑י וְרִב֖וֹת שְׂפָתַ֣י הַקְשִֽׁיבוּ׃
Translated:
Hear now my arguments,
Listen to my pleading.
Transliteration: shimeu-na tvokhachetiy verivvot shefatay hakeshiyvu

Hebrew: הַ֭לְאֵל תְּדַבְּר֣וּ עַוְלָ֑ה וְ֝ל֗וֹ תְּֽדַבְּר֥וּ רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Will you speak unjustly on God’s behalf?
Will you speak deceitfully for Him?
Transliteration: haleel tedaveru avelah velvo tedaveru remiyah

Hebrew: הֲפָנָ֥יו תִּשָּׂא֑וּן אִם־לָאֵ֥ל תְּרִיבֽוּן׃
Translated:
Will you be partial toward Him?
Will you plead God’s cause?
Transliteration: hafanayv tishaun im-lael teriyvun

Hebrew: הֲ֭טוֹב כִּֽי־יַחְקֹ֣ר אֶתְכֶ֑ם אִם־כְּהָתֵ֥ל בֶּ֝אֱנ֗וֹשׁ תְּהָתֵ֥לּוּ בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Will it go well when He examines you?
Will you fool Him as one fools men?
Transliteration: hatvov khiy-yachekor etekhem im-khehatel veenvosh tehatelu vvo

Hebrew: הוֹכֵ֣חַ יוֹכִ֣יחַ אֶתְכֶ֑ם אִם־בַּ֝סֵּ֗תֶר פָּנִ֥ים תִּשָּׂאֽוּן׃
Translated:
He will surely reprove you
If in your heart you are partial toward Him.
Transliteration: hvokhecha yvokhiycha etekhem im-vaseter faniym tishaun

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א שְׂ֭אֵתוֹ תְּבַעֵ֣ת אֶתְכֶ֑ם וּ֝פַחְדּ֗וֹ יִפֹּ֥ל עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
His threat will terrify you,
And His fear will seize you.
Transliteration: halo sheetvo tevaet etekhem ufachedvo yifol aleykhem

Hebrew: זִֽ֭כְרֹנֵיכֶם מִשְׁלֵי־אֵ֑פֶר לְגַבֵּי־חֹ֝֗מֶר גַּבֵּיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Your briefs are empty platitudes;
Your responses are unsubstantial.
Transliteration: zikheroneykhem misheley-efer legavey-chomer gaveykhem

Hebrew: הַחֲרִ֣ישׁוּ מִ֭מֶּנִּי וַאֲדַבְּרָה־אָ֑נִי וְיַעֲבֹ֖ר עָלַ֣י מָֽה׃
Translated:
Keep quiet; I will have my say,
Come what may upon me.
Transliteration: hachariyshu mimeniy vaadaverah-aniy veyaavor alay mah

Hebrew: עַל־מָ֤ה ׀ אֶשָּׂ֣א בְשָׂרִ֣י בְשִׁנָּ֑י וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י אָשִׂ֥ים בְּכַפִּֽי׃
Translated:
How long! I will take my flesh in my teeth;
I will take my life in my hands.
Transliteration: al-mah esha veshariy veshinay venafeshiy ashiym vekhafiy

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן יִ֭קְטְלֵנִי (לא) [ל֣וֹ] אֲיַחֵ֑ל אַךְ־דְּ֝רָכַ֗י אֶל־פָּנָ֥יו אוֹכִֽיחַ׃
Translated:
He may well slay me; I may have no hope;
Yet I will argue my case before Him.
Transliteration: hen yiketeleniy (l) [lvo] ayachel akhe-derakhay el-fanayv vokhiycha

Hebrew: גַּם־הוּא־לִ֥י לִישׁוּעָ֑ה כִּי־לֹ֥א לְ֝פָנָ֗יו חָנֵ֥ף יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
In this too is my salvation:
That no impious man can come into His presence.
Transliteration: gam-hu-liy liyshuah khiy-lo lefanayv chanef yavvo

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ שָׁ֭מוֹעַ מִלָּתִ֑י וְ֝אַחֲוָתִ֗י בְּאׇזְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Listen closely to my words;
Give ear to my discourse.
Transliteration: shimeu shamvoa milatiy veachavatiy veׇzeneykhem

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֭א עָרַ֣כְתִּי מִשְׁפָּ֑ט יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּי־אֲנִ֥י אֶצְדָּֽק׃
Translated:
See now, I have prepared a case;
I know that I will win it.
Transliteration: hineh-na arakhetiy mishefat yadaetiy khiy-aniy etsedak

Hebrew: מִי־ה֭וּא יָרִ֣יב עִמָּדִ֑י כִּֽי־עַתָּ֖ה אַחֲרִ֣ישׁ וְאֶגְוָֽע׃
Translated:
For who is it that would challenge me?
I should then keep silent and expire.
Transliteration: miy-hu yariyv imadiy khiy-atah achariysh veegeva

Hebrew: אַךְ־שְׁ֭תַּיִם אַל־תַּ֣עַשׂ עִמָּדִ֑י אָ֥ז מִ֝פָּנֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א אֶסָּתֵֽר׃
Translated:
But two things do not do to me,
So that I need not hide from You:
Transliteration: akhe-shetayim al-taash imadiy az mifaneykha lo esater

Hebrew: כַּ֭פְּךָ מֵעָלַ֣י הַרְחַ֑ק וְ֝אֵ֥מָתְךָ֗ אַֽל־תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Remove Your hand from me,
And let not Your terror frighten me.
Transliteration: khafekha mealay harechak veematekha al-tevaataniy

Hebrew: וּ֭קְרָא וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֶעֱנֶ֑ה אֽוֹ־אֲ֝דַבֵּ֗ר וַהֲשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Then summon me and I will respond,
Or I will speak and You reply to me.
Transliteration: ukera veanokhiy eeneh vo-adaver vahashiyveniy

Hebrew: כַּמָּ֣ה לִ֭י עֲוֺנ֣וֹת וְחַטָּא֑וֹת פִּֽשְׁעִ֥י וְ֝חַטָּאתִ֗י הֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
How many are my iniquities and sins?
Advise me of my transgression and sin.
Transliteration: khamah liy avonvot vechatavot fisheiy vechatatiy hodiyeniy
