Hebrew: לָֽמָּה־פָנֶ֥יךָ תַסְתִּ֑יר וְתַחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי לְאוֹיֵ֣ב לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Why do You hide Your face,
And treat me like an enemy?
Transliteration: lamah-faneykha tasetiyr vetachesheveniy levoeiv lakhe

Hebrew: הֶעָלֶ֣ה נִדָּ֣ף תַּעֲר֑וֹץ וְאֶת־קַ֖שׁ יָבֵ֣שׁ תִּרְדֹּֽף׃
Translated:
Will You harass a driven leaf,
Will You pursue dried-up straw,
Transliteration: healeh nidaf taarvots veet-kash yavesh tiredof

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִכְתֹּ֣ב עָלַ֣י מְרֹר֑וֹת וְ֝תוֹרִישֵׁ֗נִי עֲוֺנ֥וֹת נְעוּרָֽי׃
Translated:
That You decree for me bitter things
And make me answer for the iniquities of my youth,
Transliteration: khiy-tikhetov alay merorvot vetvoriysheniy avonvot neuray

Hebrew: וְתָ֘שֵׂ֤ם בַּסַּ֨ד ׀ רַגְלַ֗י וְתִשְׁמ֥וֹר כׇּל־אׇרְחוֹתָ֑י עַל־שׇׁרְשֵׁ֥י רַ֝גְלַ֗י תִּתְחַקֶּֽה׃
Translated:
That You put my feet in the stocks
And watch all my ways,
Hemming in my footsteps?
Transliteration: vetashem vasad ragelay vetishemvor khׇl-ׇrechvotay al-shׇreshey ragelay titechakeh

Hebrew: וְ֭הוּא כְּרָקָ֣ב יִבְלֶ֑ה כְּ֝בֶ֗גֶד אֲכָ֣לוֹ עָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Man wastes away like a rotten thing,
Like a garment eaten by moths.
Transliteration: vehu kherakav yiveleh kheveged akhalvo ash

Hebrew: אָ֭דָם יְל֣וּד אִשָּׁ֑ה קְצַ֥ר יָ֝מִ֗ים וּֽשְׂבַֽע־רֹֽגֶז׃
Translated: Man born of woman is short-lived and sated with trouble.
Transliteration: adam yelud ishah ketsar yamiym usheva-rogez

Hebrew: כְּצִ֣יץ יָ֭צָא וַיִּמָּ֑ל וַיִּבְרַ֥ח כַּ֝צֵּ֗ל וְלֹ֣א יַעֲמֽוֹד׃
Translated:
He blossoms like a flower and withers;
He vanishes like a shadow and does not endure.
Transliteration: khetsiyts yatsa vayimal vayiverach khatsel velo yaamvod

Hebrew: אַף־עַל־זֶ֭ה פָּקַ֣חְתָּ עֵינֶ֑ךָ וְאֹ֘תִ֤י תָבִ֖יא בְמִשְׁפָּ֣ט עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Do You fix Your gaze on such a one?
Will You go to law with me?
Transliteration: af-al-zeh fakacheta eynekha veotiy taviy vemishefat imakhe

Hebrew: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן טָ֭הוֹר מִטָּמֵ֗א לֹ֣א אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Who can produce a clean thing out of an unclean one? No one!
Transliteration: miy-yiten tahvor mitame lo echad

Hebrew: אִ֥ם־חֲרוּצִ֨ים ׀ יָמָ֗יו מִֽסְפַּר־חֳדָשָׁ֥יו אִתָּ֑ךְ חֻקָּ֥ו עָ֝שִׂ֗יתָ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲבֹֽר׃
Translated:
His days are determined;
You know the number of his months;
You have set him limits that he cannot pass.
Transliteration: im-charutsiym yamayv misefar-chodashayv itakhe chukav ashiyta velo yaavor

Hebrew: שְׁעֵ֣ה מֵעָלָ֣יו וְיֶחְדָּ֑ל עַד־יִ֝רְצֶ֗ה כְּשָׂכִ֥יר יוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Turn away from him, that he may be at ease
Until, like a hireling, he finishes out his day.
Transliteration: sheeh mealayv veyechedal ad-yiretseh kheshakhiyr yvomvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יֵ֥שׁ לָעֵ֗ץ תִּ֫קְוָ֥ה אִֽם־יִ֭כָּרֵת וְע֣וֹד יַחֲלִ֑יף וְ֝יֹנַקְתּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א תֶחְדָּֽל׃
Translated:
There is hope for a tree;
If it is cut down it will renew itself;
Its shoots will not cease.
Transliteration: khiy eish laets tikevah im-yikharet vevod yachaliyf veyonaketvo lo techedal

Hebrew: אִם־יַזְקִ֣ין בָּאָ֣רֶץ שׇׁרְשׁ֑וֹ וּ֝בֶעָפָ֗ר יָמ֥וּת גִּזְעֽוֹ׃
Translated:
If its roots are old in the earth,
And its stump dies in the ground,
Transliteration: im-yazekiyn vaarets shׇreshvo uveafar yamut gizevo

Hebrew: מֵרֵ֣יחַ מַ֣יִם יַפְרִ֑חַ וְעָשָׂ֖ה קָצִ֣יר כְּמוֹ־נָֽטַע׃
Translated:
At the scent of water it will bud
And produce branches like a sapling.
Transliteration: mereycha mayiim yafericha veashah katsiyr khemvo-nata

Hebrew: וְגֶ֣בֶר יָ֭מוּת וַֽיֶּחֱלָ֑שׁ וַיִּגְוַ֖ע אָדָ֣ם וְאַיּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But mortals languish and die;
Man expires; where is he?
Transliteration: vegever yamut vayechelash vayigeva adam veayyvo

Hebrew: אָֽזְלוּ־מַ֭יִם מִנִּי־יָ֑ם וְ֝נָהָ֗ר יֶחֱרַ֥ב וְיָבֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
The waters of the sea fail,
And the river dries up and is parched.
Transliteration: azelu-mayiim miniy-yam venahar yecherav veyavesh

Hebrew: וְאִ֥ישׁ שָׁכַ֗ב וְֽלֹא־יָ֫ק֥וּם עַד־בִּלְתִּ֣י שָׁ֭מַיִם לֹ֣א יָקִ֑יצוּ וְלֹֽא־יֵ֝עֹ֗רוּ מִשְּׁנָתָֽם׃
Translated:
So man lies down never to rise;
He will awake only when the heavens are no more,
Only then be aroused from his sleep.
Transliteration: veiysh shakhav velo-yakum ad-viletiy shamayim lo yakiytsu velo-eioru mishenatam

Hebrew: מִ֤י יִתֵּ֨ן ׀ בִּשְׁא֬וֹל תַּצְפִּנֵ֗נִי תַּ֭סְתִּירֵנִי עַד־שׁ֣וּב אַפֶּ֑ךָ תָּ֤שִֽׁית־לִ֖י חֹ֣ק וְתִזְכְּרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O that You would hide me in Sheol,
Conceal me until Your anger passes,
Set me a fixed time to attend to me.
Transliteration: miy yiten vishevol tatsefineniy tasetiyreniy ad-shuv afekha tashiyt-liy chok vetizekhereniy

Hebrew: אִם־יָמ֥וּת גֶּ֗בֶר הֲיִֽ֫חְיֶ֥ה כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י צְבָאִ֣י אֲיַחֵ֑ל עַד־בּ֝֗וֹא חֲלִיפָתִֽי׃
Translated:
If a man dies, can he live again?
All the time of my service I wait
Until my replacement comes.
Transliteration: im-yamut gever hayicheyeh khׇl-yemey tsevaiy ayachel ad-vvo chaliyfatiy

Hebrew: תִּ֭קְרָא וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֶעֱנֶ֑ךָּ לְֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדֶ֣יךָ תִכְסֹֽף׃
Translated:
You would call and I would answer You;
You would set Your heart on Your handiwork.
Transliteration: tikera veanokhiy eenekha lemaasheh yadeykha tikhesof

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה צְעָדַ֣י תִּסְפּ֑וֹר לֹֽא־תִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר עַל־חַטָּאתִֽי׃
Translated:
Then You would not count my steps,
Or keep watch over my sin.
Transliteration: khiy-atah tseaday tisefvor lo-tishemor al-chatatiy

Hebrew: חָתֻ֣ם בִּצְר֣וֹר פִּשְׁעִ֑י וַ֝תִּטְפֹּ֗ל עַל־עֲוֺנִֽי׃
Translated:
My transgression would be sealed up in a pouch;
You would coat over my iniquity.
Transliteration: chatum vitservor fisheiy vatitefol al-avoniy

Hebrew: וְ֭אוּלָם הַר־נוֹפֵ֣ל יִבּ֑וֹל וְ֝צ֗וּר יֶעְתַּ֥ק מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Mountains collapse and crumble;
Rocks are dislodged from their place.
Transliteration: veulam har-nvofel yivvol vetsur yeetak mimekomvo

Hebrew: אֲבָנִ֤ים ׀ שָׁ֥חֲקוּ מַ֗יִם תִּשְׁטֹֽף־סְפִיחֶ֥יהָ עֲפַר־אָ֑רֶץ וְתִקְוַ֖ת אֱנ֣וֹשׁ הֶאֱבַֽדְתָּ׃
Translated:
Water wears away stone;
Torrents wash away earth;
So you destroy man’s hope,
Transliteration: avaniym shachaku mayiim tishetof-sefiycheyha afar-arets vetikevat envosh heevadeta

Hebrew: תִּתְקְפֵ֣הוּ לָ֭נֶצַח וַֽיַּהֲלֹ֑ךְ מְשַׁנֶּ֥ה פָ֝נָ֗יו וַֽתְּשַׁלְּחֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
You overpower him forever and he perishes;
You alter his visage and dispatch him.
Transliteration: titekefehu lanetsach vayahalokhe meshaneh fanayv vateshalechehu

Hebrew: יִכְבְּד֣וּ בָ֭נָיו וְלֹ֣א יֵדָ֑ע וְ֝יִצְעֲר֗וּ וְֽלֹא־יָבִ֥ין לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
His sons attain honor and he does not know it;
They are humbled and he is not aware of it.
Transliteration: yikhevedu vanayv velo eida veyiitsearu velo-yaviyn lamvo

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּ֭שָׂרוֹ עָלָ֣יו יִכְאָ֑ב וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ עָלָ֥יו תֶּאֱבָֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
He feels only the pain of his flesh,
And his spirit mourns in him.
Transliteration: akhe-vesharvo alayv yikheav venafeshvo alayv teeval {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּימָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan eliyfaz hateymaniy vayomar

Hebrew: הֶחָכָ֗ם יַעֲנֶ֥ה דַעַת־ר֑וּחַ וִימַלֵּ֖א קָדִ֣ים בִּטְנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Does a wise man answer with windy opinions,
And fill his belly with the east wind?
Transliteration: hechakham yaaneh daat-rucha viymale kadiym vitenvo

Hebrew: הוֹכֵ֣חַ בְּ֭דָבָר לֹ֣א יִסְכּ֑וֹן וּ֝מִלִּ֗ים לֹא־יוֹעִ֥יל בָּֽם׃
Translated:
Should he argue with useless talk,
With words that are of no worth?
Transliteration: hvokhecha vedavar lo yisekhvon umiliym lo-yvoiyl vam

Hebrew: אַף־אַ֭תָּה תָּפֵ֣ר יִרְאָ֑ה וְתִגְרַ֥ע שִׂ֝יחָ֗ה לִפְנֵי־אֵֽל׃
Translated:
You subvert piety
And restrain prayer to God.
Transliteration: af-atah tafer yireah vetigera shiychah lifeney-el

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יְאַלֵּ֣ף עֲוֺנְךָ֣ פִ֑יךָ וְ֝תִבְחַ֗ר לְשׁ֣וֹן עֲרוּמִֽים׃
Translated:
Your sinfulness dictates your speech,
So you choose crafty language.
Transliteration: khiy yealef avonekha fiykha vetivechar leshvon arumiym

Hebrew: יַרְשִׁיעֲךָ֣ פִ֣יךָ וְלֹא־אָ֑נִי וּ֝שְׂפָתֶ֗יךָ יַעֲנוּ־בָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Your own mouth condemns you—not I;
Your lips testify against you.
Transliteration: yareshiyakha fiykha velo-aniy ushefateykha yaanu-vakhe

Hebrew: הֲרִאישׁ֣וֹן אָ֭דָם תִּוָּלֵ֑ד וְלִפְנֵ֖י גְבָע֣וֹת חוֹלָֽלְתָּ׃
Translated:
Were you the first man born?
Were you created before the hills?
Transliteration: hariyshvon adam tivaled velifeney gevavot chvolaleta

Hebrew: הַבְס֣וֹד אֱל֣וֹהַּ תִּשְׁמָ֑ע וְתִגְרַ֖ע אֵלֶ֣יךָ חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Have you listened in on the council of God?
Have you sole possession of wisdom?
Transliteration: havesvod elvoha tishema vetigera eleykha chׇkhemah

Hebrew: מַה־יָּ֭דַעְתָּ וְלֹ֣א נֵדָ֑ע תָּ֝בִ֗ין וְֽלֹא־עִמָּ֥נוּ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
What do you know that we do not know,
Or understand that we do not?
Transliteration: mah-yadaeta velo neda taviyn velo-imanu hu

Hebrew: גַּם־שָׂ֣ב גַּם־יָשִׁ֣ישׁ בָּ֑נוּ כַּבִּ֖יר מֵאָבִ֣יךָ יָמִֽים׃
Translated:
Among us are gray-haired old men,
Older by far than your father.
Transliteration: gam-shav gam-yashiysh vanu khaviyr meaviykha yamiym

Hebrew: הַמְעַ֣ט מִ֭מְּךָ תַּנְחוּמ֣וֹת אֵ֑ל וְ֝דָבָ֗ר לָאַ֥ט עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Are God’s consolations not enough for you,
And His gentle words to you?
Transliteration: hameat mimekha tanechumvot el vedavar laat imakhe

Hebrew: מַה־יִּקָּחֲךָ֥ לִבֶּ֑ךָ וּֽמַה־יִּרְזְמ֥וּן עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
How your heart has carried you away,
How your eyes have failed you,
Transliteration: mah-yikachakha livekha umah-yirezemun eyneykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תָשִׁ֣יב אֶל־אֵ֣ל רוּחֶ֑ךָ וְהֹצֵ֖אתָ מִפִּ֣יךָ מִלִּֽין׃
Translated:
That you could vent your anger on God,
And let such words out of your mouth!
Transliteration: khiy-tashiyv el-el ruchekha vehotseta mifiykha miliyn

Hebrew: מָה־אֱנ֥וֹשׁ כִּֽי־יִזְכֶּ֑ה וְכִי־יִ֝צְדַּ֗ק יְל֣וּד אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated:
What is man that he can be cleared of guilt,
One born of woman, that he be in the right?
Transliteration: mah-envosh khiy-yizekheh vekhiy-yitsedak yelud ishah

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן בִּ֭קְדֹשָׁו לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ין וְ֝שָׁמַ֗יִם לֹא־זַכּ֥וּ בְעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
He puts no trust in His holy ones;
The heavens are not guiltless in His sight;
Transliteration: hen vikedoshav lo yaamiyn veshamayiim lo-zakhu veeynayv

Hebrew: אַ֭ף כִּי־נִתְעָ֥ב וְֽנֶאֱלָ֑ח אִישׁ־שֹׁתֶ֖ה כַמַּ֣יִם עַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
What then of one loathsome and foul,
Man, who drinks wrongdoing like water!
Transliteration: af khiy-niteav veneelach iysh-shoteh khamayiim avelah

Hebrew: אֲחַוְךָ֥ שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י וְזֶֽה־חָ֝זִ֗יתִי וַאֲסַפֵּֽרָה׃
Translated:
I will hold forth; listen to me;
What I have seen, I will declare—
Transliteration: achavekha shema-liy vezeh-chaziytiy vaasaferah

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־חֲכָמִ֥ים יַגִּ֑ידוּ וְלֹ֥א כִ֝חֲד֗וּ מֵאֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
That which wise men have transmitted from their fathers,
And have not withheld,
Transliteration: asher-chakhamiym yagiydu velo khichadu meavvotam

Hebrew: לָהֶ֣ם לְ֭בַדָּם נִתְּנָ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־עָ֖בַר זָ֣ר בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated:
To whom alone the land was given,
No stranger passing among them:
Transliteration: lahem levadam nitenah haarets velo-avar zar vetvokham

Hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י רָ֭שָׁע ה֣וּא מִתְחוֹלֵ֑ל וּמִסְפַּ֥ר שָׁ֝נִ֗ים נִצְפְּנ֥וּ לֶעָרִֽיץ׃
Translated:
The wicked man writhes in torment all his days;
Few years are reserved for the ruthless.
Transliteration: khׇl-yemey rasha hu mitechvolel umisefar shaniym nitsefenu leariyts

Hebrew: קוֹל־פְּחָדִ֥ים בְּאׇזְנָ֑יו בַּ֝שָּׁל֗וֹם שׁוֹדֵ֥ד יְבוֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Frightening sounds fill his ears;
When he is at ease a robber falls upon him.
Transliteration: kvol-fechadiym veׇzenayv vashalvom shvoded yevvoenu

Hebrew: לֹא־יַאֲמִ֣ין שׁ֭וּב מִנִּי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ (וצפו) [וְצָפ֖וּי] ה֣וּא אֱלֵי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
He is never sure he will come back from the dark;
A sword stares him in the face.
Transliteration: lo-yaamiyn shuv miniy-choshekhe (vtsfv) [vetsafuy] hu eley-charev

Hebrew: נֹ֘דֵ֤ד ה֣וּא לַלֶּ֣חֶם אַיֵּ֑ה יָדַ֓ע ׀ כִּי־נָכ֖וֹן בְּיָד֣וֹ יֽוֹם־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
He wanders about for bread—where is it?
He knows that the day of darkness has been readied for him.
Transliteration: noded hu lalechem ayeh yada khiy-nakhvon veyadvo yvom-choshekhe

Hebrew: יְֽ֭בַעֲתֻהוּ צַ֣ר וּמְצוּקָ֑ה תִּ֝תְקְפֵ֗הוּ כְּמֶ֤לֶךְ ׀ עָתִ֬יד לַכִּידֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Troubles terrify him, anxiety overpowers him,
Like a king expecting a siege.
Transliteration: yevaatuhu tsar umetsukah titekefehu khemelekhe atiyd lakhiydvor

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נָטָ֣ה אֶל־אֵ֣ל יָד֑וֹ וְאֶל־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י יִתְגַּבָּֽר׃
Translated:
For he has raised his arm against God
And played the hero against the Almighty.
Transliteration: khiy-natah el-el yadvo veel-shaday yitegavar

Hebrew: יָר֣וּץ אֵלָ֣יו בְּצַוָּ֑אר בַּ֝עֲבִ֗י גַּבֵּ֥י מָגִנָּֽיו׃
Translated:
He runs at Him defiantly
With his thickly bossed shield.
Transliteration: yaruts elayv vetsavar vaaviy gavey maginayv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כִסָּ֣ה פָנָ֣יו בְּחֶלְבּ֑וֹ וַיַּ֖עַשׂ פִּימָ֣ה עֲלֵי־כָֽסֶל׃
Translated:
His face is covered with fat
And his loins with blubber.-a
Transliteration: khiy-khisah fanayv vechelevvo vayaash fiymah aley-khasel

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכּ֤וֹן ׀ עָ֘רִ֤ים נִכְחָד֗וֹת בָּ֭תִּים לֹא־יֵ֣שְׁבוּ לָ֑מוֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר הִתְעַתְּד֣וּ לְגַלִּֽים׃
Translated:
He dwells in cities doomed to ruin,
In houses that shall not be lived in,
That are destined to become heaps of rubble.
Transliteration: vayishekhvon ariym nikhechadvot vatiym lo-eishevu lamvo asher hiteatedu legaliym

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יֶ֭עְשַׁר וְלֹא־יָק֣וּם חֵיל֑וֹ וְלֹא־יִטֶּ֖ה לָאָ֣רֶץ מִנְלָֽם׃
Translated:
He will not be rich;
His wealth will not endure;
His produce shall not bend to the earth.
Transliteration: lo-yeeshar velo-yakum cheylvo velo-yiteh laarets minelam

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָס֨וּר ׀ מִנִּי־חֹ֗שֶׁךְ יֹ֭נַקְתּוֹ תְּיַבֵּ֣שׁ שַׁלְהָ֑בֶת וְ֝יָס֗וּר בְּר֣וּחַ פִּֽיו׃
Translated:
He will never get away from the darkness;
Flames will sear his shoots;
He will pass away by the breath of His mouth.
Transliteration: lo-yasur miniy-choshekhe yonaketvo teyavesh shalehavet veyasur verucha fiyv

Hebrew: אַל־יַאֲמֵ֣ן בַּשָּׁ֣ו נִתְעָ֑ה כִּי־שָׁ֝֗וְא תִּהְיֶ֥ה תְמוּרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He will not be trusted;
He will be misled by falsehood,
And falsehood will be his recompense.a
Transliteration: al-yaamen vashav niteah khiy-shave tiheyeh temuratvo

Hebrew: בְּֽלֹא־י֭וֹמוֹ תִּמָּלֵ֑א וְ֝כִפָּת֗וֹ לֹ֣א רַעֲנָֽנָה׃
Translated:
He will wither before his time,
His boughs never having flourished.
Transliteration: velo-yvomvo timale vekhifatvo lo raananah

Hebrew: יַחְמֹ֣ס כַּגֶּ֣פֶן בִּסְר֑וֹ וְיַשְׁלֵ֥ךְ כַּ֝זַּ֗יִת נִצָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He will drop his unripe grapes like a vine;
He will shed his blossoms like an olive tree.
Transliteration: yachemos khagefen viservo veyashelekhe khazayiit nitsatvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עֲדַ֣ת חָנֵ֣ף גַּלְמ֑וּד וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ אָכְלָ֥ה אׇהֳלֵי־שֹֽׁחַד׃
Translated:
For the company of the impious is desolate;
Fire consumes the tents of the briber;
Transliteration: khiy-adat chanef galemud veesh akhelah ׇholey-shochad

Hebrew: הָרֹ֣ה עָ֭מָל וְיָ֣לֹֽד אָ֑וֶן וּ֝בִטְנָ֗ם תָּכִ֥ין מִרְמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
For they have conceived mischief, given birth to evil,
And their womb has produced deceit.
Transliteration: haroh amal veyalod aven uvitenam takhiyn miremah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי כְאֵ֣לֶּה רַבּ֑וֹת מְנַחֲמֵ֖י עָמָ֣ל כֻּלְּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
I have often heard such things;
You are all mischievous comforters.
Transliteration: shamaetiy kheeleh ravvot menachamey amal khulekhem

Hebrew: הֲקֵ֥ץ לְדִבְרֵי־ר֑וּחַ א֥וֹ מַה־יַּ֝מְרִֽיצְךָ֗ כִּ֣י תַֽעֲנֶֽה׃
Translated:
Have windy words no limit?
What afflicts you that you speak on?
Transliteration: hakets lediverey-rucha vo mah-yameriytsekha khiy taaneh

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם ׀ אָנֹכִי֮ כָּכֶ֢ם אֲדַ֫בֵּ֥רָה ל֤וּ יֵ֪שׁ נַפְשְׁכֶ֡ם תַּ֤חַת נַפְשִׁ֗י אַחְבִּ֣ירָה עֲלֵיכֶ֣ם בְּמִלִּ֑ים וְאָנִ֥יעָה עֲ֝לֵיכֶ֗ם בְּמ֣וֹ רֹאשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
I would also talk like you
If you were in my place;
I would barrage you with words,
I would wag my head over you.
Transliteration: gam anokhiy khakhe֢m adaverah lu eish nafeshekhem tachat nafeshiy acheviyrah aleykhem vemiliym veaniyah aleykhem vemvo roshiy

Hebrew: אֲאַמִּצְכֶ֥ם בְּמוֹ־פִ֑י וְנִ֖יד שְׂפָתַ֣י יַחְשֹֽׂךְ׃
Translated:
I would encourage you with words,
My moving lips would bring relief.
Transliteration: aamitsekhem vemvo-fiy veniyd shefatay yacheshokhe

Hebrew: אִֽם־אֲ֭דַבְּרָה לֹא־יֵחָשֵׂ֣ךְ כְּאֵבִ֑י וְ֝אַחְדְּלָ֗ה מַה־מִּנִּ֥י יַהֲלֹֽךְ׃
Translated:
If I speak, my pain will not be relieved,
And if I do not—what have I lost?
Transliteration: im-adaverah lo-eichashekhe kheeviy veachedelah mah-miniy yahalokhe

Hebrew: אַךְ־עַתָּ֥ה הֶלְאָ֑נִי הֲ֝שִׁמּ֗וֹתָ כׇּל־עֲדָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Now He has truly worn me out;
You have destroyed my whole community.
Transliteration: akhe-atah heleaniy hashimvota khׇl-adatiy

Hebrew: וַֽ֭תִּקְמְטֵנִי לְעֵ֣ד הָיָ֑ה וַיָּ֥קׇם בִּ֥י כַ֝חֲשִׁ֗י בְּפָנַ֥י יַעֲנֶֽה׃
Translated:
You have shriveled me;
My gauntness serves as a witness,
And testifies against me.
Transliteration: vatikemeteniy leed hayah vayakׇm viy khachashiy vefanay yaaneh

Hebrew: אַפּ֤וֹ טָרַ֨ף ׀ וַֽיִּשְׂטְמֵ֗נִי חָרַ֣ק עָלַ֣י בְּשִׁנָּ֑יו צָרִ֓י ׀ יִלְטֹ֖שׁ עֵינָ֣יו לִֽי׃
Translated:
In His anger He tears and persecutes me;
He gnashes His teeth at me;
My foe stabs me with his eyes.
Transliteration: afvo taraf vayishetemeniy charak alay veshinayv tsariy yiletosh eynayv liy

Hebrew: פָּעֲר֬וּ עָלַ֨י ׀ בְּפִיהֶ֗ם בְּ֭חֶרְפָּה הִכּ֣וּ לְחָיָ֑י יַ֝֗חַד עָלַ֥י יִתְמַלָּאֽוּן׃
Translated:
They open wide their mouths at me;
Reviling me, they strike my cheeks;
They inflame themselves against me.
Transliteration: faaru alay vefiyhem vecherefah hikhu lechayay yachad alay yitemalaun

Hebrew: יַסְגִּירֵ֣נִי אֵ֭ל אֶ֣ל עֲוִ֑יל וְעַל־יְדֵ֖י רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִרְטֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
God hands me over to an evil man,
Thrusts me into the clutches of the wicked.
Transliteration: yasegiyreniy el el aviyl veal-yedey reshaiym yireteniy

Hebrew: שָׁ֘לֵ֤ו הָיִ֨יתִי ׀ וַֽיְפַרְפְּרֵ֗נִי וְאָחַ֣ז בְּ֭עׇרְפִּי וַֽיְפַצְפְּצֵ֑נִי וַיְקִימֵ֥נִי ל֝֗וֹ לְמַטָּרָֽה׃
Translated:
I had been untroubled, and He broke me in pieces;
He took me by the scruff and shattered me;
He set me up as His target;
Transliteration: shalev hayiytiy vayefarefereniy veachaz veׇrefiy vayefatsefetseniy vayekiymeniy lvo lematarah

Hebrew: יָ֘סֹ֤בּוּ עָלַ֨י ׀ רַבָּ֗יו יְפַלַּ֣ח כִּ֭לְיוֹתַי וְלֹ֣א יַחְמֹ֑ל יִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ לָ֝אָ֗רֶץ מְרֵרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
His bowmen surrounded me;
He pierced my kidneys; He showed no mercy;
He spilled my bile onto the ground.
Transliteration: yasovu alay ravayv yefalach khileyvotay velo yachemol yishefokhe laarets mereratiy

Hebrew: יִפְרְצֵ֣נִי פֶ֭רֶ<small>ץ</small> עַל־פְּנֵי־פָ֑רֶץ יָרֻ֖ץ עָלַ֣י כְּגִבּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
He breached me, breach after breach;
He rushed at me like a warrior.
Transliteration: yiferetseniy fere<small>ts</small> al-feney-farets yaruts alay khegivvor

Hebrew: שַׂ֣ק תָּ֭פַרְתִּי עֲלֵ֣י גִלְדִּ֑י וְעֹלַ֖לְתִּי בֶעָפָ֣ר קַרְנִֽי׃
Translated:
I sewed sackcloth over my skin;
I buried my glory in the dust.
Transliteration: shak tafaretiy aley gilediy veolaletiy veafar kareniy

Hebrew: פָּנַ֣י (חמרמרה) [חֳ֭מַרְמְרוּ] מִנִּי־בֶ֑כִי וְעַ֖ל עַפְעַפַּ֣י צַלְמָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
My face is red with weeping;
Darkness covers my eyes
Transliteration: fanay (chmrmrh) [chomaremeru] miniy-vekhiy veal afeafay tsalemavet

Hebrew: עַ֭ל לֹא־חָמָ֣ס בְּכַפָּ֑י וּֽתְפִלָּתִ֥י זַכָּֽה׃
Translated:
For no injustice on my part
And for the purity of my prayer!
Transliteration: al lo-chamas vekhafay utefilatiy zakhah

Hebrew: אֶ֭רֶץ אַל־תְּכַסִּ֣י דָמִ֑י וְֽאַל־יְהִ֥י מָ֝ק֗וֹם לְזַעֲקָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Earth, do not cover my blood;
Let there be no resting place for my outcry!
Transliteration: erets al-tekhasiy damiy veal-yehiy makvom lezaakatiy

Hebrew: גַּם־עַ֭תָּה הִנֵּה־בַשָּׁמַ֣יִם עֵדִ֑י וְ֝שָׂהֲדִ֗י בַּמְּרֹמִֽים׃
Translated:
Surely now my witness is in heaven;
He who can testify for me is on high.
Transliteration: gam-atah hineh-vashamayiim ediy veshahadiy vameromiym

Hebrew: מְלִיצַ֥י רֵעָ֑י אֶל־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ דָּלְפָ֥ה עֵינִֽי׃
Translated:
O my advocates, my fellows,
Before God my eyes shed tears;
Transliteration: meliytsay reay el-elvoha dalefah eyniy

Hebrew: וְיוֹכַ֣ח לְגֶ֣בֶר עִם־אֱל֑וֹהַּ וּֽבֶן־אָדָ֥ם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Let Him arbitrate between a man and God
As between a man and his fellow.
Transliteration: veyvokhach legever im-elvoha uven-adam lereehu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שְׁנ֣וֹת מִסְפָּ֣ר יֶאֱתָ֑יוּ וְאֹ֖רַח לֹא־אָשׁ֣וּב אֶהֱלֹֽךְ׃
Translated:
For a few more years will pass,
And I shall go the way of no return.
Transliteration: khiy-shenvot misefar yeetayu veorach lo-ashuv ehelokhe

Hebrew: רוּחִ֣י חֻ֭בָּלָה יָמַ֥י נִזְעָ֗כוּ קְבָרִ֥ים לִֽי׃
Translated:
My spirit is crushed, my days run out;
The graveyard waits for me.
Transliteration: ruchiy chuvalah yamay nizeakhu kevariym liy

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א הֲ֭תֻלִים עִמָּדִ֑י וּ֝בְהַמְּרוֹתָ֗ם תָּלַ֥ן עֵינִֽי׃
Translated:
Surely mocking men keep me company,
And with their provocations I close my eyes.
Transliteration: im-lo hatuliym imadiy uvehamervotam talan eyniy

Hebrew: שִֽׂימָה־נָּ֭א עׇרְבֵ֣נִי עִמָּ֑ךְ מִ֥י ה֝֗וּא לְיָדִ֥י יִתָּקֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
Come now, stand surety for me!
Who will give his hand on my behalf?
Transliteration: shiymah-na ׇreveniy imakhe miy huu leyadiy yitakea

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לִ֭בָּם צָפַ֣נְתָּ מִשָּׂ֑כֶל עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן לֹ֣א תְרֹמֵֽם׃
Translated:
You have hidden understanding from their minds;
Therefore You must not exalt [them].
Transliteration: khiy-livam tsafaneta mishakhel al-khen lo teromem

Hebrew: לְ֭חֵלֶק יַגִּ֣יד רֵעִ֑ים וְעֵינֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו תִּכְלֶֽנָה׃
Translated:
He informs on his friends for a share [of their property],
And his children’s eyes pine away.
Transliteration: lechelek yagiyd reiym veeyney vanayv tikhelenah

Hebrew: וְֽ֭הִצִּיגַנִי לִמְשֹׁ֣ל עַמִּ֑ים וְתֹ֖פֶת לְפָנִ֣ים אֶהְיֶֽה׃
Translated:
He made me a byword among people;
I have become like Tophet of old.
Transliteration: vehitsiyganiy limeshol amiym vetofet lefaniym eheyeh

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣כַהּ מִכַּ֣עַשׂ עֵינִ֑י וִיצֻרַ֖י כַּצֵּ֣ל כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated:
My eyes fail from vexation;
All shapes seem to me like shadows.
Transliteration: vatekhah mikhaash eyniy viytsuray khatsel khulam

Hebrew: יָשֹׁ֣מּוּ יְשָׁרִ֣ים עַל־זֹ֑את וְ֝נָקִ֗י עַל־חָנֵ֥ף יִתְעֹרָֽר׃
Translated:
The upright are amazed at this;
The pure are aroused against the impious.
Transliteration: yashomu yeshariym al-zot venakiy al-chanef yiteorar

Hebrew: וְיֹאחֵ֣ז צַדִּ֣יק דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּֽטְהׇר־יָ֝דַ֗יִם יֹסִ֥יף אֹֽמֶץ׃
Translated:
The righteous man holds to his way;
He whose hands are clean grows stronger.
Transliteration: veyochez tsadiyk darekhvo utehׇr-yadayiim yosiyf omets

Hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם כֻּלָּ֣ם תָּ֭שֻׁבוּ וּבֹ֣אוּ נָ֑א וְלֹֽא־אֶמְצָ֖א בָכֶ֣ם חָכָֽם׃
Translated:
But all of you, come back now;
I shall not find a wise man among you.
Transliteration: veulam khulam tashuvu uvou na velo-emetsa vakhem chakham

Hebrew: יָמַ֣י עָ֭בְרוּ זִמֹּתַ֣י נִתְּק֑וּ מ֖וֹרָשֵׁ֣י לְבָבִֽי׃
Translated:
My days are done, my tendons severed,
The strings of my heart.
Transliteration: yamay averu zimotay niteku mvorashey levaviy

Hebrew: לַ֭יְלָה לְי֣וֹם יָשִׂ֑ימוּ א֝֗וֹר קָר֥וֹב מִפְּנֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
They say that night is day,
That light is here—in the face of darkness.
Transliteration: layelah leyvom yashiymu vor karvov mifeney-choshekhe

Hebrew: אִם־אֲ֭קַוֶּה שְׁא֣וֹל בֵּיתִ֑י בַּ֝חֹ֗שֶׁךְ רִפַּ֥דְתִּי יְצוּעָֽי׃
Translated:
If I must look forward to Sheol as my home,
And make my bed in the dark place,
Transliteration: im-akaveh shevol veytiy vachoshekhe rifadetiy yetsuay

Hebrew: לַשַּׁ֣חַת קָ֭רָאתִי אָ֣בִי אָ֑תָּה אִמִּ֥י וַ֝אֲחֹתִ֗י לָרִמָּֽה׃
Translated:
Say to the Pit, “You are my father,”
To the maggots, “Mother,” “Sister”—
Transliteration: lashachat karatiy aviy atah imiy vaachotiy larimah

Hebrew: וְ֭אַיֵּה אֵפ֣וֹ תִקְוָתִ֑י וְ֝תִקְוָתִ֗י מִ֣י יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Where, then, is my hope?
Who can see hope for me?
Transliteration: veayeh efvo tikevatiy vetikevatiy miy yeshurenah

Hebrew: בַּדֵּ֣י שְׁאֹ֣ל תֵּרַ֑דְנָה אִם־יַ֖חַד עַל־עָפָ֣ר נָֽחַת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Will it descend to Sheol?
Shall we go down together to the dust?
Transliteration: vadey sheol teradenah im-yachad al-afar nachat {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan viledad hashuchiy vayomar

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֤נָה ׀ תְּשִׂימ֣וּן קִנְצֵ֣י לְמִלִּ֑ין תָּ֝בִ֗ינוּ וְאַחַ֥ר נְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
How long? Put an end to talk!
Consider, and then we shall speak.
Transliteration: ad-anah teshiymun kinetsey lemiliyn taviynu veachar nedaver

Hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ נֶחְשַׁ֣בְנוּ כַבְּהֵמָ֑ה נִ֝טְמִ֗ינוּ בְּעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Why are we thought of as brutes,
Regarded by you as stupid?
Transliteration: madua necheshavenu khavehemah nitemiynu veeyneykhem

Hebrew: טֹרֵ֥ף נַפְשׁ֗וֹ בְּאַ֫פּ֥וֹ הַֽ֭לְמַעַנְךָ תֵּעָ֣זַב אָ֑רֶץ וְיֶעְתַּק־צ֝֗וּר מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
You who tear yourself to pieces in anger—
Will earth’s order be disrupted for your sake?
Will rocks be dislodged from their place?
Transliteration: toref nafeshvo veafvo halemaanekha teazav arets veyeetak-tsuur mimekomvo

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם א֣וֹר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָ֑ךְ וְלֹא־יִ֝גַּ֗הּ שְׁבִ֣יב אִשּֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Indeed, the light of the wicked fails;
The flame of his fire does not shine.
Transliteration: gam vor reshaiym yideakhe velo-yigah sheviyv ishvo

Hebrew: א֭וֹר חָשַׁ֣ךְ בְּאׇהֳל֑וֹ וְ֝נֵר֗וֹ עָלָ֥יו יִדְעָֽךְ׃
Translated:
The light in his tent darkens;
His lamp fails him.
Transliteration: vor chashakhe veׇholvo venervo alayv yideakhe

Hebrew: יֵ֭צְרוּ צַעֲדֵ֣י אוֹנ֑וֹ וְֽתַשְׁלִיכֵ֥הוּ עֲצָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His iniquitous strides are hobbled;
His schemes overthrow him.
Transliteration: eitseru tsaadey vonvo vetasheliykhehu atsatvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שֻׁלַּ֣ח בְּרֶ֣שֶׁת בְּרַגְלָ֑יו וְעַל־שְׂ֝בָכָ֗ה יִתְהַלָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
He is led by his feet into the net;
He walks onto the toils.
Transliteration: khiy-shulach vereshet veragelayv veal-shevakhah yitehalakhe

Hebrew: יֹאחֵ֣ז בְּעָקֵ֣ב פָּ֑ח יַחֲזֵ֖ק עָלָ֣יו צַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
The trap seizes his heel;
The noose tightens on him.
Transliteration: yochez veakev fach yachazek alayv tsamiym

Hebrew: טָמ֣וּן בָּאָ֣רֶץ חַבְל֑וֹ וּ֝מַלְכֻּדְתּ֗וֹ עֲלֵ֣י נָתִֽיב׃
Translated:
The rope for him lies hidden on the ground;
His snare, on the path.
Transliteration: tamun vaarets chavelvo umalekhudetvo aley natiyv

Hebrew: סָ֭בִיב בִּעֲתֻ֣הוּ בַלָּה֑וֹת וֶהֱפִיצֻ֥הוּ לְרַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Terrors assault him on all sides
And send his feet flying.
Transliteration: saviyv viatuhu valahvot vehefiytsuhu leragelayv

Hebrew: יְהִי־רָעֵ֥ב אֹנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֵ֗יד נָכ֥וֹן לְצַלְעֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His progeny hunger;
Disaster awaits his wife.
Transliteration: yehiy-raev onvo veeyd nakhvon letsalevo

Hebrew: יֹ֭אכַל בַּדֵּ֣י עוֹר֑וֹ יֹאכַ֥ל בַּ֝דָּ֗יו בְּכ֣וֹר מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
The tendons under his skin are consumed;
Death’s first-born consumes his tendons.
Transliteration: yokhal vadey vorvo yokhal vadayv vekhvor mavet

Hebrew: יִנָּתֵ֣ק מֵ֭אׇהֳלוֹ מִבְטַח֑וֹ וְ֝תַצְעִדֵ֗הוּ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בַּלָּהֽוֹת׃
Translated:
He is torn from the safety of his tent;
Terror marches him to the king.
Transliteration: yinatek meׇholvo mivetachvo vetatseidehu lemelekhe valahvot

Hebrew: תִּשְׁכּ֣וֹן בְּ֭אׇהֳלוֹ מִבְּלִיל֑וֹ יְזֹרֶ֖ה עַל־נָוֵ֣הוּ גׇפְרִֽית׃
Translated:
It lodges in his desolate tent;
Sulfur is strewn upon his home.
Transliteration: tishekhvon veׇholvo miveliylvo yezoreh al-navehu gׇferiyt

Hebrew: מִ֭תַּחַת שׇׁרָשָׁ֣יו יִבָ֑שׁוּ וּ֝מִמַּ֗עַל יִמַּ֥ל קְצִירֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His roots below dry up,
And above, his branches wither.
Transliteration: mitachat shׇrashayv yivashu umimaal yimal ketsiyrvo

Hebrew: זִֽכְרוֹ־אָ֭בַד מִנִּי־אָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־שֵׁ֥ם ל֝֗וֹ עַל־פְּנֵי־חֽוּץ׃
Translated:
All mention of him vanishes from the earth;
He has no name abroad.
Transliteration: zikhervo-avad miniy-arets velo-shem lvo al-feney-chuts

Hebrew: יֶ֭הְדְּפֻהוּ מֵא֣וֹר אֶל־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וּֽמִתֵּבֵ֥ל יְנִדֻּֽהוּ׃
Translated:
He is thrust from light to darkness,
Driven from the world.
Transliteration: yehedefuhu mevor el-choshekhe umitevel yeniduhu

Hebrew: לֹ֘א־נִ֤ין ל֣וֹ וְלֹא־נֶ֣כֶד בְּעַמּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ין שָׂ֝רִ֗יד בִּמְגוּרָֽיו׃
Translated:
He has no seed or breed among his people,
No survivor where he once lived.
Transliteration: lo-niyn lvo velo-nekhed veamvo veeyn shariyd vimegurayv

Hebrew: עַל־י֭וֹמוֹ נָשַׁ֣מּוּ אַחֲרֹנִ֑ים וְ֝קַדְמֹנִ֗ים אָ֣חֲזוּ שָֽׂעַר׃
Translated:
Generations to come will be appalled at his fate,
As the previous ones are seized with horror.
Transliteration: al-yvomvo nashamu acharoniym vekademoniym achazu shaar

Hebrew: אַךְ־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁכְּנ֣וֹת עַוָּ֑ל וְ֝זֶ֗ה מְק֣וֹם לֹֽא־יָדַֽע־אֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
“These were the haunts of the wicked;
Here was the place of him who knew not God.”
Transliteration: akhe-eleh mishekhenvot aval vezeh mekvom lo-yada-el {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֭נָה תּוֹגְי֣וּן נַפְשִׁ֑י וּֽתְדַכּאוּנַ֥נִי בְמִלִּֽים׃
Translated:
How long will you grieve my spirit,
And crush me with words?
Transliteration: ad-anah tvogeyun nafeshiy utedakhunaniy vemiliym

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה עֶ֣שֶׂר פְּ֭עָמִים תַּכְלִימ֑וּנִי לֹֽא־תֵ֝בֹ֗שׁוּ תַּהְכְּרוּ־לִֽי׃
Translated:
Time and again you humiliate me,
And are not ashamed to abuse me.
Transliteration: zeh esher feamiym takheliymuniy lo-tevoshu tahekheru-liy

Hebrew: וְאַף־אׇמְנָ֥ם שָׁגִ֑יתִי אִ֝תִּ֗י תָּלִ֥ין מְשׁוּגָתִֽי׃
Translated:
If indeed I have erred,
My error remains with me.
Transliteration: veaf-ׇmenam shagiytiy itiy taliyn meshugatiy

Hebrew: אִם־אׇ֭מְנָם עָלַ֣י תַּגְדִּ֑ילוּ וְתוֹכִ֥יחוּ עָ֝לַ֗י חֶרְפָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
Though you are overbearing toward me,
Reproaching me with my disgrace,
Transliteration: im-ׇmenam alay tagediylu vetvokhiychu alay cherefatiy

Hebrew: דְּֽעוּ־אֵ֭פוֹ כִּֽי־אֱל֣וֹהַּ עִוְּתָ֑נִי וּ֝מְצוּד֗וֹ עָלַ֥י הִקִּֽיף׃
Translated:
Yet know that God has wronged me;
He has thrown up siege works around me.
Transliteration: deu-efvo khiy-elvoha ivetaniy umetsudvo alay hikiyf

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן אֶצְעַ֣ק חָ֭מָס וְלֹ֣א אֵעָנֶ֑ה אֲ֝שַׁוַּ֗ע וְאֵ֣ין מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
I cry, “Violence!” but am not answered;
I shout, but can get no justice.
Transliteration: hen etseak chamas velo eaneh ashava veeyn mishefat

Hebrew: אׇרְחִ֣י גָ֭דַר וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱב֑וֹר וְעַ֥ל נְ֝תִיבוֹתַ֗י חֹ֣שֶׁךְ יָשִֽׂים׃
Translated:
He has barred my way; I cannot pass;
He has laid darkness upon my path.
Transliteration: ׇrechiy gadar velo eevvor veal netiyvvotay choshekhe yashiym

Hebrew: כְּ֭בוֹדִי מֵעָלַ֣י הִפְשִׁ֑יט וַ֝יָּ֗סַר עֲטֶ֣רֶת רֹאשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
He has stripped me of my glory,
Removed the crown from my head.
Transliteration: khevvodiy mealay hifeshiyt vayasar ateret roshiy

Hebrew: יִתְּצֵ֣נִי סָ֭בִיב וָאֵלַ֑ךְ וַיַּסַּ֥ע כָּ֝עֵ֗ץ תִּקְוָתִֽי׃
Translated:
He tears down every part of me; I perish;
He uproots my hope like a tree.
Transliteration: yitetseniy saviyv vaelakhe vayasa khaets tikevatiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣חַר עָלַ֣י אַפּ֑וֹ וַיַּחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי ל֣וֹ כְצָרָֽיו׃
Translated:
He kindles His anger against me;
He regards me as one of His foes.
Transliteration: vayachar alay afvo vayachesheveniy lvo khetsarayv

Hebrew: יַ֤חַד ׀ יָ֘בֹ֤אוּ גְדוּדָ֗יו וַיָּסֹ֣לּוּ עָלַ֣י דַּרְכָּ֑ם וַיַּחֲנ֖וּ סָבִ֣יב לְאׇהֳלִֽי׃
Translated:
His troops advance together;
They build their road toward me
And encamp around my tent.
Transliteration: yachad yavou gedudayv vayasolu alay darekham vayachanu saviyv leׇholiy

Hebrew: אַ֭חַי מֵעָלַ֣י הִרְחִ֑יק וְ֝יֹדְעַ֗י אַךְ־זָ֥רוּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
He alienated my kin from me;
My acquaintances disown me.
Transliteration: achay mealay hirechiyk veyodeay akhe-zaru mimeniy

Hebrew: חָדְל֥וּ קְרוֹבָ֑י וּֽמְיֻדָּעַ֥י שְׁכֵחֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
My relatives are gone;
My friends have forgotten me.
Transliteration: chadelu kervovay umeyudaay shekhechuniy

Hebrew: גָּ֘רֵ֤י בֵיתִ֣י וְ֭אַמְהֹתַי לְזָ֣ר תַּחְשְׁבֻ֑נִי נׇ֝כְרִ֗י הָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
My dependents and maidservants regard me as a stranger;
I am an outsider to them.
Transliteration: garey veytiy veamehotay lezar tacheshevuniy nׇkheriy hayiytiy veeyneyhem

Hebrew: לְעַבְדִּ֣י קָ֭רָאתִי וְלֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֑ה בְּמוֹ־פִ֝֗י אֶתְחַנֶּן־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I summon my servant but he does not respond;
I must myself entreat him.
Transliteration: leavediy karatiy velo yaaneh vemvo-fiy etechanen-lvo

Hebrew: ר֭וּחִי זָ֣רָה לְאִשְׁתִּ֑י וְ֝חַנֹּתִ֗י לִבְנֵ֥י בִטְנִֽי׃
Translated:
My odor is repulsive to my wife;
I am loathsome to my children.
Transliteration: ruchiy zarah leishetiy vechanotiy liveney viteniy

Hebrew: גַּם־עֲ֭וִילִים מָ֣אֲסוּ בִ֑י אָ֝ק֗וּמָה וַיְדַבְּרוּ־בִֽי׃
Translated:
Even youngsters disdain me;
When I rise, they speak against me.
Transliteration: gam-aviyliym maasu viy akumah vayedaveru-viy

Hebrew: תִּ֭עֲבוּנִי כׇּל־מְתֵ֣י סוֹדִ֑י וְזֶה־אָ֝הַ֗בְתִּי נֶהְפְּכוּ־בִֽי׃
Translated:
All my bosom friends detest me;
Those I love have turned against me.
Transliteration: tiavuniy khׇl-metey svodiy vezeh-ahavetiy nehefekhu-viy

Hebrew: בְּעוֹרִ֣י וּ֭בִבְשָׂרִי דָּבְקָ֣ה עַצְמִ֑י וָ֝אֶתְמַלְּטָ֗ה בְּע֣וֹר שִׁנָּֽי׃
Translated:
My bones stick to my skin and flesh;
I escape with the skin of my teeth.
Transliteration: vevoriy uviveshariy davekah atsemiy vaetemaletah vevor shinay

Hebrew: חׇנֻּ֬נִי חׇנֻּ֣נִי אַתֶּ֣ם רֵעָ֑י כִּ֥י יַד־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ נָ֣גְעָה בִּֽי׃
Translated:
Pity me, pity me! You are my friends;
For the hand of God has struck me!
Transliteration: chׇnuniy chׇnuniy atem reay khiy yad-elvoha nageah viy

Hebrew: לָ֭מָּה תִּרְדְּפֻ֣נִי כְמוֹ־אֵ֑ל וּ֝מִבְּשָׂרִ֗י לֹ֣א תִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Why do you pursue me like God,
Maligning me insatiably?
Transliteration: lamah tiredefuniy khemvo-el umiveshariy lo tishevau

Hebrew: מִי־יִתֵּ֣ן אֵ֭פוֹ וְיִכָּתְב֣וּן מִלָּ֑י מִי־יִתֵּ֖ן בַּסֵּ֣פֶר וְיֻחָֽקוּ׃
Translated:
O that my words were written down;
Would they were inscribed in a record,
Transliteration: miy-yiten efvo veyikhatevun milay miy-yiten vasefer veyuchaku

Hebrew: בְּעֵט־בַּרְזֶ֥ל וְעֹפָ֑רֶת לָ֝עַ֗ד בַּצּ֥וּר יֵחָצְבֽוּן׃
Translated:
Incised on a rock forever
With iron stylus and lead!
Transliteration: veet-varezel veofaret laad vatsur eichatsevun

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י יָ֭דַעְתִּי גֹּ֣אֲלִי חָ֑י וְ֝אַחֲר֗וֹן עַל־עָפָ֥ר יָקֽוּם׃
Translated:
But I know that my Vindicator lives;
In the end He will testify on earth—
Transliteration: vaaniy yadaetiy goaliy chay veacharvon al-afar yakum

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֣ר ע֭וֹרִי נִקְּפוּ־זֹ֑את וּ֝מִבְּשָׂרִ֗י אֶחֱזֶ֥ה אֱלֽוֹהַּ׃
Translated:
This, after my skin will have been peeled off.
But I would behold God while still in my flesh,
Transliteration: veachar voriy nikefu-zot umiveshariy echezeh elvoha

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִ֨י ׀ אֶחֱזֶה־לִּ֗י וְעֵינַ֣י רָא֣וּ וְלֹא־זָ֑ר כָּל֖וּ כִלְיֹתַ֣י בְּחֵקִֽי׃
Translated:
I myself, not another, would behold Him;
Would see with my own eyes:
My heart pines within me.
Transliteration: asher aniy echezeh-liy veeynay rau velo-zar khalu khileyotay vechekiy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תֹ֭אמְרוּ מַה־נִּרְדׇּף־ל֑וֹ וְשֹׁ֥רֶשׁ דָּ֝בָ֗ר נִמְצָא־בִֽי׃
Translated:
You say, “How do we persecute him?
The root of the matter is in him.”
Transliteration: khiy tomeru mah-niredׇf-lvo veshoresh davar nimetsa-viy

Hebrew: גּ֤וּרוּ לָכֶ֨ם ׀ מִפְּנֵי־חֶ֗רֶב כִּֽי־חֵ֭מָה עֲוֺנ֣וֹת חָ֑רֶב לְמַ֖עַן תֵּדְע֣וּן (שדין) [שַׁדּֽוּן]׃ {פ}
Translated:
Be in fear of the sword,
For [your] fury is iniquity worthy of the sword;
Know there is a judgment!
Transliteration: guru lakhem mifeney-cherev khiy-chemah avonvot charev lemaan tedeun (shdyn) [shadun] {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן צֹפַ֥ר הַֽנַּעֲמָתִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Zophar the Naamathite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan tsofar hanaamatiy vayomar

Hebrew: לָ֭כֵן שְׂעִפַּ֣י יְשִׁיב֑וּנִי וּ֝בַעֲב֗וּר ח֣וּשִׁי בִֽי׃
Translated:
In truth, my thoughts urge me to answer
(It is because of my feelings
Transliteration: lakhen sheifay yeshiyvuniy uvaavur chushiy viy

Hebrew: מוּסַ֣ר כְּלִמָּתִ֣י אֶשְׁמָ֑ע וְ֝ר֗וּחַ מִֽבִּינָתִ֥י יַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
When I hear reproof that insults me);
A spirit out of my understanding makes me reply:
Transliteration: musar khelimatiy eshema verucha miviynatiy yaaneniy

Hebrew: הֲזֹ֣את יָ֭דַעְתָּ מִנִּי־עַ֑ד מִנִּ֤י שִׂ֖ים אָדָ֣ם עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Do you not know this, that from time immemorial,
Since man was set on earth,
Transliteration: hazot yadaeta miniy-ad miniy shiym adam aley-arets

Hebrew: כִּ֤י רִנְנַ֣ת רְ֭שָׁעִים מִקָּר֑וֹב וְשִׂמְחַ֖ת חָנֵ֣ף עֲדֵי־רָֽגַע׃
Translated:
The joy of the wicked has been brief,
The happiness of the impious, fleeting?
Transliteration: khiy rinenat reshaiym mikarvov veshimechat chanef adey-raga

Hebrew: אִם־יַעֲלֶ֣ה לַשָּׁמַ֣יִם שִׂיא֑וֹ וְ֝רֹאשׁ֗וֹ לָעָ֥ב יַגִּֽיעַ׃
Translated:
Though he grows as high as the sky,
His head reaching the clouds,
Transliteration: im-yaaleh lashamayiim shiyvo veroshvo laav yagiya

Hebrew: כְּֽ֭גֶלְלוֹ לָנֶ֣צַח יֹאבֵ֑ד רֹ֝אָ֗יו יֹאמְר֥וּ אַיּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He perishes forever, like his dung;
Those who saw him will say, “Where is he?”
Transliteration: khegelelvo lanetsach yoved roayv yomeru ayyvo

Hebrew: כַּחֲל֣וֹם יָ֭עוּף וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָא֑וּהוּ וְ֝יֻדַּ֗ד כְּחֶזְי֥וֹן לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
He flies away like a dream and cannot be found;
He is banished like a night vision.
Transliteration: khachalvom yauf velo yimetsauhu veyudad khechezeyvon layelah

Hebrew: עַ֣יִן שְׁ֭זָפַתּוּ וְלֹ֣א תוֹסִ֑יף וְלֹֽא־ע֝֗וֹד תְּשׁוּרֶ֥נּוּ מְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Eyes that glimpsed him do so no more;
They cannot see him in his place any longer.
Transliteration: ayiin shezafatu velo tvosiyf velo-vod teshurenu mekvomvo

Hebrew: בָּ֭נָיו יְרַצּ֣וּ דַלִּ֑ים וְ֝יָדָ֗יו תָּשֵׁ֥בְנָה אוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His sons ingratiate themselves with the poor;
His own hands must give back his wealth.
Transliteration: vanayv yeratsu daliym veyadayv tashevenah vonvo

Hebrew: עַ֭צְמוֹתָיו מָלְא֣וּ עֲלוּמָ֑ו וְ֝עִמּ֗וֹ עַל־עָפָ֥ר תִּשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated:
His bones, still full of vigor,
Lie down in the dust with him.
Transliteration: atsemvotayv maleu alumav veimvo al-afar tishekhav

Hebrew: אִם־תַּמְתִּ֣יק בְּפִ֣יו רָעָ֑ה יַ֝כְחִידֶ֗נָּה תַּ֣חַת לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Though evil is sweet to his taste,
And he conceals it under his tongue;
Transliteration: im-tametiyk vefiyv raah yakhechiydenah tachat leshonvo

Hebrew: יַחְמֹ֣ל עָ֭לֶיהָ וְלֹ֣א יַעַזְבֶ֑נָּה וְ֝יִמְנָעֶ֗נָּה בְּת֣וֹךְ חִכּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Though he saves it, does not let it go,
Holds it inside his mouth,
Transliteration: yachemol aleyha velo yaazevenah veyiimenaenah vetvokhe chikhvo

Hebrew: לַ֭חְמוֹ בְּמֵעָ֣יו נֶהְפָּ֑ךְ מְרוֹרַ֖ת פְּתָנִ֣ים בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His food in his bowels turns
Into asps’ venom within him.
Transliteration: lachemvo vemeayv nehefakhe mervorat fetaniym vekirevvo

Hebrew: חַ֣יִל בָּ֭לַע וַיְקִאֶ֑נּוּ מִ֝בִּטְנ֗וֹ יֹרִשֶׁ֥נּוּ אֵֽל׃
Translated:
The riches he swallows he vomits;
God empties it out of his stomach.
Transliteration: chayiil vala vayekienu mivitenvo yorishenu el

Hebrew: רֹאשׁ־פְּתָנִ֥ים יִינָ֑ק תַּ֝הַרְגֵ֗הוּ לְשׁ֣וֹן אֶפְעֶֽה׃
Translated:
He sucks the poison of asps;
The tongue of the viper kills him.
Transliteration: rosh-fetaniym yiynak taharegehu leshvon efeeh

Hebrew: אַל־יֵ֥רֶא בִפְלַגּ֑וֹת נַהֲרֵ֥י נַ֝חֲלֵ֗י דְּבַ֣שׁ וְחֶמְאָֽה׃
Translated:
Let him not enjoy the streams,
The rivers of honey, the brooks of cream.
Transliteration: al-eire vifelagvot naharey nachaley devash vechemeah

Hebrew: מֵשִׁ֣יב יָ֭גָע וְלֹ֣א יִבְלָ֑ע כְּחֵ֥יל תְּ֝מוּרָת֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲלֹֽס׃
Translated:
He will give back the goods unswallowed;
The value of the riches, undigested.
Transliteration: meshiyv yaga velo yivela khecheyl temuratvo velo yaalos

Hebrew: כִּֽי־רִ֭צַּץ עָזַ֣ב דַּלִּ֑ים בַּ֥יִת גָּ֝זַ֗ל וְלֹ֣א יִבְנֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Because he crushed and tortured the poor,
He will not build up the house he took by force.
Transliteration: khiy-ritsats azav daliym vayiit gazal velo yivenehu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־יָדַ֣ע שָׁלֵ֣ו בְּבִטְנ֑וֹ בַּ֝חֲמוּד֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּֽט׃
Translated:
He will not see his children tranquil;
He will not preserve one of his dear ones.
Transliteration: khiy lo-yada shalev vevitenvo vachamudvo lo yemalet

Hebrew: אֵין־שָׂרִ֥יד לְאׇכְל֑וֹ עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן לֹא־יָחִ֥יל טוּבֽוֹ׃
Translated:
With no survivor to enjoy it,
His fortune will not prosper.
Transliteration: eyn-shariyd leׇkhelvo al-khen lo-yachiyl tuvvo

Hebrew: בִּמְלֹ֣אות שִׂ֭פְקוֹ יֵ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ כׇּל־יַ֖ד עָמֵ֣ל תְּבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
When he has all he wants, trouble will come;
Misfortunes of all kinds will batter him.
Transliteration: vimelovt shifekvo eitser lvo khׇl-yad amel tevoenu

Hebrew: יְהִ֤י ׀ לְמַלֵּ֬א בִטְנ֗וֹ יְֽשַׁלַּח־בּ֭וֹ חֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֑וֹ וְיַמְטֵ֥ר עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ בִּלְחוּמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let that fill his belly;
Let Him loose His burning anger at him,
And rain down His weapons upon him.
Transliteration: yehiy lemale vitenvo yeshalach-vvo charvon afvo veyameter aleymvo vilechumvo

Hebrew: יִ֭בְרַח מִנֵּ֣שֶׁק בַּרְזֶ֑ל תַּ֝חְלְפֵ֗הוּ קֶ֣שֶׁת נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
Translated:
Fleeing from iron arrows,
He is shot through from a bow of bronze.
Transliteration: yiverach mineshek varezel tachelefehu keshet nechushah

Hebrew: שָׁלַף֮ וַיֵּצֵ֢א מִגֵּ֫וָ֥ה וּ֭בָרָק מִֽמְּרֹרָת֥וֹ יַהֲלֹ֗ךְ עָלָ֥יו אֵמִֽים׃
Translated:
Brandished and run through his body,
The blade, through his gall,
Strikes terror into him.
Transliteration: shalaf vayetse֢ migevah uvarak mimeroratvo yahalokhe alayv emiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־חֹשֶׁךְ֮ טָמ֢וּן לִצְפּ֫וּנָ֥יו תְּ֭אׇכְלֵהוּ אֵ֣שׁ לֹא־נֻפָּ֑ח יֵ֖רַע שָׂרִ֣יד בְּאׇהֳלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Utter darkness waits for his treasured ones;
A fire fanned by no man will consume him;
Who survives in his tent will be crushed.
Transliteration: khׇl-choshekhe tamun litsefunayv teׇkhelehu esh lo-nufach eira shariyd veׇholvo

Hebrew: יְגַלּ֣וּ שָׁמַ֣יִם עֲוֺנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֶ֗רֶץ מִתְקוֹמָ֘מָ֥ה לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Heaven will expose his iniquity;
Earth will rise up against him.
Transliteration: yegalu shamayiim avonvo veerets mitekvomamah lvo

Hebrew: יִ֭גֶל יְב֣וּל בֵּית֑וֹ נִ֝גָּר֗וֹת בְּי֣וֹם אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His household will be cast forth by a flood,
Spilled out on the day of His wrath.
Transliteration: yigel yevul veytvo nigarvot veyvom afvo

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה ׀ חֵלֶק־אָדָ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע מֵאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְנַחֲלַ֖ת אִמְר֣וֹ מֵאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
This is the wicked man’s portion from God,
The lot God has ordained for him.
Transliteration: zeh chelek-adam rasha meElohim venachalat imervo meel {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ שָׁ֭מוֹעַ מִלָּתִ֑י וּתְהִי־זֹ֝֗את תַּנְח֥וּמֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Listen well to what I say,
And let that be your consolation.
Transliteration: shimeu shamvoa milatiy utehiy-zot tanechumoteykhem

Hebrew: שָׂ֭אוּנִי וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאַחַ֖ר דַּבְּרִ֣י תַלְעִֽיג׃
Translated:
Bear with me while I speak,
And after I have spoken, you may mock.
Transliteration: shauniy veanokhiy adaver veachar daveriy taleiyg

Hebrew: הֶ֭אָנֹכִי לְאָדָ֣ם שִׂיחִ֑י וְאִם־מַ֝דּ֗וּעַ לֹֽא־תִקְצַ֥ר רוּחִֽי׃
Translated:
Is my complaint directed toward a man?
Why should I not lose my patience?
Transliteration: heanokhiy leadam shiychiy veim-madua lo-tiketsar ruchiy

Hebrew: פְּנוּ־אֵלַ֥י וְהָשַׁ֑מּוּ וְשִׂ֖ימוּ יָ֣ד עַל־פֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Look at me and be appalled,
And clap your hand to your mouth.
Transliteration: fenu-elay vehashamu veshiymu yad al-feh

Hebrew: וְאִם־זָכַ֥רְתִּי וְנִבְהָ֑לְתִּי וְאָחַ֥ז בְּ֝שָׂרִ֗י פַּלָּצֽוּת׃
Translated:
When I think of it I am terrified;
My body is seized with shuddering.
Transliteration: veim-zakharetiy venivehaletiy veachaz veshariy falatsut

Hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִֽחְי֑וּ עָ֝תְק֗וּ גַּם־גָּ֥בְרוּ חָֽיִל׃
Translated:
Why do the wicked live on,
Prosper and grow wealthy?
Transliteration: madua reshaiym yicheyu ateku gam-gaveru chayiil

Hebrew: זַרְעָ֤ם נָכ֣וֹן לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם עִמָּ֑ם וְ֝צֶאֱצָאֵיהֶ֗ם לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Their children are with them always,
And they see their children’s children.
Transliteration: zaream nakhvon lifeneyhem imam vetseetsaeyhem leeyneyhem

Hebrew: בָּתֵּיהֶ֣ם שָׁל֣וֹם מִפָּ֑חַד וְלֹ֤א שֵׁ֖בֶט אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Their homes are secure, without fear;
They do not feel the rod of God.
Transliteration: vateyhem shalvom mifachad velo shevet elvoha aleyhem

Hebrew: שׁוֹר֣וֹ עִ֭בַּר וְלֹ֣א יַגְעִ֑ל תְּפַלֵּ֥ט פָּ֝רָת֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א תְשַׁכֵּֽל׃
Translated:
Their bull breeds and does not fail;
Their cow calves and never miscarries;
Transliteration: shvorvo ivar velo yageil tefalet faratvo velo teshakhel

Hebrew: יְשַׁלְּח֣וּ כַ֭צֹּאן עֲוִילֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝יַלְדֵיהֶ֗ם יְרַקֵּדֽוּן׃
Translated:
They let their infants run loose like sheep,
And their children skip about.
Transliteration: yeshalechu khatson aviyleyhem veyaledeyhem yerakedun

Hebrew: יִ֭שְׂאוּ כְּתֹ֣ף וְכִנּ֑וֹר וְ֝יִשְׂמְח֗וּ לְק֣וֹל עוּגָֽב׃
Translated:
They sing to the music of timbrel and lute,
And revel to the tune of the pipe;
Transliteration: yisheu khetof vekhinvor veyiishemechu lekvol ugav

Hebrew: (יבלו) [יְכַלּ֣וּ] בַטּ֣וֹב יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וּ֝בְרֶ֗גַע שְׁא֣וֹל יֵחָֽתּוּ׃
Translated:
They spend their days in happiness,
And go down to Sheol in peace.
Transliteration: (yvlv) [yekhalu] vatvov yemeyhem uverega shevol eichatu

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לָ֭אֵל ס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְדַ֥עַת דְּ֝רָכֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א חָפָֽצְנוּ׃
Translated:
They say to God, “Leave us alone,
We do not want to learn Your ways;
Transliteration: vayomeru lael sur mimenu vedaat derakheykha lo chafatsenu

Hebrew: מַה־שַּׁדַּ֥י כִּֽי־נַעַבְדֶ֑נּוּ וּמַה־נּ֝וֹעִ֗יל כִּ֣י נִפְגַּע־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
What is Shaddai that we should serve Him?
What will we gain by praying to Him?”
Transliteration: mah-shaday khiy-naavedenu umah-nvoiyl khiy nifega-vvo

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן לֹ֣א בְיָדָ֣ם טוּבָ֑ם עֲצַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים רָ֣חֲקָה מֶֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Their happiness is not their own doing.
(The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!)
Transliteration: hen lo veyadam tuvam atsat reshaiym rachakah meniy

Hebrew: כַּמָּ֤ה ׀ נֵר־רְשָׁ֘עִ֤ים יִדְעָ֗ךְ וְיָבֹ֣א עָלֵ֣ימוֹ אֵידָ֑ם חֲ֝בָלִ֗ים יְחַלֵּ֥ק בְּאַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
How seldom does the lamp of the wicked fail,
Does the calamity they deserve befall them,
Does He apportion [their] lot in anger!
Transliteration: khamah ner-reshaiym yideakhe veyavo aleymvo eydam chavaliym yechalek veafvo

Hebrew: יִֽהְי֗וּ כְּתֶ֥בֶן לִפְנֵי־ר֑וּחַ וּ֝כְמֹ֗ץ גְּנָבַ֥תּוּ סוּפָֽה׃
Translated:
Let them become like straw in the wind,
Like chaff carried off by a storm.
Transliteration: yiheyu kheteven lifeney-rucha ukhemots genavatu sufah

Hebrew: אֱל֗וֹהַּ יִצְפֹּן־לְבָנָ֥יו אוֹנ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם אֵלָ֣יו וְיֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
[You say,] “God is reserving his punishment for his sons”;
Let it be paid back to him that he may feel it,
Transliteration: elvoha yitsefon-levanayv vonvo yeshalem elayv veeida

Hebrew: יִרְא֣וּ עֵינָ֣ו כִּיד֑וֹ וּמֵחֲמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Let his eyes see his ruin,
And let him drink the wrath of Shaddai!
Transliteration: yireu eynav khiydvo umechamat shaday yisheteh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מַה־חֶפְצ֣וֹ בְּבֵית֣וֹ אַחֲרָ֑יו וּמִסְפַּ֖ר חֳדָשָׁ֣יו חֻצָּֽצוּ׃
Translated:
For what does he care about the fate of his family,
When his number of months runs out?
Transliteration: khiy mah-chefetsvo veveytvo acharayv umisefar chodashayv chutsatsu

Hebrew: הַלְאֵ֥ל יְלַמֶּד־דָּ֑עַת וְ֝ה֗וּא רָמִ֥ים יִשְׁפּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
Can God be instructed in knowledge,
He who judges from such heights?
Transliteration: haleel yelamed-daat vehu ramiym yishefvot

Hebrew: זֶ֗ה יָ֭מוּת בְּעֶ֣צֶם תֻּמּ֑וֹ כֻּ֝לּ֗וֹ שַׁלְאֲנַ֥ן וְשָׁלֵֽיו׃
Translated:
One man dies in robust health,
All tranquil and untroubled;
Transliteration: zeh yamut veetsem tumvo khulvo shaleanan veshaleyv

Hebrew: עֲ֭טִינָיו מָלְא֣וּ חָלָ֑ב וּמֹ֖חַ עַצְמוֹתָ֣יו יְשֻׁקֶּֽה׃
Translated:
His pails are full of milk;
The marrow of his bones is juicy.
Transliteration: atiynayv maleu chalav umocha atsemvotayv yeshukeh

Hebrew: וְזֶ֗ה יָ֭מוּת בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ מָרָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־אָ֝כַ֗ל בַּטּוֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
Another dies embittered,
Never having tasted happiness.
Transliteration: vezeh yamut venefesh marah velo-akhal vatvovah

Hebrew: יַ֭חַד עַל־עָפָ֣ר יִשְׁכָּ֑בוּ וְ֝רִמָּ֗ה תְּכַסֶּ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
They both lie in the dust
And are covered with worms.
Transliteration: yachad al-afar yishekhavu verimah tekhaseh aleyhem

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן יָ֭דַעְתִּי מַחְשְׁבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וּ֝מְזִמּ֗וֹת עָלַ֥י תַּחְמֹֽסוּ׃
Translated:
Oh, I know your thoughts,
And the tactics you will devise against me.
Transliteration: hen yadaetiy macheshevvoteykhem umezimvot alay tachemosu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תֹאמְר֗וּ אַיֵּ֥ה בֵית־נָדִ֑יב וְ֝אַיֵּ֗ה אֹ֤הֶל ׀ מִשְׁכְּנ֬וֹת רְשָׁעִֽים׃
Translated:
You will say, “Where is the house of the great man—
And where the tent in which the wicked dwelled?”
Transliteration: khiy tomeru ayeh veyt-nadiyv veayeh ohel mishekhenvot reshaiym

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א שְׁ֭אֶלְתֶּם ע֣וֹבְרֵי דָ֑רֶךְ וְ֝אֹתֹתָ֗ם לֹ֣א תְנַכֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
You must have consulted the wayfarers;
You cannot deny their evidence.
Transliteration: halo sheeletem voverey darekhe veototam lo tenakheru

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לְי֣וֹם אֵ֭יד יֵחָ֣שֶׂךְ רָ֑ע לְי֖וֹם עֲבָר֣וֹת יוּבָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
For the evil man is spared on the day of calamity,
On the day when wrath is led forth.
Transliteration: khiy leyvom eyd eichashekhe ra leyvom avarvot yuvalu

Hebrew: מִֽי־יַגִּ֣יד עַל־פָּנָ֣יו דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְהוּא־עָ֝שָׂ֗ה מִ֣י יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who will upbraid him to his face?
Who will requite him for what he has done?
Transliteration: miy-yagiyd al-fanayv darekhvo vehu-ashah miy yeshalem-lvo

Hebrew: וְ֭הוּא לִקְבָר֣וֹת יוּבָ֑ל וְֽעַל־גָּדִ֥ישׁ יִשְׁקֽוֹד׃
Translated:
He is brought to the grave,
While a watch is kept at his tomb.
Transliteration: vehu likevarvot yuval veal-gadiysh yishekvod

Hebrew: מָֽתְקוּ־ל֗וֹ רִגְבֵ֫י־נָ֥חַל וְ֭אַחֲרָיו כׇּל־אָדָ֣ם יִמְשׁ֑וֹךְ וּ֝לְפָנָ֗יו אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
The clods of the wadi are sweet to him,
Everyone follows behind him,
Innumerable are those who precede him.
Transliteration: mateku-lvo rigevey-nachal veacharayv khׇl-adam yimeshvokhe ulefanayv eyn misefar

Hebrew: וְ֭אֵיךְ תְּנַחֲמ֣וּנִי הָ֑בֶל וּ֝תְשׁ֥וּבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם נִשְׁאַר־מָֽעַל׃ {פ}
Translated:
Why then do you offer me empty consolation?
Of your replies only the perfidy remains.
Transliteration: veeykhe tenachamuniy havel uteshuvoteykhem nishear-maal {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּמָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan eliyfaz hatemaniy vayomar

Hebrew: הַלְאֵ֥ל יִסְכׇּן־גָּ֑בֶר כִּֽי־יִסְכֹּ֖ן עָלֵ֣ימוֹ מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
Translated:
Can a man be of use to God,
A wise man benefit Him?
Transliteration: haleel yisekhׇn-gaver khiy-yisekhon aleymvo mashekhiyl

Hebrew: הַחֵ֣פֶץ לְ֭שַׁדַּי כִּ֣י תִצְדָּ֑ק וְאִם־בֶּ֝֗צַע כִּֽי־תַתֵּ֥ם דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Does Shaddai gain if you are righteous?
Does He profit if your conduct is blameless?
Transliteration: hachefets leshaday khiy titsedak veim-vetsa khiy-tatem derakheykha

Hebrew: הֲֽ֭מִיִּרְאָ֣תְךָ יֹכִיחֶ֑ךָ יָב֥וֹא עִ֝מְּךָ֗ בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
Is it because of your piety that He arraigns you,
And enters into judgment with you?
Transliteration: hamiyireatekha yokhiychekha yavvo imekha vamishefat

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א רָעָתְךָ֣ רַבָּ֑ה וְאֵֽין־קֵ֝֗ץ לַעֲוֺנֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You know that your wickedness is great,
And that your iniquities have no limit.
Transliteration: halo raatekha ravah veeyn-kets laavonoteykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תַחְבֹּ֣ל אַחֶ֣יךָ חִנָּ֑ם וּבִגְדֵ֖י עֲרוּמִּ֣ים תַּפְשִֽׁיט׃
Translated:
You exact pledges from your fellows without reason,
And leave them naked, stripped of their clothes;
Transliteration: khiy-tachevol acheykha chinam uvigedey arumiym tafeshiyt

Hebrew: לֹא־מַ֭יִם עָיֵ֣ף תַּשְׁקֶ֑ה וּ֝מֵרָעֵ֗ב תִּֽמְנַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
You do not give the thirsty water to drink;
You deny bread to the hungry.
Transliteration: lo-mayiim aeif tashekeh umeraev timena-lachem

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ זְ֭רוֹעַ ל֣וֹ הָאָ֑רֶץ וּנְשׂ֥וּא פָ֝נִ֗ים יֵ֣שֶׁב בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
The land belongs to the strong;
The privileged occupy it.
Transliteration: veiysh zervoa lvo haarets uneshu faniym eishev vah

Hebrew: אַ֭לְמָנוֹת שִׁלַּ֣חְתָּ רֵיקָ֑ם וּזְרֹע֖וֹת יְתֹמִ֣ים יְדֻכָּֽא׃
Translated:
You have sent away widows empty-handed;
The strength of the fatherless is broken.
Transliteration: alemanvot shilacheta reykam uzerovot yetomiym yedukha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן סְבִיבוֹתֶ֣יךָ פַחִ֑ים וִ֝יבַהֶלְךָ֗ פַּ֣חַד פִּתְאֹֽם׃
Translated:
Therefore snares are all around you,
And sudden terrors frighten you,
Transliteration: al-khen seviyvvoteykha fachiym viyvahelekha fachad fiteom

Hebrew: אוֹ־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ לֹֽא־תִרְאֶ֑ה וְֽשִׁפְעַת־מַ֥יִם תְּכַסֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Or darkness, so you cannot see;
A flood of waters covers you.
Transliteration: vo-choshekhe lo-tireeh veshifeat-mayiim tekhasekha

Hebrew: הֲֽלֹא־אֱ֭לוֹהַּ גֹּ֣בַהּ שָׁמָ֑יִם וּרְאֵ֤ה רֹ֖אשׁ כּוֹכָבִ֣ים כִּי־רָֽמּוּ׃
Translated:
God is in the heavenly heights;
See the highest stars, how lofty!
Transliteration: halo-elvoha govah shamayiim ureeh rosh khvokhaviym khiy-ramu

Hebrew: וְֽ֭אָמַרְתָּ מַה־יָּ֣דַֽע אֵ֑ל הַבְעַ֖ד עֲרָפֶ֣ל יִשְׁפּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
You say, “What can God know?
Can He govern through the dense cloud?
Transliteration: veamareta mah-yada el havead arafel yishefvot

Hebrew: עָבִ֣ים סֵֽתֶר־ל֭וֹ וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֶ֑ה וְח֥וּג שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם יִתְהַלָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
The clouds screen Him so He cannot see
As He moves about the circuit of heaven.”
Transliteration: aviym seter-lvo velo yireeh vechug shamayiim yitehalakhe

Hebrew: הַאֹ֣רַח עוֹלָ֣ם תִּשְׁמ֑וֹר אֲשֶׁ֖ר דָּרְכ֣וּ מְתֵי־אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Have you observed the immemorial path
That evil men have trodden;
Transliteration: haorach volam tishemvor asher darekhu metey-aven

Hebrew: אֲשֶֽׁר־קֻמְּט֥וּ וְלֹא־עֵ֑ת נָ֝הָ֗ר יוּצַ֥ק יְסוֹדָֽם׃
Translated:
How they were shriveled up before their time
And their foundation poured out like a river?
Transliteration: asher-kumetu velo-et nahar yutsak yesvodam

Hebrew: הָאֹמְרִ֣ים לָ֭אֵל ס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וּמַה־יִּפְעַ֖ל שַׁדַּ֣י לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
They said to God, “Leave us alone;
What can Shaddai do about it?”
Transliteration: haomeriym lael sur mimenu umah-yifeal shaday lamvo

Hebrew: וְה֤וּא מִלֵּ֣א בָתֵּיהֶ֣ם ט֑וֹב וַעֲצַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים רָ֣חֲקָה מֶֽנִּי׃
Translated:
But it was He who filled their houses with good things.
(The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!)
Transliteration: vehu mile vateyhem tvov vaatsat reshaiym rachakah meniy

Hebrew: יִרְא֣וּ צַדִּיקִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ וְ֝נָקִ֗י יִלְעַג־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
The righteous, seeing it, rejoiced;
The innocent laughed with scorn.
Transliteration: yireu tsadiykiym veyishemachu venakiy yileag-lamvo

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א נִכְחַ֣ד קִימָ֑נוּ וְ֝יִתְרָ֗ם אָ֣כְלָה אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Surely their substance was destroyed,
And their remnant consumed by fire.
Transliteration: im-lo nikhechad kiymanu veyiiteram akhelah esh

Hebrew: הַסְכֶּן־נָ֣א עִמּ֣וֹ וּשְׁלָ֑ם בָּ֝הֶ֗ם תְּֽבוֹאַתְךָ֥ טוֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
Be close to Him and wholehearted;
Good things will come to you thereby.
Transliteration: hasekhen-na imvo ushelam vahem tevvoatekha tvovah

Hebrew: קַח־נָ֣א מִפִּ֣יו תּוֹרָ֑ה וְשִׂ֥ים אֲ֝מָרָ֗יו בִּלְבָבֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Accept instruction from His mouth;
Lay up His words in your heart.
Transliteration: kach-na mifiyv tvorah veshiym amarayv vilevavekha

Hebrew: אִם־תָּשׁ֣וּב עַד־שַׁ֭דַּי תִּבָּנֶ֑ה תַּֽרְחִ֥יק עַ֝וְלָ֗ה מֵאׇהֳלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
If you return to Shaddai you will be restored,
If you banish iniquity from your tent;
Transliteration: im-tashuv ad-shaday tivaneh tarechiyk avelah meׇholekha

Hebrew: וְשִׁית־עַל־עָפָ֥ר בָּ֑צֶר וּכְצ֖וּר נְחָלִ֣ים אוֹפִֽיר׃
Translated:
If you regard treasure as dirt,
Ophir-gold as stones of the wadi,
Transliteration: veshiyt-al-afar vatser ukhetsur nechaliym vofiyr

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה שַׁדַּ֣י בְּצָרֶ֑יךָ וְכֶ֖סֶף תּוֹעָפ֣וֹת לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
And Shaddai be your treasure
And precious silver for you,
Transliteration: vehayah shaday vetsareykha vekhesef tvoafvot lakhe

Hebrew: כִּי־אָ֭ז עַל־שַׁדַּ֣י תִּתְעַנָּ֑ג וְתִשָּׂ֖א אֶל־אֱל֣וֹהַּ פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
When you seek the favor of Shaddai,
And lift up your face to God,
Transliteration: khiy-az al-shaday titeanag vetisha el-elvoha faneykha

Hebrew: תַּעְתִּ֣יר אֵ֭לָיו וְיִשְׁמָעֶ֑ךָּ וּנְדָרֶ֥יךָ תְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated:
You will pray to Him, and He will listen to you,
And you will pay your vows.
Transliteration: taetiyr elayv veyishemaekha unedareykha teshalem

Hebrew: וְֽתִגְזַר־אֹ֭מֶר וְיָ֣קׇם־לָ֑ךְ וְעַל־דְּ֝רָכֶ֗יךָ נָ֣גַהּ אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
You will decree and it will be fulfilled,
And light will shine upon your affairs.
Transliteration: vetigezar-omer veyakׇm-lakhe veal-derakheykha nagah vor

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׁפִּילוּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר גֵּוָ֑ה וְשַׁ֖ח עֵינַ֣יִם יוֹשִֽׁעַ׃
Translated:
When others sink low, you will say it is pride;
For He saves the humble.
Transliteration: khiy-hishefiylu vatomer gevah veshach eynayiim yvoshia

Hebrew: יְמַלֵּ֥ט אִֽי־נָקִ֑י וְ֝נִמְלַ֗ט בְּבֹ֣ר כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He will deliver the guilty;
He will be delivered through the cleanness of your hands.
Transliteration: yemalet iy-nakiy venimelat vevor khafeykha {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: גַּם־הַ֭יּוֹם מְרִ֣י שִׂחִ֑י יָ֝דִ֗י כָּבְדָ֥ה עַל־אַנְחָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Today again my complaint is bitter;
My strength is spent on account of my groaning.
Transliteration: gam-hayyvom meriy shichiy yadiy khavedah al-anechatiy

Hebrew: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן יָ֭דַעְתִּי וְאֶמְצָאֵ֑הוּ אָ֝ב֗וֹא עַד־תְּכוּנָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Would that I knew how to reach Him,
How to get to His dwelling-place.
Transliteration: miy-yiten yadaetiy veemetsaehu avvo ad-tekhunatvo

Hebrew: אֶעֶרְכָ֣ה לְפָנָ֣יו מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝פִ֗י אֲמַלֵּ֥א תוֹכָחֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I would set out my case before Him
And fill my mouth with arguments.
Transliteration: eerekhah lefanayv mishefat ufiy amale tvokhachvot

Hebrew: אֵ֭דְעָה מִלִּ֣ים יַעֲנֵ֑נִי וְ֝אָבִ֗ינָה מַה־יֹּ֥אמַר לִֽי׃
Translated:
I would learn what answers He had for me
And know how He would reply to me.
Transliteration: edeah miliym yaaneniy veaviynah mah-yomar liy

Hebrew: הַבְּרׇב־כֹּ֭חַ יָרִ֣יב עִמָּדִ֑י לֹ֥א אַךְ־ה֝֗וּא יָשִׂ֥ם בִּֽי׃
Translated:
Would He contend with me overbearingly?
Surely He would not accuse me!
Transliteration: haverׇv-khocha yariyv imadiy lo akhe-huu yashim viy

Hebrew: שָׁ֗ם יָ֭שָׁר נוֹכָ֣ח עִמּ֑וֹ וַאֲפַלְּטָ֥ה לָ֝נֶ֗צַח מִשֹּׁפְטִֽי׃
Translated:
There the upright would be cleared by Him,
And I would escape forever from my judge.
Transliteration: sham yashar nvokhach imvo vaafaletah lanetsach mishofetiy

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן קֶ֣דֶם אֶהֱלֹ֣ךְ וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וְ֝אָח֗וֹר וְֽלֹא־אָבִ֥ין לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But if I go East—He is not there;
West—I still do not perceive Him;
Transliteration: hen kedem ehelokhe veeynenu veachvor velo-aviyn lvo

Hebrew: שְׂמֹ֣אול בַּעֲשֹׂת֣וֹ וְלֹא־אָ֑חַז יַעְטֹ֥ף יָ֝מִ֗ין וְלֹ֣א אֶרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
North—since He is concealed, I do not behold Him;
South—He is hidden, and I cannot see Him.
Transliteration: shemovl vaashotvo velo-achaz yaetof yamiyn velo ereeh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָ֭דַע דֶּ֣רֶךְ עִמָּדִ֑י בְּ֝חָנַ֗נִי כַּזָּהָ֥ב אֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
But He knows the way I take;
Would He assay me, I should emerge pure as gold.
Transliteration: khiy-yada derekhe imadiy vechananiy khazahav etse

Hebrew: בַּ֭אֲשֻׁרוֹ אָחֲזָ֣ה רַגְלִ֑י דַּרְכּ֖וֹ שָׁמַ֣רְתִּי וְלֹא־אָֽט׃
Translated:
I have followed in His tracks,
Kept His way without swerving,
Transliteration: vaashurvo achazah rageliy darekhvo shamaretiy velo-at

Hebrew: מִצְוַ֣ת שְׂ֭פָתָיו וְלֹ֣א אָמִ֑ישׁ מֵ֝חֻקִּ֗י צָפַ֥נְתִּי אִמְרֵי־פִֽיו׃
Translated:
I have not deviated from what His lips commanded;
I have treasured His words more than my daily bread.
Transliteration: mitsevat shefatayv velo amiysh mechukiy tsafanetiy imerey-fiyv

Hebrew: וְה֣וּא בְ֭אֶחָד וּמִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ אִוְּתָ֣ה וַיָּֽעַשׂ׃
Translated:
He is one; who can dissuade Him?
Whatever He desires, He does.
Transliteration: vehu veechad umiy yeshiyvenu venafeshvo ivetah vayaash

Hebrew: כִּ֭י יַשְׁלִ֣ים חֻקִּ֑י וְכָהֵ֖נָּה רַבּ֣וֹת עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For He will bring my term to an end,
But He has many more such at His disposal.
Transliteration: khiy yasheliym chukiy vekhahenah ravvot imvo

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן מִפָּנָ֣יו אֶבָּהֵ֑ל אֶ֝תְבּוֹנֵ֗ן וְאֶפְחַ֥ד מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Therefore I am terrified at His presence;
When I consider, I dread Him.
Transliteration: al-khen mifanayv evahel etevvonen veefechad mimenu

Hebrew: וְ֭אֵל הֵרַ֣ךְ לִבִּ֑י וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י הִבְהִילָֽנִי׃
Translated:
God has made me fainthearted;
Shaddai has terrified me.
Transliteration: veel herakhe liviy veshaday hivehiylaniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לֹ֣א נִ֭צְמַתִּי מִפְּנֵי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וּ֝מִפָּנַ֗י כִּסָּה־אֹֽפֶל׃
Translated:
Yet I am not cut off by the darkness;
He has concealed the thick gloom from me.
Transliteration: khiy-lo nitsematiy mifeney-choshekhe umifanay khisah-ofel

Hebrew: מַדּ֗וּעַ מִ֭שַּׁדַּי לֹא־נִצְפְּנ֣וּ עִתִּ֑ים וְ֝יֹדְעָ֗ו לֹא־חָ֥זוּ יָמָֽיו׃
Translated:
Why are times for judgment not reserved by Shaddai?
Even those close to Him cannot foresee His actions.
Transliteration: madua mishaday lo-nitsefenu itiym veyodeav lo-chazu yamayv

Hebrew: גְּבֻל֥וֹת יַשִּׂ֑יגוּ עֵ֥דֶר גָּ֝זְל֗וּ וַיִּרְעֽוּ׃
Translated:
People remove boundary-stones;
They carry off flocks and pasture them;
Transliteration: gevulvot yashiygu eder gazelu vayireu

Hebrew: חֲמ֣וֹר יְתוֹמִ֣ים יִנְהָ֑גוּ יַ֝חְבְּל֗וּ שׁ֣וֹר אַלְמָנָֽה׃
Translated:
They lead away the donkeys of the fatherless,
And seize the widow’s bull as a pledge;
Transliteration: chamvor yetvomiym yinehagu yachevelu shvor alemanah

Hebrew: יַטּ֣וּ אֶבְיֹנִ֣ים מִדָּ֑רֶךְ יַ֥חַד חֻ֝בְּא֗וּ עֲנִיֵּי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
They chase the needy off the roads;
All the poor of the land are forced into hiding.
Transliteration: yatu eveyoniym midarekhe yachad chuveu aniyey-arets

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן פְּרָאִ֨ים ׀ בַּ֥מִּדְבָּ֗ר יָצְא֣וּ בְּ֭פׇעֳלָם מְשַׁחֲרֵ֣י לַטָּ֑רֶף עֲרָבָ֥ה ל֥וֹ לֶ֝֗חֶם לַנְּעָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Like the wild asses of the wilderness,
They go about their tasks, seeking food;
The wilderness provides each with food for his lads;
Transliteration: hen feraiym vamidevar yatseu vefׇolam meshacharey lataref aravah lvo lechem laneariym

Hebrew: בַּ֭שָּׂדֶה בְּלִיל֣וֹ (יקצירו) [יִקְצ֑וֹרוּ] וְכֶ֖רֶם רָשָׁ֣ע יְלַקֵּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
They harvest fodder in the field,
And glean the late grapes in the vineyards of the wicked.
Transliteration: vashadeh veliylvo (yktsyrv) [yiketsvoru] vekherem rasha yelakeshu

Hebrew: עָר֣וֹם יָ֭לִינוּ מִבְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת בַּקָּרָֽה׃
Translated:
They pass the night naked for lack of clothing,
They have no covering against the cold;
Transliteration: arvom yaliynu miveliy levush veeyn khesut vakarah

Hebrew: מִזֶּ֣רֶם הָרִ֣ים יִרְטָ֑בוּ וּֽמִבְּלִ֥י מַ֝חְסֶ֗ה חִבְּקוּ־צֽוּר׃
Translated:
They are drenched by the mountain rains,
And huddle against the rock for lack of shelter.
Transliteration: mizerem hariym yiretavu umiveliy macheseh chiveku-tsur

Hebrew: יִ֭גְזְלוּ מִשֹּׁ֣ד יָת֑וֹם וְֽעַל־עָנִ֥י יַחְבֹּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
They snatch the fatherless infant from the breast,
And seize the child of the poor as a pledge.
Transliteration: yigezelu mishod yatvom veal-aniy yachevolu

Hebrew: עָר֣וֹם הִ֭לְּכוּ בְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וּ֝רְעֵבִ֗ים נָ֣שְׂאוּ עֹֽמֶר׃
Translated:
They go about naked for lack of clothing,
And, hungry, carry sheaves;
Transliteration: arvom hilekhu veliy levush ureeviym nasheu omer

Hebrew: בֵּין־שׁוּרֹתָ֥ם יַצְהִ֑ירוּ יְקָבִ֥ים דָּ֝רְכ֗וּ וַיִּצְמָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Between rows [of olive trees] they make oil,
And, thirsty, they tread the winepresses.
Transliteration: veyn-shurotam yatsehiyru yekaviym darekhu vayitsemau

Hebrew: מֵ֘עִ֤יר מְתִ֨ים ׀ יִנְאָ֗קוּ וְנֶֽפֶשׁ־חֲלָלִ֥ים תְּשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וֶ֝אֱל֗וֹהַּ לֹֽא־יָשִׂ֥ים תִּפְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Men groan in the city;
The souls of the dying cry out;
Yet God does not regard it as a reproach.
Transliteration: meiyr metiym yineaku venefesh-chalaliym teshavea veelvoha lo-yashiym tifelah

Hebrew: הֵ֤מָּה ׀ הָיוּ֮ בְּֽמֹרְדֵ֫י־א֥וֹר לֹא־הִכִּ֥ירוּ דְרָכָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יָ֝שְׁב֗וּ בִּנְתִיבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
They are rebels against the light;
They are strangers to its ways,
And do not stay in its path.
Transliteration: hemah hayu vemoredey-vor lo-hikhiyru derakhayv velo yashevu vinetiyvotayv

Hebrew: לָא֡וֹר יָ֘ק֤וּם רוֹצֵ֗חַ יִֽקְטׇל־עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן וּ֝בַלַּ֗יְלָה יְהִ֣י כַגַּנָּֽב׃
Translated:
The murderer arises in the evening
To kill the poor and needy,
And at night he acts the thief.
Transliteration: lavor yakum rvotsecha yiketׇl-aniy veeveyvon uvalayelah yehiy khaganav

Hebrew: וְעֵ֤ין נֹאֵ֨ף ׀ שָׁ֤מְרָֽה־נֶ֣שֶׁף לֵ֭אמֹר לֹא־תְשׁוּרֵ֣נִי עָ֑יִן וְסֵ֖תֶר פָּנִ֣ים יָשִֽׂים׃
Translated:
The eyes of the adulterer watch for twilight,
Thinking, “No one will glimpse me then.”
He masks his face.
Transliteration: veeyn noef shamerah-neshef lemor lo-teshureniy ayiin veseter faniym yashiym

Hebrew: חָתַ֥ר בַּחֹ֗שֶׁךְ בָּ֫תִּ֥ים יוֹמָ֥ם חִתְּמוּ־לָ֗מוֹ לֹא־יָ֥דְעוּ אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
In the dark they break into houses;
By day they shut themselves in;
They do not know the light.
Transliteration: chatar vachoshekhe vatiym yvomam chitemu-lamvo lo-yadeu vor

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יַחְדָּ֨ו ׀ בֹּ֣קֶר לָ֣מוֹ צַלְמָ֑וֶת כִּֽי־יַ֝כִּ֗יר בַּלְה֥וֹת צַלְמָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
For all of them morning is darkness;
It is then that they discern the terror of darkness.
Transliteration: khiy yachedav voker lamvo tsalemavet khiy-yakhiyr valehvot tsalemavet

Hebrew: קַל־ה֤וּא ׀ עַל־פְּנֵי־מַ֗יִם תְּקֻלַּ֣ל חֶלְקָתָ֣ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ לֹא־יִ֝פְנֶ֗ה דֶּ֣רֶךְ כְּרָמִֽים׃
Translated:
May they be flotsam on the face of the water;
May their portion in the land be cursed;
May none turn aside by way of their vineyards.
Transliteration: kal-hu al-feney-mayiim tekulal chelekatam vaarets lo-yifeneh derekhe kheramiym

Hebrew: צִיָּ֤ה גַם־חֹ֗ם יִגְזְל֥וּ מֵֽימֵי־שֶׁ֗לֶג שְׁא֣וֹל חָטָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
May drought and heat snatch away their snow waters,
And Sheol, those who have sinned.
Transliteration: tsiyah gam-chom yigezelu meymey-sheleg shevol chatau

Hebrew: יִשְׁכָּ֘חֵ֤הוּ רֶ֨חֶם ׀ מְתָ֘ק֤וֹ רִמָּ֗ה ע֥וֹד לֹֽא־יִזָּכֵ֑ר וַתִּשָּׁבֵ֖ר כָּעֵ֣ץ עַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
May the womb forget him;
May he be sweet to the worms;
May he be no longer remembered;
May wrongdoers be broken like a tree.
Transliteration: yishekhachehu rechem metakvo rimah vod lo-yizakher vatishaver khaets avelah

Hebrew: רֹעֶ֣ה עֲ֭קָרָה לֹ֣א תֵלֵ֑ד וְ֝אַלְמָנָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְיֵטִֽיב׃
Translated:
May he consort with a barren woman who bears no child,
Leave his widow deprived of good.
Transliteration: roeh akarah lo teled vealemanah lo yeeitiyv

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁ֣ךְ אַבִּירִ֣ים בְּכֹח֑וֹ יָ֝ק֗וּם וְֽלֹא־יַאֲמִ֥ין בַּחַיִּֽין׃
Translated:
Though he has the strength to seize bulls,
May he live with no assurance of survival.
Transliteration: umashakhe aviyriym vekhochvo yakum velo-yaamiyn vachayiyn

Hebrew: יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ לָ֭בֶטַח וְיִשָּׁעֵ֑ן וְ֝עֵינֵ֗יהוּ עַל־דַּרְכֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Yet [God] gives him the security on which he relies,
And keeps watch over his affairs.
Transliteration: yiten-lvo lavetach veyishaen veeyneyhu al-darekheyhem

Hebrew: ר֤וֹמּוּ מְּעַ֨ט ׀ וְֽאֵינֶ֗נּוּ וְֽהֻמְּכ֗וּ כַּכֹּ֥ל יִקָּפְצ֑וּן וּכְרֹ֖אשׁ שִׁבֹּ֣לֶת יִמָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
Exalted for a while, let them be gone;
Be brought low, and shrivel like mallows,
And wither like the heads of grain.
Transliteration: rvomu meat veeynenu vehumekhu khakhol yikafetsun ukherosh shivolet yimalu

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֣א אֵ֭פוֹ מִ֣י יַכְזִיבֵ֑נִי וְיָשֵׂ֥ם לְ֝אַ֗ל מִלָּתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Surely no one can confute me,
Or prove that I am wrong.
Transliteration: veim-lo efvo miy yakheziyveniy veyashem leal milatiy {f}

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan viledad hashuchiy vayomar

Hebrew: הַמְשֵׁ֣ל וָפַ֣חַד עִמּ֑וֹ עֹשֶׂ֥ה שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם בִּמְרוֹמָֽיו׃
Translated:
Dominion and dread are His;
He imposes peace in His heights.
Transliteration: hameshel vafachad imvo osheh shalvom vimervomayv

Hebrew: הֲיֵ֣שׁ מִ֭סְפָּר לִגְדוּדָ֑יו וְעַל־מִ֝֗י לֹא־יָק֥וּם אוֹרֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Can His troops be numbered?
On whom does His light not shine?
Transliteration: haeish misefar ligedudayv veal-miy lo-yakum vorehu

Hebrew: וּמַה־יִּצְדַּ֣ק אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עִם־אֵ֑ל וּמַה־יִּ֝זְכֶּ֗ה יְל֣וּד אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated:
How can man be in the right before God?
How can one born of woman be cleared of guilt?
Transliteration: umah-yitsedak envosh im-el umah-yizekheh yelud ishah

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן עַד־יָ֭רֵחַ וְלֹ֣א יַאֲהִ֑יל וְ֝כוֹכָבִ֗ים לֹא־זַכּ֥וּ בְעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
Even the moon is not bright,
And the stars are not pure in His sight.
Transliteration: hen ad-yarecha velo yaahiyl vekhvokhaviym lo-zakhu veeynayv

Hebrew: אַ֭ף כִּֽי־אֱנ֣וֹשׁ רִמָּ֑ה וּבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם תּוֹלֵעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
How much less man, a worm,
The son-of-man, a maggot.
Transliteration: af khiy-envosh rimah uven-adam tvoleah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Job said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: מֶה־עָזַ֥רְתָּ לְלֹא־כֹ֑חַ ה֝וֹשַׁ֗עְתָּ זְר֣וֹעַ לֹא־עֹֽז׃
Translated:
You would help without having the strength;
You would deliver with arms that have no power.
Transliteration: meh-azareta lelo-khocha hvoshaeta zervoa lo-oz

Hebrew: מַה־יָּ֭עַצְתָּ לְלֹ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝תֻשִׁיָּ֗ה לָרֹ֥ב הוֹדָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated:
Without having the wisdom, you offer advice
And freely give your counsel.
Transliteration: mah-yaatseta lelo chׇkhemah vetushiyah larov hvodaeta

Hebrew: אֶת־מִ֭י הִגַּ֣דְתָּ מִלִּ֑ין וְנִשְׁמַת־מִ֝֗י יָצְאָ֥ה מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
To whom have you addressed words?
Whose breath issued from you?
Transliteration: et-miy higadeta miliyn venishemat-miy yatseah mimekha

Hebrew: הָרְפָאִ֥ים יְחוֹלָ֑לוּ מִתַּ֥חַת מַ֝֗יִם וְשֹׁכְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The shades tremble
Beneath the waters and their denizens.
Transliteration: harefaiym yechvolalu mitachat mayiyim veshokheneyhem

Hebrew: עָר֣וֹם שְׁא֣וֹל נֶגְדּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת לָאֲבַדּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Sheol is naked before Him;
Abaddon has no cover.
Transliteration: arvom shevol negedvo veeyn khesut laavadvon

Hebrew: נֹטֶ֣ה צָפ֣וֹן עַל־תֹּ֑הוּ תֹּ֥לֶה אֶ֝֗רֶץ עַל־בְּלִי־מָֽה׃
Translated:
He it is who stretched out Zaphon over chaos,
Who suspended earth over emptiness.
Transliteration: noteh tsafvon al-tohu toleh erets al-veliy-mah

Hebrew: צֹרֵֽר־מַ֥יִם בְּעָבָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־נִבְקַ֖ע עָנָ֣ן תַּחְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
He wrapped up the waters in His clouds;
Yet no cloud burst under their weight.
Transliteration: tsorer-mayiim veavayv velo-niveka anan tachetam

Hebrew: מְאַחֵ֥ז פְּנֵֽי־כִסֵּ֑ה פַּרְשֵׁ֖ז עָלָ֣יו עֲנָנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He shuts off the view of His throne,
Spreading His cloud over it.
Transliteration: meachez feney-khiseh fareshez alayv ananvo

Hebrew: חֹֽק־חָ֭ג עַל־פְּנֵי־מָ֑יִם עַד־תַּכְלִ֖ית א֣וֹר עִם־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
He drew a boundary on the surface of the waters,
At the extreme where light and darkness meet.
Transliteration: chok-chag al-feney-mayiim ad-takheliyt vor im-choshekhe

Hebrew: עַמּוּדֵ֣י שָׁמַ֣יִם יְרוֹפָ֑פוּ וְ֝יִתְמְה֗וּ מִגַּעֲרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The pillars of heaven tremble,
Astounded at His blast.
Transliteration: amudey shamayiim yervofafu veyiitemehu migaaratvo

Hebrew: בְּ֭כֹחוֹ רָגַ֣ע הַיָּ֑ם (ובתובנתו) [וּ֝בִתְבוּנָת֗וֹ] מָ֣חַץ רָֽהַב׃
Translated:
By His power He stilled the sea;
By His skill He struck down Rahab.
Transliteration: vekhochvo raga hayam (vvtvvntv) [uvitevunatvo] machats rahav

Hebrew: בְּ֭רוּחוֹ שָׁמַ֣יִם שִׁפְרָ֑ה חֹלְלָ֥ה יָ֝ד֗וֹ נָחָ֥שׁ בָּרִֽחַ׃
Translated:
By His wind the heavens were calmed;
His hand pierced the Elusive Serpent.
Transliteration: veruchvo shamayiim shiferah cholelah yadvo nachash varicha

Hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֤לֶּה ׀ קְצ֬וֹת דְּרָכָ֗ו וּמַה־שֵּׁ֣מֶץ דָּ֭בָר נִשְׁמַע־בּ֑וֹ וְרַ֥עַם גְּ֝בוּרֹתָ֗ו מִ֣י יִתְבּוֹנָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
These are but glimpses of His rule,
The mere whisper that we perceive of Him;
Who can absorb the thunder of His mighty deeds?
Transliteration: hen-eleh ketsvot derakhav umah-shemets davar nishema-vvo veraam gevurotav miy yitevvonan {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣סֶף אִ֭יּוֹב שְׂאֵ֥ת מְשָׁל֗וֹ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job again took up his theme and said:
Transliteration: vayosef iyyvov sheet meshalvo vayomar

Hebrew: חַי־אֵ֭ל הֵסִ֣יר מִשְׁפָּטִ֑י וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י הֵמַ֥ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
By God who has deprived me of justice!
By Shaddai who has embittered my life!
Transliteration: chay-el hesiyr mishefatiy veshaday hemar nafeshiy

Hebrew: כִּי־כׇל־ע֣וֹד נִשְׁמָתִ֣י בִ֑י וְר֖וּחַ אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּאַפִּֽי׃
Translated:
As long as there is life in me,
And God’s breath is in my nostrils,
Transliteration: khiy-khׇl-vod nishematiy viy verucha elvoha veafiy

Hebrew: אִם־תְּדַבֵּ֣רְנָה שְׂפָתַ֣י עַוְלָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנִ֗י אִם־יֶהְגֶּ֥ה רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
My lips will speak no wrong,
Nor my tongue utter deceit.
Transliteration: im-tedaverenah shefatay avelah uleshvoniy im-yehegeh remiyah

Hebrew: חָלִ֣ילָה לִּי֮ אִם־אַצְדִּ֢יק אֶ֫תְכֶ֥ם עַד־אֶגְוָ֑ע לֹֽא־אָסִ֖יר תֻּמָּתִ֣י מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Far be it from me to say you are right;
Until I die I will maintain my integrity.
Transliteration: chaliylah liy im-atsedi֢yk etekhem ad-egeva lo-asiyr tumatiy mimeniy

Hebrew: בְּצִדְקָתִ֣י הֶ֭חֱזַקְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אַרְפֶּ֑הָ לֹא־יֶחֱרַ֥ף לְ֝בָבִ֗י מִיָּמָֽי׃
Translated:
I persist in my righteousness and will not yield;
I shall be free of reproach as long as I live.
Transliteration: vetsidekatiy hechezaketiy velo arefeha lo-yecheraf levaviy miyamay

Hebrew: יְהִ֣י כְ֭רָשָׁע אֹ֣יְבִ֑י וּמִתְקוֹמְמִ֥י כְעַוָּֽל׃
Translated:
May my enemy be as the wicked;
My assailant, as the wrongdoer.
Transliteration: yehiy kherasha oyeviy umitekvomemiy kheaval

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מַה־תִּקְוַ֣ת חָ֭נֵף כִּ֣י יִבְצָ֑ע כִּ֤י יֵ֖שֶׁל אֱל֣וֹהַּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
For what hope has the impious man when he is cut down,
When God takes away his life?
Transliteration: khiy mah-tikevat chanef khiy yivetsa khiy eishel elvoha nafeshvo

Hebrew: הֲֽ֭צַעֲקָתוֹ יִשְׁמַ֥ע <small>׀</small> אֵ֑ל כִּֽי־תָב֖וֹא עָלָ֣יו צָרָֽה׃
Translated:
Will God hear his cry
When trouble comes upon him,
Transliteration: hatsaakatvo yishema <small></small> el khiy-tavvo alayv tsarah

Hebrew: אִם־עַל־שַׁדַּ֥י יִתְעַנָּ֑ג יִקְרָ֖א אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּכׇל־עֵֽת׃
Translated:
When he seeks the favor of Shaddai,
Calls upon God at all times?
Transliteration: im-al-shaday yiteanag yikera elvoha vekhׇl-et

Hebrew: אוֹרֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֣ם בְּיַד־אֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִם־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י לֹ֣א אֲכַחֵֽד׃
Translated:
I will teach you what is in God’s power,
And what is with Shaddai I will not conceal.
Transliteration: voreh etekhem veyad-el asher im-shaday lo akhached

Hebrew: הֵן־אַתֶּ֣ם כֻּלְּכֶ֣ם חֲזִיתֶ֑ם וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֝֗ה הֶ֣בֶל תֶּהְבָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
All of you have seen it,
So why talk nonsense?
Transliteration: hen-atem khulekhem chaziytem velamah-zeh hevel tehevalu

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה ׀ חֵלֶק־אָדָ֖ם רָשָׁ֥ע ׀ עִם־אֵ֑ל וְֽנַחֲלַ֥ת עָ֝רִיצִ֗ים מִשַּׁדַּ֥י יִקָּֽחוּ׃
Translated:
This is the evil man’s portion from God,
The lot that the ruthless receive from Shaddai:
Transliteration: zeh chelek-adam rasha im-el venachalat ariytsiym mishaday yikachu

Hebrew: אִם־יִרְבּ֣וּ בָנָ֣יו לְמוֹ־חָ֑רֶב וְ֝צֶאֱצָאָ֗יו לֹ֣א יִשְׂבְּעוּ־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
Should he have many sons—they are marked for the sword;
His descendants will never have their fill of bread;
Transliteration: im-yirevu vanayv lemvo-charev vetseetsaayv lo yisheveu-lachem

Hebrew: שְׂ֭רִידָו בַּמָּ֣וֶת יִקָּבֵ֑רוּ וְ֝אַלְמְנֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִבְכֶּֽינָה׃
Translated:
Those who survive him will be buried in a plague,
And their widows will not weep;
Transliteration: sheriydav vamavet yikaveru vealemenotayv lo tivekheynah

Hebrew: אִם־יִצְבֹּ֣ר כֶּעָפָ֣ר כָּ֑סֶף וְ֝כַחֹ֗מֶר יָכִ֥ין מַלְבּֽוּשׁ׃
Translated:
Should he pile up silver like dust,
Lay up clothing like dirt—
Transliteration: im-yitsevor kheafar khasef vekhachomer yakhiyn malevush

Hebrew: יָ֭כִין וְצַדִּ֣יק יִלְבָּ֑שׁ וְ֝כֶ֗סֶף נָקִ֥י יַחֲלֹֽק׃
Translated:
He may lay it up, but the righteous will wear it,
And the innocent will share the silver.
Transliteration: yakhiyn vetsadiyk yilevash vekhesef nakiy yachalok

Hebrew: בָּנָ֣ה כָעָ֣שׁ בֵּית֑וֹ וּ֝כְסֻכָּ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה נֹצֵֽר׃
Translated:
The house he built is like a bird’s nest,
Like the booth a watchman makes.
Transliteration: vanah khaash veytvo ukhesukhah ashah notser

Hebrew: עָשִׁ֣יר יִ֭שְׁכַּב וְלֹ֣א יֵאָסֵ֑ף עֵינָ֖יו פָּקַ֣ח וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
He lies down, a rich man, with [his wealth] intact;
When he opens his eyes it is gone.
Transliteration: ashiyr yishekhav velo eiasef eynayv fakach veeynenu

Hebrew: תַּשִּׂיגֵ֣הוּ כַ֭מַּיִם בַּלָּה֑וֹת לַ֝֗יְלָה גְּנָבַ֥תּוּ סוּפָֽה׃
Translated:
Terror overtakes him like a flood;
A storm wind makes off with him by night.
Transliteration: tashiygehu khamayim valahvot layelah genavatu sufah

Hebrew: יִשָּׂאֵ֣הוּ קָדִ֣ים וְיֵלַ֑ךְ וִ֝ישָׂעֲרֵ֗הוּ מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The east wind carries him far away, and he is gone;
It sweeps him from his place.
Transliteration: yishaehu kadiym veeilakhe viyshaarehu mimekomvo

Hebrew: וְיַשְׁלֵ֣ךְ עָ֭לָיו וְלֹ֣א יַחְמֹ֑ל מִ֝יָּד֗וֹ בָּר֥וֹחַ יִבְרָֽח׃
Translated:
Then it hurls itself at him without mercy;
He tries to escape from its force.
Transliteration: veyashelekhe alayv velo yachemol miyadvo varvocha yiverach

Hebrew: יִשְׂפֹּ֣ק עָלֵ֣ימוֹ כַפֵּ֑ימוֹ וְיִשְׁרֹ֥ק עָ֝לָ֗יו מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
It claps its hands at him,
And whistles at him from its place.
Transliteration: yishefok aleymvo khafeymvo veyisherok alayv mimekomvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יֵ֣שׁ לַכֶּ֣סֶף מוֹצָ֑א וּ֝מָק֗וֹם לַזָּהָ֥ב יָזֹֽקּוּ׃
Translated:
There is a mine for silver,
And a place where gold is refined.
Transliteration: khiy eish lakhesef mvotsa umakvom lazahav yazoku

Hebrew: בַּ֭רְזֶל מֵעָפָ֣ר יֻקָּ֑ח וְ֝אֶ֗בֶן יָצ֥וּק נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
Translated:
Iron is taken out of the earth,
And copper smelted from rock.
Transliteration: varezel meafar yukach veeven yatsuk nechushah

Hebrew: קֵ֤ץ ׀ שָׂ֤ם לַחֹ֗שֶׁךְ וּֽלְכׇל־תַּ֭כְלִית ה֣וּא חוֹקֵ֑ר אֶ֖בֶן אֹ֣פֶל וְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
He sets bounds for darkness;
To every limit man probes,
To rocks in deepest darkness.
Transliteration: kets sham lachoshekhe ulekhׇl-takheliyt hu chvoker even ofel vetsalemavet

Hebrew: פָּ֤רַץ נַ֨חַל ׀ מֵֽעִם־גָּ֗ר הַֽנִּשְׁכָּחִ֥ים מִנִּי־רָ֑גֶל דַּ֖לּוּ מֵאֱנ֣וֹשׁ נָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
They open up a shaft far from where men live,
[In places] forgotten by wayfarers,
Destitute of men, far removed.
Transliteration: farats nachal meim-gar hanishekhachiym miniy-ragel dalu meenvosh nau

Hebrew: אֶ֗רֶץ מִמֶּ֥נָּה יֵֽצֵא־לָ֑חֶם וְ֝תַחְתֶּ֗יהָ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ כְּמוֹ־אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Earth, out of which food grows,
Is changed below as if into fire.
Transliteration: erets mimenah eitse-lachem vetacheteyha nehefakhe khemvo-esh

Hebrew: מְקוֹם־סַפִּ֥יר אֲבָנֶ֑יהָ וְעַפְרֹ֖ת זָהָ֣ב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Its rocks are a source of sapphires;
It contains gold dust too.
Transliteration: mekvom-safiyr avaneyha veaferot zahav lvo

Hebrew: נָ֭תִיב לֹא־יְדָ֣עוֹ עָ֑יִט וְלֹ֥א שְׁ֝זָפַ֗תּוּ עֵ֣ין אַיָּֽה׃
Translated:
No bird of prey knows the path to it;
The falcon’s eye has not gazed upon it.
Transliteration: natiyv lo-yedavo ayiit velo shezafatu eyn ayah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־הִדְרִיכ֥וּהוּ בְנֵי־שָׁ֑חַץ לֹֽא־עָדָ֖ה עָלָ֣יו שָֽׁחַל׃
Translated:
The proud beasts have not reached it;
The lion has not crossed it.
Transliteration: lo-hideriykhuhu veney-shachats lo-adah alayv shachal

Hebrew: בַּ֭חַלָּמִישׁ שָׁלַ֣ח יָד֑וֹ הָפַ֖ךְ מִשֹּׁ֣רֶשׁ הָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Man sets his hand against the flinty rock
And overturns mountains by the roots.
Transliteration: vachalamiysh shalach yadvo hafakhe mishoresh hariym

Hebrew: בַּ֭צּוּרוֹת יְאֹרִ֣ים בִּקֵּ֑עַ וְכׇל־יְ֝קָ֗ר רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He carves out channels through rock;
His eyes behold every precious thing.
Transliteration: vatsurvot yeoriym vikea vekhׇl-yekar raatah eynvo

Hebrew: מִ֭בְּכִי נְהָר֣וֹת חִבֵּ֑שׁ וְ֝תַעֲלֻמָ֗הּ יֹ֣צִא אֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated:
He dams up the sources of the streams
So that hidden things may be brought to light.
Transliteration: mivekhiy neharvot chivesh vetaalumah yotsi vor {f}

Hebrew: וְֽ֭הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַ֣יִן תִּמָּצֵ֑א וְאֵ֥י זֶ֝֗ה מְק֣וֹם בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
