But where can wisdom be found;
Where is the source of understanding?
Transliteration: vehachׇkhemah meayiin timatse veey zeh mekvom viynah

Hebrew: לֹא־יָדַ֣ע אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עֶרְכָּ֑הּ וְלֹ֥א תִ֝מָּצֵ֗א בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַחַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
No man can set a value on it;
It cannot be found in the land of the living.
Transliteration: lo-yada envosh erekhah velo timatse veerets hachayiym

Hebrew: תְּה֣וֹם אָ֭מַר לֹ֣א בִי־הִ֑יא וְיָ֥ם אָ֝מַ֗ר אֵ֣ין עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated:
The deep says, “It is not in me”;
The sea says, “I do not have it.”
Transliteration: tehvom amar lo viy-hiy veyam amar eyn imadiy

Hebrew: לֹא־יֻתַּ֣ן סְג֣וֹר תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִ֝שָּׁקֵ֗ל כֶּ֣סֶף מְחִירָֽהּ׃
Translated:
It cannot be bartered for gold;
Silver cannot be paid out as its price.
Transliteration: lo-yutan segvor tacheteyha velo yishakel khesef mechiyrah

Hebrew: לֹא־תְ֭סֻלֶּה בְּכֶ֣תֶם אוֹפִ֑יר בְּשֹׁ֖הַם יָקָ֣ר וְסַפִּֽיר׃
Translated:
The finest gold of Ophir cannot be weighed against it,
Nor precious onyx, nor sapphire.
Transliteration: lo-tesuleh vekhetem vofiyr veshoham yakar vesafiyr

Hebrew: לֹא־יַעַרְכֶ֣נָּה זָ֭הָב וּזְכוֹכִ֑ית וּתְמ֖וּרָתָ֣הּ כְּלִי־פָֽז׃
Translated:
Gold or glass cannot match its value,
Nor vessels of fine gold be exchanged for it.
Transliteration: lo-yaarekhenah zahav uzekhvokhiyt utemuratah kheliy-faz

Hebrew: רָאמ֣וֹת וְ֭גָבִישׁ לֹ֣א יִזָּכֵ֑ר וּמֶ֥שֶׁךְ חׇ֝כְמָ֗ה מִפְּנִינִֽים׃
Translated:
Coral and crystal cannot be mentioned with it;
A pouch of wisdom is better than rubies.
Transliteration: ramvot vegaviysh lo yizakher umeshekhe chׇkhemah mifeniyniym

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יַ֭עַרְכֶנָּה פִּטְדַת־כּ֑וּשׁ בְּכֶ֥תֶם טָ֝ה֗וֹר לֹ֣א תְסֻלֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Topaz from Nubia cannot match its value;
Pure gold cannot be weighed against it.
Transliteration: lo-yaarekhenah fitedat-khush vekhetem tahvor lo tesuleh

Hebrew: וְֽ֭הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַ֣יִן תָּב֑וֹא וְאֵ֥י זֶ֝֗ה מְק֣וֹם בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
But whence does wisdom come?
Where is the source of understanding?
Transliteration: vehachׇkhemah meayiin tavvo veey zeh mekvom viynah

Hebrew: וְֽ֭נֶעֶלְמָה מֵעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־חָ֑י וּמֵע֖וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם נִסְתָּֽרָה׃
Translated:
It is hidden from the eyes of all living,
Concealed from the fowl of heaven.
Transliteration: veneelemah meeyney khׇl-chay umevof hashamayiim nisetarah

Hebrew: אֲבַדּ֣וֹן וָ֭מָוֶת אָ֣מְר֑וּ בְּ֝אׇזְנֵ֗ינוּ שָׁמַ֥עְנוּ שִׁמְעָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Abaddon and Death say,
“We have only a report of it.”
Transliteration: avadvon vamavet ameru veׇzeneynu shamaenu shimeah

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים הֵבִ֣ין דַּרְכָּ֑הּ וְ֝ה֗וּא יָדַ֥ע אֶת־מְקוֹמָֽהּ׃
Translated:
God understands the way to it;
He knows its source;
Transliteration: Elohim heviyn darekhah vehu yada et-mekvomah

Hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא לִקְצוֹת־הָאָ֣רֶץ יַבִּ֑יט תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
For He sees to the ends of the earth,
Observes all that is beneath the heavens.
Transliteration: khiy-hu liketsvot-haarets yaviyt tachat khׇl-hashamayiim yireeh

Hebrew: לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָר֣וּחַ מִשְׁקָ֑ל וּ֝מַ֗יִם תִּכֵּ֥ן בְּמִדָּֽה׃
Translated:
When He fixed the weight of the winds,
Set the measure of the waters;
Transliteration: laashvot larucha mishekal umayiim tikhen vemidah

Hebrew: בַּעֲשֹׂת֣וֹ לַמָּטָ֣ר חֹ֑ק וְ֝דֶ֗רֶךְ לַחֲזִ֥יז קֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
When He made a rule for the rain
And a course for the thunderstorms,
Transliteration: vaashotvo lamatar chok vederekhe lachaziyz kolvot

Hebrew: אָ֣ז רָ֭אָהּ וַֽיְסַפְּרָ֑הּ הֱ֝כִינָ֗הּ וְגַם־חֲקָרָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Then He saw it and gauged it;
He measured it and probed it.
Transliteration: az raah vayesaferah hekhiynah vegam-chakarah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר ׀ לָאָדָ֗ם הֵ֤ן יִרְאַ֣ת אֲ֭דֹנָי הִ֣יא חׇכְמָ֑ה וְס֖וּר מֵרָ֣ע בִּינָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
He said to man,
“See! Fear of the Lord is wisdom;
To shun evil is understanding.”
Transliteration: vayomer laadam hen yireat adonay hiy chׇkhemah vesur mera viynah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣סֶף אִ֭יּוֹב שְׂאֵ֥ת מְשָׁל֗וֹ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job again took up his theme and said:
Transliteration: vayosef iyyvov sheet meshalvo vayomar

Hebrew: מִֽי־יִתְּנֵ֥נִי כְיַרְחֵי־קֶ֑דֶם כִּ֝ימֵ֗י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יִשְׁמְרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O that I were as in months gone by,
In the days when God watched over me,
Transliteration: miy-yiteneniy kheyarechey-kedem khiymey elvoha yishemereniy

Hebrew: בְּהִלּ֣וֹ נֵ֭רוֹ עֲלֵ֣י רֹאשִׁ֑י לְ֝אוֹר֗וֹ אֵ֣לֶךְ חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
When His lamp shone over my head,
When I walked in the dark by its light,
Transliteration: vehilvo nervo aley roshiy levorvo elekhe choshekhe

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר הָ֭יִיתִי בִּימֵ֣י חׇרְפִּ֑י בְּס֥וֹד אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ עֲלֵ֣י אׇהֳלִֽי׃
Translated:
When I was in my prime,
When God’s company graced my tent,
Transliteration: khaasher hayiiytiy viymey chׇrefiy vesvod elvoha aley ׇholiy

Hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד שַׁ֭דַּי עִמָּדִ֑י סְבִ֖יבוֹתַ֣י נְעָרָֽי׃
Translated:
When Shaddai was still with me,
When my lads surrounded me,
Transliteration: vevod shaday imadiy seviyvvotay nearay

Hebrew: בִּרְחֹ֣ץ הֲלִיכַ֣י בְּחֵמָ֑ה וְצ֥וּר יָצ֥וּק עִ֝מָּדִ֗י פַּלְגֵי־שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated:
When my feet were bathed in cream,
And rocks poured out streams of oil for me.
Transliteration: virechots haliykhay vechemah vetsur yatsuk imadiy falegey-shamen

Hebrew: בְּצֵ֣אתִי שַׁ֣עַר עֲלֵי־קָ֑רֶת בָּ֝רְח֗וֹב אָכִ֥ין מוֹשָׁבִֽי׃
Translated:
When I passed through the city gates
To take my seat in the square,
Transliteration: vetsetiy shaar aley-karet varechvov akhiyn mvoshaviy

Hebrew: רָא֣וּנִי נְעָרִ֣ים וְנֶחְבָּ֑אוּ וִ֝ישִׁישִׁ֗ים קָ֣מוּ עָמָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Young men saw me and hid,
Elders rose and stood;
Transliteration: rauniy neariym venechevau viyshiyshiym kamu amadu

Hebrew: שָׂ֭רִים עָצְר֣וּ בְמִלִּ֑ים וְ֝כַ֗ף יָשִׂ֥ימוּ לְפִיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Nobles held back their words;
They clapped their hands to their mouths.
Transliteration: shariym atseru vemiliym vekhaf yashiymu lefiyhem

Hebrew: קוֹל־נְגִידִ֥ים נֶחְבָּ֑אוּ וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם לְחִכָּ֥ם דָּבֵֽקָה׃
Translated:
The voices of princes were hushed;
Their tongues stuck to their palates.
Transliteration: kvol-negiydiym nechevau uleshvonam lechikham davekah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֹ֣זֶן שָׁ֭מְעָה וַֽתְּאַשְּׁרֵ֑נִי וְעַ֥יִן רָ֝אֲתָ֗ה וַתְּעִידֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
The ear that heard me acclaimed me;
The eye that saw, commended me.
Transliteration: khiy ozen shameah vateashereniy veayiin raatah vateiydeniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲ֭מַלֵּט עָנִ֣י מְשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וְ֝יָת֗וֹם וְֽלֹא־עֹזֵ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For I saved the poor man who cried out,
The orphan who had none to help him.
Transliteration: khiy-amalet aniy meshavea veyatvom velo-ozer lvo

Hebrew: בִּרְכַּ֣ת אֹ֭בֵד עָלַ֣י תָּבֹ֑א וְלֵ֖ב אַלְמָנָ֣ה אַרְנִֽן׃
Translated:
I received the blessing of the lost;
I gladdened the heart of the widow.
Transliteration: virekhat oved alay tavo velev alemanah arenin

Hebrew: צֶ֣דֶק לָ֭בַשְׁתִּי וַיִּלְבָּשֵׁ֑נִי כִּֽמְעִ֥יל וְ֝צָנִ֗יף מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃
Translated:
I clothed myself in righteousness and it robed me;
Justice was my cloak and turban.
Transliteration: tsedek lavashetiy vayilevasheniy khimeiyl vetsaniyf mishefatiy

Hebrew: עֵינַ֣יִם הָ֭יִיתִי לַעִוֵּ֑ר וְרַגְלַ֖יִם לַפִּסֵּ֣חַ אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I was eyes to the blind
And feet to the lame.
Transliteration: eynayiim hayiiytiy laiver veragelayiim lafisecha aniy

Hebrew: אָ֣ב אָ֭נֹכִֽי לָאֶבְיוֹנִ֑ים וְרִ֖ב לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶחְקְרֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
I was a father to the needy,
And I looked into the case of the stranger.
Transliteration: av anokhiy laeveyvoniym veriv lo-yadaetiy echekerehu

Hebrew: וָ֭אֲשַׁבְּרָה מְתַלְּע֣וֹת עַוָּ֑ל וּ֝מִשִּׁנָּ֗יו אַשְׁלִ֥יךְ טָֽרֶף׃
Translated:
I broke the jaws of the wrongdoer,
And I wrested prey from his teeth.
Transliteration: vaashaverah metalevot aval umishinayv asheliykhe taref

Hebrew: וָ֭אֹמַר עִם־קִנִּ֣י אֶגְוָ֑ע וְ֝כַח֗וֹל אַרְבֶּ֥ה יָמִֽים׃
Translated:
I thought I would end my days with my family,
And be as long-lived as the phoenix,
Transliteration: vaomar im-kiniy egeva vekhachvol areveh yamiym

Hebrew: שׇׁרְשִׁ֣י פָת֣וּחַ אֱלֵי־מָ֑יִם וְ֝טַ֗ל יָלִ֥ין בִּקְצִירִֽי׃
Translated:
My roots reaching water,
And dew lying on my branches;
Transliteration: shׇreshiy fatucha eley-mayiim vetal yaliyn viketsiyriy

Hebrew: כְּ֭בוֹדִי חָדָ֣שׁ עִמָּדִ֑י וְ֝קַשְׁתִּ֗י בְּיָדִ֥י תַחֲלִֽיף׃
Translated:
My vigor refreshed,
My bow ever new in my hand.
Transliteration: khevvodiy chadash imadiy vekashetiy veyadiy tachaliyf

Hebrew: לִֽי־שָׁמְע֥וּ וְיִחֵ֑לּוּ וְ֝יִדְּמ֗וּ לְמ֣וֹ עֲצָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Men would listen to me expectantly,
And wait for my counsel.
Transliteration: liy-shameu veyichelu veyiidemu lemvo atsatiy

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י דְ֭בָרִי לֹ֣א יִשְׁנ֑וּ וְ֝עָלֵ֗ימוֹ תִּטֹּ֥ף מִלָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
After I spoke they had nothing to say;
My words were as drops [of dew] upon them.
Transliteration: acharey devariy lo yishenu vealeymvo titof milatiy

Hebrew: וְיִחֲל֣וּ כַמָּטָ֣ר לִ֑י וּ֝פִיהֶ֗ם פָּעֲר֥וּ לְמַלְקֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
They waited for me as for rain,
For the late rain, their mouths open wide.
Transliteration: veyichalu khamatar liy ufiyhem faaru lemalekvosh

Hebrew: אֶשְׂחַ֣ק אֲ֭לֵהֶם לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ינוּ וְא֥וֹר פָּ֝נַ֗י לֹ֣א יַפִּילֽוּן׃
Translated:
When I smiled at them, they would not believe it;
They never expected a sign of my favor.
Transliteration: eshechak alehem lo yaamiynu vevor fanay lo yafiylun

Hebrew: אֶ֥בְחַ֣ר דַּרְכָּם֮ וְאֵשֵׁ֢ב רֹ֥֫אשׁ וְ֭אֶשְׁכּוֹן כְּמֶ֣לֶךְ בַּגְּד֑וּד כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲבֵלִ֣ים יְנַחֵֽם׃
Translated:
I decided their course and presided over them;
I lived like a king among his troops,
Like one who consoles mourners.
Transliteration: evechar darekham veeshe֢v rosh veeshekhvon khemelekhe vagedud khaasher aveliym yenachem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֤ה ׀ שָׂ֥חֲק֣וּ עָלַי֮ צְעִירִ֥ים מִמֶּ֗נִּי לְיָ֫מִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־מָאַ֥סְתִּי אֲבוֹתָ֑ם לָ֝שִׁ֗ית עִם־כַּלְבֵ֥י צֹאנִֽי׃
Translated:
But now those younger than I deride me,
[Men] whose fathers I would have disdained to put among my sheep dogs.
Transliteration: veatah shachaku alay tseiyriym mimeniy leyamiym asher-maasetiy avvotam lashiyt im-khalevey tsoniy

Hebrew: גַּם־כֹּ֣חַ יְ֭דֵיהֶם לָ֣מָּה לִּ֑י עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ אָ֣בַד כָּֽלַח׃
Translated:
Of what use to me is the strength of their hands?
All their vigor is gone.
Transliteration: gam-khocha yedeyhem lamah liy aleymvo avad khalach

Hebrew: בְּחֶ֥סֶר וּבְכָפָ֗ן גַּ֫לְמ֥וּד הַעֹרְקִ֥ים צִיָּ֑ה אֶ֝֗מֶשׁ שׁוֹאָ֥ה וּמְשֹׁאָֽה׃
Translated:
Wasted from want and starvation,
They flee to a parched land,
To the gloom of desolate wasteland.
Transliteration: vecheser uvekhafan galemud haorekiym tsiyah emesh shvoah umeshoah

Hebrew: הַקֹּטְפִ֣ים מַלּ֣וּחַ עֲלֵי־שִׂ֑יחַ וְשֹׁ֖רֶשׁ רְתָמִ֣ים לַחְמָֽם׃
Translated:
They pluck saltwort and wormwood;
The roots of broom are their food.
Transliteration: hakotefiym malucha aley-shiycha veshoresh retamiym lachemam

Hebrew: מִן־גֵּ֥ו יְגֹרָ֑שׁוּ יָרִ֥יעוּ עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ כַּגַּנָּֽב׃
Translated:
Driven out from society,
They are cried at like a thief.
Transliteration: min-gev yegorashu yariyu aleymvo khaganav

Hebrew: בַּעֲר֣וּץ נְחָלִ֣ים לִשְׁכֹּ֑ן חֹרֵ֖י עָפָ֣ר וְכֵפִֽים׃
Translated:
They live in the gullies of wadis,
In holes in the ground, and in rocks,
Transliteration: vaaruts nechaliym lishekhon chorey afar vekhefiym

Hebrew: בֵּין־שִׂיחִ֥ים יִנְהָ֑קוּ תַּ֖חַת חָר֣וּל יְסֻפָּֽחוּ׃
Translated:
Braying among the bushes,
Huddling among the nettles,
Transliteration: veyn-shiychiym yinehaku tachat charul yesufachu

Hebrew: בְּֽנֵי־נָ֭בָל גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י בְלִי־שֵׁ֑ם נִ֝כְּא֗וּ מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Scoundrels, nobodies,
Stricken from the earth.
Transliteration: veney-naval gam-veney veliy-shem nikheu min-haarets

Hebrew: וְ֭עַתָּה נְגִינָתָ֣ם הָיִ֑יתִי וָאֱהִ֖י לָהֶ֣ם לְמִלָּֽה׃
Translated:
Now I am the butt of their gibes;
I have become a byword to them.
Transliteration: veatah negiynatam hayiytiy vaehiy lahem lemilah

Hebrew: תִּ֭עֲבוּנִי רָ֣חֲקוּ מֶ֑נִּי וּ֝מִפָּנַ֗י לֹא־חָ֥שְׂכוּ רֹֽק׃
Translated:
They abhor me; they keep their distance from me;
They do not withhold spittle from my face.
Transliteration: tiavuniy rachaku meniy umifanay lo-chashekhu rok

Hebrew: כִּֽי־[יִתְרִ֣י] (יתרו) פִ֭תַּח וַיְעַנֵּ֑נִי וְ֝רֶ֗סֶן מִפָּנַ֥י שִׁלֵּֽחוּ׃
Translated:
Because God has disarmed and humbled me,
They have thrown off restraint in my presence.
Transliteration: khiy-[yiteriy] (ytrv) fitach vayeaneniy veresen mifanay shilechu

Hebrew: עַל־יָמִין֮ פִּרְחַ֢ח יָ֫ק֥וּמוּ רַגְלַ֥י שִׁלֵּ֑חוּ וַיָּסֹ֥לּוּ עָ֝לַ֗י אׇרְח֥וֹת אֵידָֽם׃
Translated:
Mere striplings assail me at my right hand:
They put me to flight;
They build their roads for my ruin.
Transliteration: al-yamiyn firecha֢ch yakumu ragelay shilechu vayasolu alay ׇrechvot eydam

Hebrew: נָֽתְס֗וּ נְֽתִיבָ֫תִ֥י לְהַוָּתִ֥י יֹעִ֑ילוּ לֹ֖א עֹזֵ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
They tear up my path;
They promote my fall,
Although it does them no good.
Transliteration: natesu netiyvatiy lehavatiy yoiylu lo ozer lamvo

Hebrew: כְּפֶ֣רֶץ רָחָ֣ב יֶאֱתָ֑יוּ תַּ֥חַת שֹׁ֝אָ֗ה הִתְגַּלְגָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
They come as through a wide breach;
They roll in like raging billows.
Transliteration: kheferets rachav yeetayu tachat shoah hitegalegalu

Hebrew: הׇהְפַּ֥ךְ עָלַ֗י בַּלָּ֫ה֥וֹת תִּרְדֹּ֣ף כָּ֭רוּחַ נְדִבָתִ֑י וּ֝כְעָ֗ב עָבְרָ֥ה יְשֻׁעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Terror tumbles upon me;
It sweeps away my honor like the wind;
My dignity vanishes like a cloud.
Transliteration: hׇhefakhe alay valahvot tiredof kharucha nedivatiy ukheav averah yeshuatiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה עָ֭לַי תִּשְׁתַּפֵּ֣ךְ נַפְשִׁ֑י יֹ֖אחֲז֣וּנִי יְמֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
Translated:
So now my life runs out;
Days of misery have taken hold of me.
Transliteration: veatah alay tishetafekhe nafeshiy yochazuniy yemey-oniy

Hebrew: לַ֗יְלָה עֲ֭צָמַי נִקַּ֣ר מֵעָלָ֑י וְ֝עֹרְקַ֗י לֹ֣א יִשְׁכָּבֽוּן׃
Translated:
By night my bones feel gnawed;
My sinews never rest.
Transliteration: layelah atsamay nikar mealay veorekay lo yishekhavun

Hebrew: בְּרׇב־כֹּ֭חַ יִתְחַפֵּ֣שׂ לְבוּשִׁ֑י כְּפִ֖י כֻתׇּנְתִּ֣י יַאַזְרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
With great effort I change clothing;
The neck of my tunic fits my waist.
Transliteration: verׇv-khocha yitechafesh levushiy khefiy khutׇnetiy yaazereniy

Hebrew: הֹרָ֥נִי לַחֹ֑מֶר וָ֝אֶתְמַשֵּׁ֗ל כֶּעָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃
Translated:
He regarded me as clay,
I have become like dust and ashes.
Transliteration: horaniy lachomer vaetemashel kheafar vaefer

Hebrew: אֲשַׁוַּ֣ע אֵ֭לֶיךָ וְלֹ֣א תַעֲנֵ֑נִי עָ֝מַ֗דְתִּי וַתִּתְבֹּ֥נֶן בִּֽי׃
Translated:
I cry out to You, but You do not answer me;
I wait, but You do [not] consider me.
Transliteration: ashava eleykha velo taaneniy amadetiy vatitevonen viy

Hebrew: תֵּהָפֵ֣ךְ לְאַכְזָ֣ר לִ֑י בְּעֹ֖צֶם יָדְךָ֣ תִשְׂטְמֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
You have become cruel to me;
With Your powerful hand You harass me.
Transliteration: tehafekhe leakhezar liy veotsem yadekha tishetemeniy

Hebrew: תִּשָּׂאֵ֣נִי אֶל־ר֭וּחַ תַּרְכִּיבֵ֑נִי וּ֝תְמֹגְגֵ֗נִי (תשוה) [תּוּשִׁיָּֽה]׃
Translated:
You lift me up and mount me on the wind;
You make my courage melt.
Transliteration: tishaeniy el-rucha tarekhiyveniy utemogegeniy (tshvh) [tushiyah]

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָ֭דַעְתִּי מָ֣וֶת תְּשִׁיבֵ֑נִי וּבֵ֖ית מוֹעֵ֣ד לְכׇל־חָֽי׃
Translated:
I know You will bring me to death,
The house assigned for all the living.
Transliteration: khiy-yadaetiy mavet teshiyveniy uveyt mvoed lekhׇl-chay

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ לֹֽא־בְ֭עִי יִשְׁלַח־יָ֑ד אִם־בְּ֝פִיד֗וֹ לָהֶ֥ן שֽׁוּעַ׃
Translated:
Surely He would not strike at a ruin
If, in calamity, one cried out to Him.
Transliteration: akhe lo-veiy yishelach-yad im-vefiydvo lahen shua

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א בָ֭כִיתִי לִקְשֵׁה־י֑וֹם עָֽגְמָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Did I not weep for the unfortunate?
Did I not grieve for the needy?
Transliteration: im-lo vakhiytiy likesheh-yvom agemah nafeshiy laeveyvon

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ט֣וֹב קִ֭וִּיתִי וַיָּ֣בֹא רָ֑ע וַאֲיַחֲלָ֥ה לְ֝א֗וֹר וַיָּ֥בֹא אֹֽפֶל׃
Translated:
I looked forward to good fortune, but evil came;
I hoped for light, but darkness came.
Transliteration: khiy tvov kiviytiy vayavo ra vaayachalah levor vayavo ofel

Hebrew: מֵעַ֖י רֻתְּח֥וּ וְלֹא־דָ֗מּוּ קִדְּמֻ֥נִי יְמֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
Translated:
My bowels are in turmoil without respite;
Days of misery confront me.
Transliteration: meay rutechu velo-damu kidemuniy yemey-oniy

Hebrew: קֹדֵ֣ר הִ֭לַּכְתִּי בְּלֹ֣א חַמָּ֑ה קַ֖מְתִּי בַקָּהָ֣ל אֲשַׁוֵּֽעַ׃
Translated:
I walk about in sunless gloom;
I rise in the assembly and cry out.
Transliteration: koder hilakhetiy velo chamah kametiy vakahal ashavea

Hebrew: אָ֭ח הָיִ֣יתִי לְתַנִּ֑ים וְ֝רֵ֗עַ לִבְנ֥וֹת יַעֲנָֽה׃
Translated:
I have become a brother to jackals,
A companion to ostriches.
Transliteration: ach hayiytiy letaniym verea livenvot yaanah

Hebrew: ע֭וֹרִי שָׁחַ֣ר מֵעָלָ֑י וְעַצְמִי־חָ֝֗רָה מִנִּי־חֹֽרֶב׃
Translated:
My skin, blackened, is peeling off me;
My bones are charred by the heat.
Transliteration: voriy shachar mealay veatsemiy-charah miniy-chorev

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י לְ֭אֵבֶל כִּנֹּרִ֑י וְ֝עֻגָבִ֗י לְק֣וֹל בֹּכִֽים׃
Translated:
So my lyre is given over to mourning,
My pipe, to accompany weepers.
Transliteration: vayehiy leevel khinoriy veugaviy lekvol vokhiym

Hebrew: בְּ֭רִית כָּרַ֣תִּי לְעֵינָ֑י וּמָ֥ה אֶ֝תְבּוֹנֵ֗ן עַל־בְּתוּלָֽה׃
Translated:
I have covenanted with my eyes
Not to gaze on a maiden.
Transliteration: veriyt kharatiy leeynay umah etevvonen al-vetulah

Hebrew: וּמֶ֤ה חֵ֣לֶק אֱל֣וֹהַּ מִמָּ֑עַל וְֽנַחֲלַ֥ת שַׁ֝דַּ֗י מִמְּרֹמִֽים׃
Translated:
What fate is decreed by God above?
What lot, by Shaddai in the heights?
Transliteration: umeh chelek elvoha mimaal venachalat shaday mimeromiym

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־אֵ֥יד לְעַוָּ֑ל וְ֝נֵ֗כֶר לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Calamity is surely for the iniquitous;
Misfortune, for the worker of mischief.
Transliteration: halo-eyd leaval venekher lefoaley aven

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־ה֭וּא יִרְאֶ֣ה דְרָכָ֑י וְֽכׇל־צְעָדַ֥י יִסְפּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Surely He observes my ways,
Takes account of my every step.
Transliteration: halo-hu yireeh derakhay vekhׇl-tseaday yisefvor

Hebrew: אִם־הָלַ֥כְתִּי עִם־שָׁ֑וְא וַתַּ֖חַשׁ עַל־מִרְמָ֣ה רַגְלִֽי׃
Translated:
Have I walked with worthless men,
Or my feet hurried to deceit?
Transliteration: im-halakhetiy im-shave vatachash al-miremah rageliy

Hebrew: יִשְׁקְלֵ֥נִי בְמֹֽאזְנֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וְיֵדַ֥ע אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ תֻּמָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
Let Him weigh me on the scale of righteousness;
Let God ascertain my integrity.
Transliteration: yishekeleniy vemozeney-tsedek veeida elvoha tumatiy

Hebrew: אִ֥ם־תִּטֶּ֣ה אַשֻּׁרִי֮ מִנִּ֢י הַ֫דָּ֥רֶךְ וְאַחַ֣ר עֵ֭ינַי הָלַ֣ךְ לִבִּ֑י וּ֝בְכַפַּ֗י דָּ֣בַק מֽאוּם׃
Translated:
If my feet have strayed from their course,
My heart followed after my eyes,
And a stain sullied my hands,
Transliteration: im-titeh ashuriy mini֢y hadarekhe veachar eynay halakhe liviy uvekhafay davak mum

Hebrew: אֶ֭זְרְעָה וְאַחֵ֣ר יֹאכֵ֑ל וְֽצֶאֱצָאַ֥י יְשֹׁרָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
May I sow, but another reap,
May the growth of my field be uprooted!
Transliteration: ezereah veacher yokhel vetseetsaay yeshorashu

Hebrew: אִם־נִפְתָּ֣ה לִ֭בִּי עַל־אִשָּׁ֑ה וְעַל־פֶּ֖תַח רֵעִ֣י אָרָֽבְתִּי׃
Translated:
If my heart was ravished by the wife of my neighbor,
And I lay in wait at his door,
Transliteration: im-nifetah liviy al-ishah veal-fetach reiy aravetiy

Hebrew: תִּטְחַ֣ן לְאַחֵ֣ר אִשְׁתִּ֑י וְ֝עָלֶ֗יהָ יִכְרְע֥וּן אֲחֵרִֽין׃
Translated:
May my wife grind for another,
May others kneel over her!
Transliteration: titechan leacher ishetiy vealeyha yikhereun acheriyn

Hebrew: כִּי־[הִ֥יא] (הוא) זִמָּ֑ה (והיא) [וְ֝ה֗וּא] עָוֺ֥ן פְּלִילִֽים׃
Translated:
For that would have been debauchery,
A criminal offense,
Transliteration: khiy-[hiy] (hv) zimah (vhy) [vehu] avon feliyliym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣שׁ הִ֭יא עַד־אֲבַדּ֣וֹן תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּֽבְכׇל־תְּב֖וּאָתִ֣י תְשָׁרֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
A fire burning down to Abaddon,
Consuming the roots of all my increase.
Transliteration: khiy esh hiy ad-avadvon tokhel uvekhׇl-tevuatiy tesharesh

Hebrew: אִם־אֶמְאַ֗ס מִשְׁפַּ֣ט עַ֭בְדִּי וַאֲמָתִ֑י בְּ֝רִבָ֗ם עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated:
Did I ever brush aside the case of my servants, man or maid,
When they made a complaint against me?
Transliteration: im-emeas mishefat avediy vaamatiy verivam imadiy

Hebrew: וּמָ֣ה אֶ֭עֱשֶׂה כִּֽי־יָק֣וּם אֵ֑ל וְכִי־יִ֝פְקֹ֗ד מָ֣ה אֲשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
What then should I do when God arises;
When He calls me to account, what should I answer Him?
Transliteration: umah eesheh khiy-yakum el vekhiy-yifekod mah ashiyvenu

Hebrew: הֲֽלֹא־בַ֭בֶּטֶן עֹשֵׂ֣נִי עָשָׂ֑הוּ וַ֝יְכֻנֶ֗נּוּ בָּרֶ֥חֶם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated:
Did not He who made me in my mother’s belly make him?
Did not One form us both in the womb?
Transliteration: halo-vaveten osheniy ashahu vayekhunenu varechem echad

Hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭מְנַע מֵחֵ֣פֶץ דַּלִּ֑ים וְעֵינֵ֖י אַלְמָנָ֣ה אֲכַלֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Did I deny the poor their needs,
Or let a widow pine away,
Transliteration: im-emena mechefets daliym veeyney alemanah akhaleh

Hebrew: וְאֹכַ֣ל פִּתִּ֣י לְבַדִּ֑י וְלֹֽא־אָכַ֖ל יָת֣וֹם מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated:
By eating my food alone,
The fatherless not eating of it also?
Transliteration: veokhal fitiy levadiy velo-akhal yatvom mimenah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מִ֭נְּעוּרַי גְּדֵלַ֣נִי כְאָ֑ב וּמִבֶּ֖טֶן אִמִּ֣י אַנְחֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Why, from my youth he grew up with me as though I were his father;
Since I left my mother’s womb I was her guide.
Transliteration: khiy mineuray gedelaniy kheav umiveten imiy anechenah

Hebrew: אִם־אֶרְאֶ֣ה א֭וֹבֵד מִבְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
I never saw an unclad wretch,
A needy man without clothing,
Transliteration: im-ereeh voved miveliy levush veeyn khesut laeveyvon

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א בֵרְכ֣וּנִי חֲלָצָ֑ו וּמִגֵּ֥ז כְּ֝בָשַׂ֗י יִתְחַמָּֽם׃
Translated:
Whose loins did not bless me
As he warmed himself with the shearings of my sheep.
Transliteration: im-lo verekhuniy chalatsav umigez khevashay yitechamam

Hebrew: אִם־הֲנִיפ֣וֹתִי עַל־יָת֣וֹם יָדִ֑י כִּֽי־אֶרְאֶ֥ה בַ֝שַּׁ֗עַר עֶזְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
If I raised my hand against the fatherless,
Looking to my supporters in the gate,
Transliteration: im-haniyfvotiy al-yatvom yadiy khiy-ereeh vashaar ezeratiy

Hebrew: כְּ֭תֵפִי מִשִּׁכְמָ֣הֿ תִפּ֑וֹל וְ֝אֶזְרֹעִ֗י מִקָּנָ֥הֿ תִשָּׁבֵֽר׃
Translated:
May my arm drop off my shoulder;
My forearm break off at the elbow.
Transliteration: khetefiy mishikhemahֿ tifvol veezeroiy mikanahֿ tishaver

Hebrew: כִּ֤י פַ֣חַד אֵ֭לַי אֵ֣יד אֵ֑ל וּ֝מִשְּׂאֵת֗וֹ לֹ֣א אוּכָֽל׃
Translated:
For I am in dread of God-sent calamity;
I cannot bear His threat.
Transliteration: khiy fachad elay eyd el umisheetvo lo ukhal

Hebrew: אִם־שַׂ֣מְתִּי זָהָ֣ב כִּסְלִ֑י וְ֝לַכֶּ֗תֶם אָמַ֥רְתִּי מִבְטַחִֽי׃
Translated:
Did I put my reliance on gold,
Or regard fine gold as my bulwark?
Transliteration: im-shametiy zahav khiseliy velakhetem amaretiy mivetachiy

Hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭שְׂמַח כִּֽי־רַ֣ב חֵילִ֑י וְכִֽי־כַ֝בִּ֗יר מָצְאָ֥ה יָדִֽי׃
Translated:
Did I rejoice in my great wealth,
In having attained plenty?
Transliteration: im-eshemach khiy-rav cheyliy vekhiy-khaviyr matseah yadiy

Hebrew: אִם־אֶרְאֶ֣ה א֭וֹר כִּ֣י יָהֵ֑ל וְ֝יָרֵ֗חַ יָקָ֥ר הֹלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
If ever I saw the light shining,
The moon on its course in full glory,
Transliteration: im-ereeh vor khiy yahel veyarecha yakar holekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣פְתְּ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר לִבִּ֑י וַתִּשַּׁ֖ק יָדִ֣י לְפִֽי׃
Translated:
And I secretly succumbed,
And my hand touched my mouth in a kiss,
Transliteration: vayifete vaseter liviy vatishak yadiy lefiy

Hebrew: גַּם־ה֭וּא עָוֺ֣ן פְּלִילִ֑י כִּֽי־כִחַ֖שְׁתִּי לָאֵ֣ל מִמָּֽעַל׃
Translated:
That, too, would have been a criminal offense,
For I would have denied God above.
Transliteration: gam-hu avon feliyliy khiy-khichashetiy lael mimaal

Hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭שְׂמַח בְּפִ֣יד מְשַׂנְאִ֑י וְ֝הִתְעֹרַ֗רְתִּי כִּֽי־מְצָ֥אוֹ רָֽע׃
Translated:
Did I rejoice over my enemy’s misfortune?
Did I thrill because evil befell him?
Transliteration: im-eshemach vefiyd meshaneiy vehiteoraretiy khiy-metsavo ra

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נָתַ֣תִּי לַחֲטֹ֣א חִכִּ֑י לִשְׁאֹ֖ל בְּאָלָ֣ה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
I never let my mouth sin
By wishing his death in a curse.
Transliteration: velo-natatiy lachato chikhiy lisheol vealah nafeshvo

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א אָ֭מְרוּ מְתֵ֣י אׇהֳלִ֑י מִי־יִתֵּ֥ן מִ֝בְּשָׂר֗וֹ לֹ֣א נִשְׂבָּֽע׃
Translated:
(Indeed, the men of my clan said,
“We would consume his flesh insatiably!”)
Transliteration: im-lo ameru metey ׇholiy miy-yiten mivesharvo lo nisheva

Hebrew: בַּ֭חוּץ לֹא־יָלִ֣ין גֵּ֑ר דְּ֝לָתַ֗י לָאֹ֥רַח אֶפְתָּֽח׃
Translated:
No sojourner spent the night in the open;
I opened my doors to the road.
Transliteration: vachuts lo-yaliyn ger delatay laorach efetach

Hebrew: אִם־כִּסִּ֣יתִי כְאָדָ֣ם פְּשָׁעָ֑י לִטְמ֖וֹן בְּחֻבִּ֣י עֲוֺנִֽי׃
Translated:
Did I hide my transgressions like Adam,
Bury my wrongdoing in my bosom,
Transliteration: im-khisiytiy kheadam feshaay litemvon vechuviy avoniy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶעֱר֨וֹץ ׀ הָ֘מ֤וֹן רַבָּ֗ה וּבוּז־מִשְׁפָּח֥וֹת יְחִתֵּ֑נִי וָ֝אֶדֹּ֗ם לֹא־אֵ֥צֵא פָֽתַח׃
Translated:
That I should [now] fear the great multitude,
And am shattered by the contempt of families,
So that I keep silent and do not step outdoors?
Transliteration: khiy eervots hamvon ravah uvuz-mishefachvot yechiteniy vaedom lo-etse fatach

Hebrew: מִ֤י יִתֶּן־לִ֨י ׀ שֹׁ֘מֵ֤עַֽ לִ֗י הֶן־תָּ֭וִי שַׁדַּ֣י יַעֲנֵ֑נִי וְסֵ֥פֶר כָּ֝תַ֗ב אִ֣ישׁ רִיבִֽי׃
Translated:
O that I had someone to give me a hearing;
O that Shaddai would reply to my writ,
Or my accuser draw up a true bill!
Transliteration: miy yiten-liy shomea liy hen-taviy shaday yaaneniy vesefer khatav iysh riyviy

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א עַל־שִׁ֭כְמִי אֶשָּׂאֶ֑נּוּ אֶעֶנְדֶ֖נּוּ עֲטָר֣וֹת לִֽי׃
Translated:
I would carry it on my shoulder;
Tie it around me for a wreath.
Transliteration: im-lo al-shikhemiy eshaenu eenedenu atarvot liy

Hebrew: מִסְפַּ֣ר צְ֭עָדַי אַגִּידֶ֑נּוּ כְּמוֹ־נָ֝גִ֗יד אֲקָֽרְבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
I would give him an account of my steps,
Offer it as to a commander.
Transliteration: misefar tseaday agiydenu khemvo-nagiyd akarevenu

Hebrew: אִם־עָ֭לַי אַדְמָתִ֣י תִזְעָ֑ק וְ֝יַ֗חַד תְּלָמֶ֥יהָ יִבְכָּיֽוּן׃
Translated:
If my land cries out against me,
Its furrows weep together;
Transliteration: im-alay adematiy tizeak veyachad telameyha yivekhayun

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֭חָהּ אָכַ֣לְתִּי בְלִי־כָ֑סֶף וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ בְּעָלֶ֣יהָ הִפָּֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
If I have eaten its produce without payment,
And made its [rightful] owners despair,
Transliteration: im-khochah akhaletiy veliy-khasef venefesh vealeyha hifachetiy

Hebrew: תַּ֤חַת חִטָּ֨ה ׀ יֵ֥צֵא ח֗וֹחַ וְתַֽחַת־שְׂעֹרָ֥ה בׇאְשָׁ֑ה תַּ֝֗מּוּ דִּבְרֵ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃ {פ}
Translated:
May nettles grow there instead of wheat;
Instead of barley, stinkweed!

The words of Job are at an end.
Transliteration: tachat chitah eitse chvocha vetachat-sheorah vׇeshah tamu diverey iyyvov {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁבְּת֡וּ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָ֭אֵלֶּה מֵעֲנ֣וֹת אֶת־אִיּ֑וֹב כִּ֤י ה֖וּא צַדִּ֣יק בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: These three men ceased replying to Job, for he considered himself right.
Transliteration: vayishevetu sheloshet haanashiym haeleh meanvot et-iyyvov khiy hu tsadiyk veeynayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤חַר אַ֨ף ׀ אֱלִיה֣וּא בֶן־בַּרַכְאֵ֣ל הַבּוּזִי֮ מִמִּשְׁפַּ֢חַ֫ת רָ֥ם בְּ֭אִיּוֹב חָרָ֣ה אַפּ֑וֹ עַֽל־צַדְּק֥וֹ נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ מֵאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was angry—angry at Job because he thought himself right against God.
Transliteration: vayichar af eliyhu ven-varakheel havuziy mimishefa֢chat ram veiyyvov charah afvo al-tsadekvo nafeshvo meElohim

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת רֵעָיו֮ חָרָ֢ה אַ֫פּ֥וֹ עַ֤ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־מָצְא֣וּ מַעֲנֶ֑ה וַ֝יַּרְשִׁ֗יעוּ אֶת־אִיּֽוֹב׃
Translated: He was angry as well at his three friends, because they found no reply, but merely condemned Job.
Transliteration: uvisheloshet reayv chara֢h afvo al asher lo-matseu maaneh vayareshiyu et-iyyvov

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִיה֗וּ חִכָּ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב בִּדְבָרִ֑ים כִּ֤י זְֽקֵנִים־הֵ֖מָּה מִמֶּ֣נּוּ לְיָמִֽים׃
Translated: Elihu waited out Job’s speech, for they were all older than he.
Transliteration: veeliyhu chikhah et-iyyvov videvariym khiy zekeniym-hemah mimenu leyamiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא אֱלִיה֗וּא כִּ֘י־אֵ֤ין מַעֲנֶ֗ה בְּ֭פִי שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים וַיִּ֥חַר אַפּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: But when Elihu saw that the three men had nothing to reply, he was angry.
Transliteration: vayare eliyhu khiy-eyn maaneh vefiy sheloshet haanashiym vayichar afvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן ׀ אֱלִיה֖וּא בֶן־בַּרַכְאֵ֥ל הַבּוּזִ֗י וַיֹּ֫אמַ֥ר צָ֘עִ֤יר אֲנִ֣י לְ֭יָמִים וְאַתֶּ֣ם יְשִׁישִׁ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֖ן זָחַ֥לְתִּי וָאִירָ֓א ׀ מֵחַוֺּ֖ת דֵּעִ֣י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite said in reply:

I have but few years, while you are old;
Therefore I was too awestruck and fearful
To hold forth among you.
Transliteration: vayaan eliyhu ven-varakheel havuziy vayomar tsaiyr aniy leyamiym veatem yeshiyshiym al-khen zachaletiy vaiyra mechavot deiy etekhem

Hebrew: אָ֭מַרְתִּי יָמִ֣ים יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ וְרֹ֥ב שָׁ֝נִ֗ים יֹדִ֥יעוּ חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
I thought, “Let age speak;
Let advanced years declare wise things.”
Transliteration: amaretiy yamiym yedaveru verov shaniym yodiyu chׇkhemah

Hebrew: אָ֭כֵן רוּחַ־הִ֣יא בֶאֱנ֑וֹשׁ וְנִשְׁמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י תְּבִינֵֽם׃
Translated:
But truly it is the spirit in men,
The breath of Shaddai, that gives them understanding.
Transliteration: akhen rucha-hiy veenvosh venishemat shaday teviynem

Hebrew: לֹא־רַבִּ֥ים יֶחְכָּ֑מוּ וּ֝זְקֵנִ֗ים יָבִ֥ינוּ מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
It is not the aged who are wise,
The elders, who understand how to judge.
Transliteration: lo-raviym yechekhamu uzekeniym yaviynu mishefat

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן אָ֭מַרְתִּי שִׁמְעָה־לִּ֑י אֲחַוֶּ֖ה דֵעִ֣י אַף־אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
Therefore I say, “Listen to me;
I too would hold forth.”
Transliteration: lakhen amaretiy shimeah-liy achaveh deiy af-aniy

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן הוֹחַ֨לְתִּי ׀ לְֽדִבְרֵיכֶ֗ם אָ֭זִין עַד־תְּב֥וּנֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם עַֽד־תַּחְקְר֥וּן מִלִּֽין׃
Translated:
Here I have waited out your speeches,
I have given ear to your insights,
While you probed the issues;
Transliteration: hen hvochaletiy ledivereykhem aziyn ad-tevunoteykhem ad-tachekerun miliyn

Hebrew: וְעָ֥דֵיכֶ֗ם אֶתְבּ֫וֹנָ֥ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵ֣ין לְאִיּ֣וֹב מוֹכִ֑יחַ עוֹנֶ֖ה אֲמָרָ֣יו מִכֶּֽם׃
Translated:
But as I attended to you,
I saw that none of you could argue with Job,
Or offer replies to his statements.
Transliteration: veadeykhem etevvonan vehineh eyn leiyyvov mvokhiycha voneh amarayv mikhem

Hebrew: פֶּן־תֹּ֣֭אמְרוּ מָצָ֣אנוּ חׇכְמָ֑ה אֵ֖ל יִדְּפֶ֣נּוּ לֹא־אִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
I fear you will say, “We have found the wise course;
God will defeat him, not man.”
Transliteration: fen-tomeru matsanu chׇkhemah el yidefenu lo-iysh

Hebrew: וְלֹא־עָרַ֣ךְ אֵלַ֣י מִלִּ֑ין וּ֝בְאִמְרֵיכֶ֗ם לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
He did not set out his case against me,
Nor shall I use your reasons to reply to him.
Transliteration: velo-arakhe elay miliyn uveimereykhem lo ashiyvenu

Hebrew: חַ֭תּוּ לֹא־עָ֣נוּ ע֑וֹד הֶעְתִּ֖יקוּ מֵהֶ֣ם מִלִּֽים׃
Translated:
They have been broken and can no longer reply;
Words fail them.
Transliteration: chatu lo-anu vod heetiyku mehem miliym

Hebrew: וְ֭הוֹחַלְתִּי כִּי־לֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ כִּ֥י עָ֝מְד֗וּ לֹא־עָ֥נוּ עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
I have waited till they stopped speaking,
Till they ended and no longer replied.
Transliteration: vehvochaletiy khiy-lo yedaveru khiy amedu lo-anu vod

Hebrew: אַעֲנֶ֣ה אַף־אֲנִ֣י חֶלְקִ֑י אֲחַוֶּ֖ה דֵעִ֣י אַף־אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
Now I also would have my say;
I too would like to hold forth,
Transliteration: aaneh af-aniy chelekiy achaveh deiy af-aniy

Hebrew: כִּ֭י מָלֵ֣תִי מִלִּ֑ים הֱ֝צִיקַ֗תְנִי ר֣וּחַ בִּטְנִֽי׃
Translated:
For I am full of words;
The wind in my belly presses me.
Transliteration: khiy maletiy miliym hetsiykateniy rucha viteniy

Hebrew: הִנֵּֽה־בִטְנִ֗י כְּיַ֥יִן לֹֽא־יִפָּתֵ֑חַ כְּאֹב֥וֹת חֲ֝דָשִׁ֗ים יִבָּקֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
My belly is like wine not yet opened,
Like jugs of new wine ready to burst.
Transliteration: hineh-viteniy kheyayiin lo-yifatecha kheovvot chadashiym yivakea

Hebrew: אֲדַבְּרָ֥ה וְיִֽרְוַֽח־לִ֑י אֶפְתַּ֖ח שְׂפָתַ֣י וְאֶעֱנֶֽה׃
Translated:
Let me speak, then, and get relief;
Let me open my lips and reply.
Transliteration: adaverah veyirevach-liy efetach shefatay veeeneh

Hebrew: אַל־נָ֭א אֶשָּׂ֣א פְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְאֶל־אָ֝דָ֗ם לֹ֣א אֲכַנֶּֽה׃
Translated:
I would not show regard for any man,
Or temper my speech for anyone’s sake;
Transliteration: al-na esha feney-iysh veel-adam lo akhaneh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֲכַנֶּ֑ה כִּ֝מְעַ֗ט יִשָּׂאֵ֥נִי עֹשֵֽׂנִי׃
Translated:
For I do not know how to temper my speech—
My Maker would soon carry me off!
Transliteration: khiy lo yadaetiy akhaneh khimeat yishaeniy osheniy

Hebrew: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם שְׁמַֽע־נָ֣א אִיּ֣וֹב מִלָּ֑י וְֽכׇל־דְּבָרַ֥י הַאֲזִֽינָה׃
Translated:
But now, Job, listen to my words,
Give ear to all that I say.
Transliteration: veulam shema-na iyyvov milay vekhׇl-devaray haaziynah

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֭א פָּתַ֣חְתִּי פִ֑י דִּבְּרָ֖ה לְשׁוֹנִ֣י בְחִכִּֽי׃
Translated:
Now I open my lips;
My tongue forms words in my mouth.
Transliteration: hineh-na fatachetiy fiy diverah leshvoniy vechikhiy

Hebrew: יֹשֶׁר־לִבִּ֥י אֲמָרָ֑י וְדַ֥עַת שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י בָּר֥וּר מִלֵּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
My words bespeak the uprightness of my heart;
My lips utter insight honestly.
Transliteration: yosher-liviy amaray vedaat shefatay varur milelu

Hebrew: רֽוּחַ־אֵ֥ל עָשָׂ֑תְנִי וְנִשְׁמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י תְּחַיֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
The spirit of God formed me;
The breath of Shaddai sustains me.
Transliteration: rucha-el ashateniy venishemat shaday techayeniy

Hebrew: אִם־תּוּכַ֥ל הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נִי עֶרְכָ֥הֿ לְ֝פָנַ֗י הִתְיַצָּֽבָה׃
Translated:
If you can, answer me;
Argue against me, take your stand.
Transliteration: im-tukhal hashiyveniy erekhahֿ lefanay hiteyatsavah

Hebrew: הֵן־אֲנִ֣י כְפִ֣יךָ לָאֵ֑ל מֵ֝חֹ֗מֶר קֹרַ֥צְתִּי גַם־אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
You and I are the same before God;
I too was nipped from clay.
Transliteration: hen-aniy khefiykha lael mechomer koratsetiy gam-aniy

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה אֵ֭מָתִי לֹ֣א תְבַעֲתֶ֑ךָּ וְ֝אַכְפִּ֗י עָלֶ֥יךָ לֹֽא־יִכְבָּֽד׃
Translated:
You are not overwhelmed by fear of me;
My pressure does not weigh heavily on you.
Transliteration: hineh ematiy lo tevaatekha veakhefiy aleykha lo-yikhevad

Hebrew: אַ֭ךְ אָמַ֣רְתָּ בְאׇזְנָ֑י וְק֖וֹל מִלִּ֣ין אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
Indeed, you have stated in my hearing,
I heard the words spoken,
Transliteration: akhe amareta veׇzenay vekvol miliyn eshema

Hebrew: זַ֥ךְ אֲנִ֗י בְּֽלִ֫י־פָ֥שַׁע חַ֥ף אָנֹכִ֑י וְלֹ֖א עָוֺ֣ן לִֽי׃
Translated:
“I am guiltless, free from transgression;
I am innocent, without iniquity.
Transliteration: zakhe aniy veliy-fasha chaf anokhiy velo avon liy

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן תְּ֭נוּאוֹת עָלַ֣י יִמְצָ֑א יַחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי לְאוֹיֵ֣ב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But He finds reasons to oppose me,
Considers me His enemy.
Transliteration: hen tenuvot alay yimetsa yachesheveniy levoeiv lvo

Hebrew: יָשֵׂ֣ם בַּסַּ֣ד רַגְלָ֑י יִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר כׇּל־אׇרְחֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
He puts my feet in stocks,
Watches all my ways.”
Transliteration: yashem vasad ragelay yishemor khׇl-ׇrechotay

Hebrew: הֶן־זֹ֣את לֹא־צָדַ֣קְתָּ אֶעֱנֶ֑ךָּ כִּי־יִרְבֶּ֥ה אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ מֵאֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
In this you are not right;
I will answer you: God is greater than any man.
Transliteration: hen-zot lo-tsadaketa eenekha khiy-yireveh elvoha meenvosh

Hebrew: מַ֭דּוּעַ אֵלָ֣יו רִיב֑וֹתָ כִּ֥י כׇל־דְּ֝בָרָ֗יו לֹ֣א יַעֲנֶֽה׃
Translated:
Why do you complain against Him
That He does not reply to any of man’s charges?
Transliteration: madua elayv riyvvota khiy khׇl-devarayv lo yaaneh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בְאַחַ֥ת יְדַבֶּר־אֵ֑ל וּ֝בִשְׁתַּ֗יִם לֹ֣א יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
For God speaks time and again—
Though man does not perceive it—
Transliteration: khiy-veachat yedaver-el uvishetayiim lo yeshurenah

Hebrew: בַּחֲל֤וֹם ׀ חֶזְי֬וֹן לַ֗יְלָה בִּנְפֹ֣ל תַּ֭רְדֵּמָה עַל־אֲנָשִׁ֑ים בִּ֝תְנוּמ֗וֹת עֲלֵ֣י מִשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated:
In a dream, a night vision,
When deep sleep falls on men,
While they slumber on their beds.
Transliteration: vachalvom chezeyvon layelah vinefol taredemah al-anashiym vitenumvot aley mishekhav

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יִ֭גְלֶה אֹ֣זֶן אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וּבְמֹ֖סָרָ֣ם יַחְתֹּֽם׃
Translated:
Then He opens men’s understanding,
And by disciplining them leaves His signature
Transliteration: az yigeleh ozen anashiym uvemosaram yachetom

Hebrew: לְ֭הָסִיר אָדָ֣ם מַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְגֵוָ֖ה מִגֶּ֣בֶר יְכַסֶּֽה׃
Translated:
To turn man away from an action,
To suppress pride in man.
Transliteration: lehasiyr adam maasheh vegevah migever yekhaseh

Hebrew: יַחְשֹׂ֣ךְ נַ֭פְשׁוֹ מִנִּי־שָׁ֑חַת וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ מֵעֲבֹ֥ר בַּשָּֽׁלַח׃
Translated:
He spares him from the Pit,
His person, from perishing by the sword.
Transliteration: yacheshokhe nafeshvo miniy-shachat vechayatvo meavor vashalach

Hebrew: וְהוּכַ֣ח בְּ֭מַכְאוֹב עַל־מִשְׁכָּב֑וֹ (וריב) [וְר֖וֹב] עֲצָמָ֣יו אֵתָֽן׃
Translated:
He is reproved by pains on his bed,
And the trembling in his bones is constant.
Transliteration: vehukhach vemakhevov al-mishekhavvo (vryv) [vervov] atsamayv etan

Hebrew: וְזִהֲמַ֣תּוּ חַיָּת֣וֹ לָ֑חֶם וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מַאֲכַ֥ל תַּאֲוָֽה׃
Translated:
He detests food;
Fine food [is repulsive] to him.
Transliteration: vezihamatu chayatvo lachem venafeshvo maakhal taavah

Hebrew: יִ֣כֶל בְּשָׂר֣וֹ מֵרֹ֑אִי (ושפי) [וְשֻׁפּ֥וּ] עַ֝צְמֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א רֻאּֽוּ׃
Translated:
His flesh wastes away till it cannot be seen,
And his bones are rubbed away till they are invisible.
Transliteration: yikhel vesharvo meroiy (vshfy) [veshufu] atsemotayv lo ruu

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרַ֣ב לַשַּׁ֣חַת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ לַֽמְמִתִֽים׃
Translated:
He comes close to the Pit,
His life [verges] on death.
Transliteration: vatikerav lashachat nafeshvo vechayatvo lamemitiym

Hebrew: אִם־יֵ֤שׁ עָלָ֨יו ׀ מַלְאָ֗ךְ מֵלִ֗יץ אֶחָ֥ד מִנִּי־אָ֑לֶף לְהַגִּ֖יד לְאָדָ֣ם יׇשְׁרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
If he has a representative,
One advocate against a thousand
To declare the man’s uprightness,
Transliteration: im-eish alayv maleakhe meliyts echad miniy-alef lehagiyd leadam yׇshervo

Hebrew: וַיְחֻנֶּ֗נּוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר פְּ֭דָעֵהוּ מֵרֶ֥דֶת שָׁ֗חַת מָצָ֥אתִי כֹֽפֶר׃
Translated:
Then He has mercy on him and decrees,
“Redeem him from descending to the Pit,
For I have obtained his ransom;
Transliteration: vayechunenu vayomer fedaehu meredet shachat matsatiy khofer

Hebrew: רֻֽטְפַ֣שׁ בְּשָׂר֣וֹ מִנֹּ֑עַר יָ֝שׁ֗וּב לִימֵ֥י עֲלוּמָֽיו׃
Translated:
Let his flesh be healthier than in his youth;
Let him return to his younger days.”
Transliteration: rutefash vesharvo minoar yashuv liymey alumayv

Hebrew: יֶעְתַּ֤ר אֶל־אֱל֨וֹהַּ ׀ וַיִּרְצֵ֗הוּ וַיַּ֣רְא פָּ֭נָיו בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה וַיָּ֥שֶׁב לֶ֝אֱנ֗וֹשׁ צִדְקָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He prays to God and is accepted by Him;
He enters His presence with shouts of joy,
For He requites a man for his righteousness.
Transliteration: yeetar el-elvoha vayiretsehu vayare fanayv viteruah vayashev leenvosh tsidekatvo

Hebrew: יָשֹׁ֤ר ׀ עַל־אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וַיֹּ֗אמֶר חָ֭טָאתִי וְיָשָׁ֥ר הֶעֱוֵ֗יתִי וְלֹא־שָׁ֥וָה לִֽי׃
Translated:
He declares to men,
“I have sinned; I have perverted what was right;
But I was not paid back for it.”
Transliteration: yashor al-anashiym vayomer chatatiy veyashar heeveytiy velo-shavah liy

Hebrew: פָּדָ֣ה (נפשי) [נַ֭פְשׁוֹ] מֵעֲבֹ֣ר בַּשָּׁ֑חַת (וחיתי) [וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ] בָּא֥וֹר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
He redeemed him from passing into the Pit;
He will enjoy the light.
Transliteration: fadah (nfshy) [nafeshvo] meavor vashachat (vchyty) [vechayatvo] vavor tireeh

Hebrew: הֶן־כׇּל־אֵ֭לֶּה יִפְעַל־אֵ֑ל פַּעֲמַ֖יִם שָׁל֣וֹשׁ עִם־גָּֽבֶר׃
Translated:
Truly, God does all these things
Two or three times to a man,
Transliteration: hen-khׇl-eleh yifeal-el faamayiim shalvosh im-gaver

Hebrew: לְהָשִׁ֣יב נַ֭פְשׁוֹ מִנִּי־שָׁ֑חַת לֵ֝א֗וֹר בְּא֣וֹר הַחַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
To bring him back from the Pit,
That he may bask in the light of life.
Transliteration: lehashiyv nafeshvo miniy-shachat levor vevor hachayiym

Hebrew: הַקְשֵׁ֖ב אִיּ֥וֹב שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י הַ֝חֲרֵ֗שׁ וְאָנֹכִ֥י אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
Pay heed, Job, and hear me;
Be still, and I will speak;
Transliteration: hakeshev iyyvov shema-liy hacharesh veanokhiy adaver

Hebrew: אִם־יֵשׁ־מִלִּ֥ין הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נִי דַּ֝בֵּ֗ר כִּֽי־חָפַ֥צְתִּי צַדְּקֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
If you have what to say, answer me;
Speak, for I am eager to vindicate you.
Transliteration: im-eish-miliyn hashiyveniy daver khiy-chafatsetiy tsadekekha

Hebrew: אִם־אַ֭יִן אַתָּ֥ה שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י הַ֝חֲרֵ֗שׁ וַאֲאַלֶּפְךָ֥ חׇכְמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
But if not, you listen to me;
Be still, and I will teach you wisdom.
Transliteration: im-ayiin atah shema-liy hacharesh vaaalefekha chׇkhemah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אֱלִיה֗וּא וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Elihu said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan eliyhu vayomar

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ חֲכָמִ֣ים מִלָּ֑י וְ֝יֹדְעִ֗ים הַאֲזִ֥ינוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
Listen, O wise men, to my words;
You who have knowledge, give ear to me.
Transliteration: shimeu chakhamiym milay veyodeiym haaziynu liy

Hebrew: כִּי־אֹ֭זֶן מִלִּ֣ין תִּבְחָ֑ן וְ֝חֵ֗ךְ יִטְעַ֥ם לֶאֱכֹֽל׃
Translated:
For the ear tests arguments
As the palate tastes food.
Transliteration: khiy-ozen miliyn tivechan vechekhe yiteam leekhol

Hebrew: מִשְׁפָּ֥ט נִבְחֲרָה־לָּ֑נוּ נֵדְעָ֖ה בֵינֵ֣ינוּ מַה־טּֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Let us decide for ourselves what is just;
Let us know among ourselves what is good.
Transliteration: mishefat nivecharah-lanu nedeah veyneynu mah-tvov

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר אִיּ֣וֹב צָדַ֑קְתִּי וְ֝אֵ֗ל הֵסִ֥יר מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃
Translated:
For Job has said, “I am right;
God has deprived me of justice.
Transliteration: khiy-amar iyyvov tsadaketiy veel hesiyr mishefatiy

Hebrew: עַל־מִשְׁפָּטִ֥י אֲכַזֵּ֑ב אָנ֖וּשׁ חִצִּ֣י בְלִי־פָֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
I declare the judgment against me false;
My arrow-wound is deadly, though I am free from transgression.”
Transliteration: al-mishefatiy akhazev anush chitsiy veliy-fasha

Hebrew: מִי־גֶ֥בֶר כְּאִיּ֑וֹב יִֽשְׁתֶּה־לַּ֥עַג כַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated:
What man is like Job,
Who drinks mockery like water;
Transliteration: miy-gever kheiyyvov yisheteh-laag khamayiim

Hebrew: וְאָרַ֣ח לְ֭חֶבְרָה עִם־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן וְ֝לָלֶ֗כֶת עִם־אַנְשֵׁי־רֶֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
Who makes common cause with evildoers,
And goes with wicked men?
Transliteration: vearach lecheverah im-foaley aven velalekhet im-aneshey-resha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָ֭מַר לֹ֣א יִסְכׇּן־גָּ֑בֶר בִּ֝רְצֹת֗וֹ עִם־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
For he says, “Man gains nothing
When he is in God’s favor.”
Transliteration: khiy-amar lo yisekhׇn-gaver viretsotvo im-Elohim

Hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ אַ֥נְשֵׁ֥י לֵבָ֗ב שִׁמְע֫וּ־לִ֥י חָלִ֖לָה לָאֵ֥ל מֵרֶ֗שַׁע וְשַׁדַּ֥י מֵעָֽוֶל׃
Translated:
Therefore, men of understanding, listen to me;
Wickedness be far from God,
Wrongdoing, from Shaddai!
Transliteration: lakhen aneshey levav shimeu-liy chalilah lael meresha veshaday meavel

Hebrew: כִּ֤י פֹ֣עַל אָ֭דָם יְשַׁלֶּם־ל֑וֹ וּֽכְאֹ֥רַח אִ֝֗ישׁ יַמְצִאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
For He pays a man according to his actions,
And provides for him according to his conduct;
Transliteration: khiy foal adam yeshalem-lvo ukheorach iysh yametsienu

Hebrew: אַף־אׇמְנָ֗ם אֵ֥ל לֹֽא־יַרְשִׁ֑יעַ וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י לֹא־יְעַוֵּ֥ת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
For God surely does not act wickedly;
Shaddai does not pervert justice.
Transliteration: af-ׇmenam el lo-yareshiya veshaday lo-yeavet mishefat

Hebrew: מִֽי־פָקַ֣ד עָלָ֣יו אָ֑רְצָה וּמִ֥י שָׂ֝֗ם תֵּבֵ֥ל כֻּלָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Who placed the earth in His charge?
Who ordered the entire world?
Transliteration: miy-fakad alayv aretsah umiy sham tevel khulah

Hebrew: אִם־יָשִׂ֣ים אֵלָ֣יו לִבּ֑וֹ רוּח֥וֹ וְ֝נִשְׁמָת֗וֹ אֵלָ֥יו יֶאֱסֹֽף׃
Translated:
If He but intends it,
He can call back His spirit and breath;
Transliteration: im-yashiym elayv livvo ruchvo venishematvo elayv yeesof

Hebrew: יִגְוַ֣ע כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֣ר יָ֑חַד וְ֝אָדָ֗ם עַל־עָפָ֥ר יָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
All flesh would at once expire,
And mankind return to dust.
Transliteration: yigeva khׇl-vashar yachad veadam al-afar yashuv

Hebrew: וְאִם־בִּ֥ינָה שִׁמְעָה־זֹּ֑את הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינָה לְק֣וֹל מִלָּֽי׃
Translated:
If you would understand, listen to this;
Give ear to what I say.
Transliteration: veim-viynah shimeah-zot haaziynah lekvol milay

Hebrew: הַאַ֬ף שׂוֹנֵ֣א מִשְׁפָּ֣ט יַחֲב֑וֹשׁ וְאִם־צַדִּ֖יק כַּבִּ֣יר תַּרְשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
Would one who hates justice govern?
Would you condemn the Just Mighty One?
Transliteration: haaf shvone mishefat yachavvosh veim-tsadiyk khaviyr tareshiya

Hebrew: הַאֲמֹ֣ר לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בְּלִיָּ֑עַל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע אֶל־נְדִיבִֽים׃
Translated:
Would you call a king a scoundrel,
Great men, wicked?
Transliteration: haamor lemelekhe veliyaal rasha el-nediyviym

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־נָשָׂ֨א ׀ פְּנֵ֥י שָׂרִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א נִכַּר־שׁ֭וֹעַ לִפְנֵי־דָ֑ל כִּֽי־מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדָ֣יו כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated:
He is not partial to princes;
The noble are not preferred to the wretched;
For all of them are the work of His hands.
Transliteration: asher lo-nasha feney shariym velo nikhar-shvoa lifeney-dal khiy-maasheh yadayv khulam

Hebrew: רֶ֤גַע ׀ יָמֻתוּ֮ וַחֲצ֢וֹת לָ֥֫יְלָה יְגֹעֲשׁ֣וּ עָ֣ם וְיַעֲבֹ֑רוּ וְיָסִ֥ירוּ אַ֝בִּ֗יר לֹ֣א בְיָֽד׃
Translated:
Some die suddenly in the middle of the night;
People are in turmoil and pass on;
Even great men are removed—not by human hands.
Transliteration: rega yamutu vachats֢vot layelah yegoashu am veyaavoru veyasiyru aviyr lo veyad

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עֵ֭ינָיו עַל־דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְֽכׇל־צְעָדָ֥יו יִרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
For His eyes are upon a man’s ways;
He observes his every step.
Transliteration: khiy-eynayv al-darekhey-iysh vekhׇl-tseadayv yireeh

Hebrew: אֵֽין־חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וְאֵ֣ין צַלְמָ֑וֶת לְהִסָּ֥תֶר שָׁ֝֗ם פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Neither darkness nor gloom offers
A hiding-place for evildoers.
Transliteration: eyn-choshekhe veeyn tsalemavet lehisater sham foaley aven

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א עַל־אִ֭ישׁ יָשִׂ֣ים ע֑וֹד לַהֲלֹ֥ךְ אֶל־אֵ֝֗ל בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
He has no set time for man
To appear before God in judgment.
Transliteration: khiy lo al-iysh yashiym vod lahalokhe el-el vamishefat

Hebrew: יָרֹ֣עַ כַּבִּירִ֣ים לֹא־חֵ֑קֶר וַיַּעֲמֵ֖ד אֲחֵרִ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
He shatters mighty men without number
And sets others in their place.
Transliteration: yaroa khaviyriym lo-cheker vayaamed acheriym tachetam

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יַ֭כִּיר מַעְבָּדֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָ֥פַךְ לַ֝֗יְלָה וְיִדַּכָּֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Truly, He knows their deeds;
Night is over, and they are crushed.
Transliteration: lakhen yakhiyr maevadeyhem vehafakhe layelah veyidakhau

Hebrew: תַּֽחַת־רְשָׁעִ֥ים סְפָקָ֗ם בִּמְק֥וֹם רֹאִֽים׃
Translated:
He strikes them down with the wicked
Where people can see,
Transliteration: tachat-reshaiym sefakam vimekvom roiym

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כֵּ֭ן סָ֣רוּ מֵאַחֲרָ֑יו וְכׇל־דְּ֝רָכָ֗יו לֹ֣א הִשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃
Translated:
Because they have been disloyal to Him
And have not understood any of His ways;
Transliteration: asher al-khen saru meacharayv vekhׇl-derakhayv lo hishekhiylu

Hebrew: לְהָבִ֣יא עָ֭לָיו צַעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל וְצַעֲקַ֖ת עֲנִיִּ֣ים יִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
Thus He lets the cry of the poor come before Him;
He listens to the cry of the needy.
Transliteration: lehaviy alayv tsaakat-dal vetsaakat aniyiym yishema

Hebrew: וְה֤וּא יַשְׁקִ֨ט ׀ וּמִ֥י יַרְשִׁ֗עַ וְיַסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נִים וּמִ֣י יְשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ וְעַל־גּ֖וֹי וְעַל־אָדָ֣ם יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
When He is silent, who will condemn?
If He hides His face, who will see Him,
Be it nation or man?
Transliteration: vehu yashekit umiy yareshia veyaseter faniym umiy yeshurenu veal-gvoy veal-adam yachad

Hebrew: מִ֭מְּלֹךְ אָדָ֥ם חָנֵ֗ף מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי עָֽם׃
Translated:
The impious man rules no more,
Nor do those who ensnare the people.
Transliteration: mimelokhe adam chanef mimokeshey am

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֶל־אֵ֭ל הֶאָמַ֥ר נָשָׂ֗אתִי לֹ֣א אֶחְבֹּֽל׃
Translated:
Has he said to God,
“I will bear [my punishment] and offend no more.
Transliteration: khiy-el-el heamar nashatiy lo echevol

Hebrew: בִּלְעֲדֵ֣י אֶ֭חֱזֶה אַתָּ֣ה הֹרֵ֑נִי אִֽם־עָ֥וֶל פָּ֝עַ֗לְתִּי לֹ֣א אֹסִֽיף׃
Translated:
What I cannot see You teach me.
If I have done iniquity, I shall not do so again”?
Transliteration: vileadey echezeh atah horeniy im-avel faaletiy lo osiyf

Translated:
Should He requite as you see fit?
But you have despised [Him]!
You must decide, not I;
Speak what you know.
Transliteration: hameimekha yeshalemenah khiy-maaseta khiy-atah tivechar velo-aniy umah-yadaeta daver

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י לֵ֭בָב יֹ֣אמְרוּ לִ֑י וְגֶ֥בֶר חָ֝כָ֗ם שֹׁמֵ֥עַֽ לִֽי׃
Translated:
Men of understanding say to me,
Wise men who hear me,
Transliteration: aneshey levav yomeru liy vegever chakham shomea liy

Hebrew: אִ֭יּוֹב לֹא־בְדַ֣עַת יְדַבֵּ֑ר וּ֝דְבָרָ֗יו לֹ֣א בְהַשְׂכֵּֽיל׃
Translated:
“Job does not speak with knowledge;
His words lack understanding.”
Transliteration: iyyvov lo-vedaat yedaver udevarayv lo vehashekheyl

Hebrew: אָבִ֗י יִבָּחֵ֣ן אִיּ֣וֹב עַד־נֶ֑צַח עַל־תְּ֝שֻׁבֹ֗ת בְּאַנְשֵׁי־אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Would that Job were tried to the limit
For answers which befit sinful men.
Transliteration: aviy yivachen iyyvov ad-netsach al-teshuvot veaneshey-aven

Hebrew: כִּ֥י־יֹ֘סִ֤יף עַֽל־חַטָּאת֣וֹ פֶ֭שַׁע בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ יִשְׂפּ֑וֹק וְיֶ֖רֶב אֲמָרָ֣יו לָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
He adds to his sin;
He increases his transgression among us;
He multiplies his statements against God.
Transliteration: khiy-yosiyf al-chatatvo fesha veyneynu yishefvok veyerev amarayv lael {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אֱלִיה֗וּ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Elihu said in reply:
Transliteration: vayaan eliyhu vayomar

Hebrew: הֲ֭זֹאת חָשַׁ֣בְתָּ לְמִשְׁפָּ֑ט אָ֝מַ֗רְתָּ צִדְקִ֥י מֵאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Do you think it just
To say, “I am right against God”?
Transliteration: hazot chashaveta lemishefat amareta tsidekiy meel

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֹ֭אמַר מַה־יִּסְכׇּן־לָ֑ךְ מָה־אֹ֝עִ֗יל מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃
Translated:
If you ask how it benefits you,
“What have I gained from not sinning?”
Transliteration: khiy-tomar mah-yisekhׇn-lakhe mah-oiyl mechatatiy

Hebrew: אֲ֭נִי אֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֣ מִלִּ֑ין וְֽאֶת־רֵעֶ֥יךָ עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
I shall give you a reply,
You, along with your friends.
Transliteration: aniy ashiyvekha miliyn veet-reeykha imakhe

Hebrew: הַבֵּ֣ט שָׁמַ֣יִם וּרְאֵ֑ה וְשׁ֥וּר שְׁ֝חָקִ֗ים גָּבְה֥וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Behold the heavens and see;
Look at the skies high above you.
Transliteration: havet shamayiim ureeh veshur shechakiym gavehu mimekha

Hebrew: אִם־חָ֭טָאתָ מַה־תִּפְעׇל־בּ֑וֹ וְרַבּ֥וּ פְ֝שָׁעֶ֗יךָ מַה־תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
If you sin, what do you do to Him?
If your transgressions are many,
How do you affect Him?
Transliteration: im-chatata mah-tifeׇl-vvo veravu feshaeykha mah-taasheh-lvo

Hebrew: אִם־צָ֭דַקְתָּ מַה־תִּתֶּן־ל֑וֹ א֥וֹ מַה־מִּיָּדְךָ֥ יִקָּֽח׃
Translated:
If you are righteous,
What do you give Him;
What does He receive from your hand?
Transliteration: im-tsadaketa mah-titen-lvo vo mah-miyadekha yikach

Hebrew: לְאִישׁ־כָּמ֥וֹךָ רִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וּלְבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם צִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Your wickedness affects men like yourself;
Your righteousness, mortals.
Transliteration: leiysh-khamvokha risheekha uleven-adam tsidekatekha

Hebrew: מֵ֭רֹב עֲשׁוּקִ֣ים יַזְעִ֑יקוּ יְשַׁוְּע֖וּ מִזְּר֣וֹעַ רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
Because of contention the oppressed cry out;
They shout because of the power of the great.
Transliteration: merov ashukiym yazeiyku yeshaveu mizervoa raviym

Hebrew: וְֽלֹא־אָמַ֗ר אַ֭יֵּה אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֹשָׂ֑י נֹתֵ֖ן זְמִר֣וֹת בַּלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
But none says, “Where is my God, my Maker,
Who gives strength in the night;
Transliteration: velo-amar ayeh elvoha oshay noten zemirvot valayelah

Hebrew: מַ֭לְּפֵנוּ מִבַּהֲמ֣וֹת אָ֑רֶץ וּמֵע֖וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יְחַכְּמֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth,
Makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?”
Transliteration: malefenu mivahamvot arets umevof hashamayiim yechakhemenu

Hebrew: שָׁ֣ם יִ֭צְעֲקוּ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֑ה מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י גְּא֣וֹן רָעִֽים׃
Translated:
Then they cry out, but He does not respond
Because of the arrogance of evil men.
Transliteration: sham yitseaku velo yaaneh mifeney gevon raiym

Hebrew: אַךְ־שָׁ֭וְא לֹא־יִשְׁמַ֥ע <small>׀</small> אֵ֑ל וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י לֹ֣א יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Surely it is false that God does not listen,
That Shaddai does not take note of it.
Transliteration: akhe-shave lo-yishema <small></small> el veshaday lo yeshurenah

Hebrew: אַ֣ף כִּֽי־תֹ֭אמַר לֹ֣א תְשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ דִּ֥ין לְ֝פָנָ֗יו וּתְח֥וֹלֵֽל לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Though you say, “You do not take note of it,”
The case is before Him;
So wait for Him.
Transliteration: af khiy-tomar lo teshurenu diyn lefanayv utechvolel lvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כִּי־אַ֭יִן פָּקַ֣ד אַפּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע בַּפַּ֣שׁ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
But since now it does not seem so,
He vents his anger;
He does not realize that it may be long drawn out.
Transliteration: veatah khiy-ayiin fakad afvo velo-yada vafash meod

Hebrew: וְ֭אִיּוֹב הֶ֣בֶל יִפְצֶה־פִּ֑יהוּ בִּבְלִי־דַ֝֗עַת מִלִּ֥ין יַכְבִּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Hence Job mouths empty words,
And piles up words without knowledge.
Transliteration: veiyyvov hevel yifetseh-fiyhu viveliy-daat miliyn yakhevir {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥סֶף אֱלִיה֗וּא וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then Elihu spoke once more.
Transliteration: vayosef eliyhu vayomar

Hebrew: כַּתַּר־לִ֣י זְ֭עֵיר וַאֲחַוֶּ֑ךָּ כִּ֤י ע֖וֹד לֶאֱל֣וֹהַּ מִלִּֽים׃
Translated:
Wait a little and let me hold forth;
There is still more to say for God.
Transliteration: khatar-liy zeeyr vaachavekha khiy vod leelvoha miliym

Hebrew: אֶשָּׂ֣א דֵ֭עִי לְמֵרָח֑וֹק וּ֝לְפֹעֲלִ֗י אֶֽתֵּֽן־צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
I will make my opinions widely known;
I will justify my Maker.
Transliteration: esha deiy lemerachvok ulefoaliy eten-tsedek

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אׇ֭מְנָם לֹא־שֶׁ֣קֶר מִלָּ֑י תְּמִ֖ים דֵּע֣וֹת עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
In truth, my words are not false;
A man of sound opinions is before you.
Transliteration: khiy-ׇmenam lo-sheker milay temiym devot imakhe

Hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֣ל כַּ֭בִּיר וְלֹ֣א יִמְאָ֑ס כַּ֝בִּ֗יר כֹּ֣חַֽ לֵֽב׃
Translated:
See, God is mighty; He is not contemptuous;
He is mighty in strength and mind.
Transliteration: hen-el khaviyr velo yimeas khaviyr khocha lev

Hebrew: לֹא־יְחַיֶּ֥ה רָשָׁ֑ע וּמִשְׁפַּ֖ט עֲנִיִּ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃
Translated:
He does not let the wicked live;
He grants justice to the lowly.
Transliteration: lo-yechayeh rasha umishefat aniyiym yiten

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִגְרַ֥ע מִצַּדִּ֗יק עֵ֫ינָ֥יו וְאֶת־מְלָכִ֥ים לַכִּסֵּ֑א וַיֹּשִׁיבֵ֥ם לָ֝נֶ֗צַח וַיִּגְבָּֽהוּ׃
Translated:
He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous;
With kings on thrones
He seats them forever, and they are exalted.
Transliteration: lo-yigera mitsadiyk eynayv veet-melakhiym lakhise vayoshiyvem lanetsach vayigevahu

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֲסוּרִ֥ים בַּזִּקִּ֑ים יִ֝לָּכְד֗וּן בְּחַבְלֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
Translated:
If they are bound in shackles
And caught in trammels of affliction,
Transliteration: veim-asuriym vazikiym yilakhedun vechaveley-oniy

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לָהֶ֣ם פׇּעֳלָ֑ם וּ֝פִשְׁעֵיהֶ֗ם כִּ֣י יִתְגַּבָּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
He declares to them what they have done,
And that their transgressions are excessive;
Transliteration: vayaged lahem fׇolam ufisheeyhem khiy yitegavaru

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣גֶל אׇ֭זְנָם לַמּוּסָ֑ר וַ֝יֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־יְשׁוּב֥וּן מֵאָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
He opens their understanding by discipline,
And orders them back from mischief.
Transliteration: vayigel ׇzenam lamusar vayomer khiy-yeshuvun meaven

Hebrew: אִֽם־יִשְׁמְע֗וּ וְֽיַ֫עֲבֹ֥דוּ יְכַלּ֣וּ יְמֵיהֶ֣ם בַּטּ֑וֹב וּ֝שְׁנֵיהֶ֗ם בַּנְּעִימִֽים׃
Translated:
If they will serve obediently,
They shall spend their days in happiness,
Their years in delight.
Transliteration: im-yishemeu veyaavodu yekhalu yemeyhem vatvov usheneyhem vaneiymiym

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֣א יִ֭שְׁמְעוּ בְּשֶׁ֣לַח יַעֲבֹ֑רוּ וְ֝יִגְוְע֗וּ בִּבְלִי־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
But if they are not obedient,
They shall perish by the sword,
Die for lack of understanding.
Transliteration: veim-lo yishemeu veshelach yaavoru veyiigeveu viveliy-daat

Hebrew: וְֽחַנְפֵי־לֵ֭ב יָשִׂ֣ימוּ אָ֑ף לֹ֥א יְ֝שַׁוְּע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲסָרָֽם׃
Translated:
But the impious in heart become enraged;
They do not cry for help when He afflicts them.
Transliteration: vechanefey-lev yashiymu af lo yeshaveu khiy asaram

Hebrew: תָּמֹ֣ת בַּנֹּ֣עַר נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְ֝חַיָּתָ֗ם בַּקְּדֵשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
They die in their youth;
[Expire] among the depraved.
Transliteration: tamot vanoar nafesham vechayatam vakedeshiym

Hebrew: יְחַלֵּ֣ץ עָנִ֣י בְעׇנְי֑וֹ וְיִ֖גֶל בַּלַּ֣חַץ אׇזְנָֽם׃
Translated:
He rescues the lowly from their affliction,
And opens their understanding through distress.
Transliteration: yechalets aniy veׇneyvo veyigel valachats ׇzenam

Hebrew: וְאַ֤ף הֲסִֽיתְךָ֨ ׀ מִפִּי־צָ֗ר רַ֭חַב לֹא־מוּצָ֣ק תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ וְנַ֥חַת שֻׁ֝לְחָנְךָ֗ מָ֣לֵא דָֽשֶׁן׃
Translated:
Indeed, He draws you away from the brink of distress
To a broad place where there is no constraint;
Your table is laid out with rich food.
Transliteration: veaf hasiytekha mifiy-tsar rachav lo-mutsak tacheteyha venachat shulechanekha male dashen

Hebrew: וְדִין־רָשָׁ֥ע מָלֵ֑אתָ דִּ֖ין וּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃
Translated:
You are obsessed with the case of the wicked man,
But the justice of the case will be upheld.
Transliteration: vediyn-rasha maleta diyn umishefat yitemokhu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חֵ֭מָה פֶּן־יְסִֽיתְךָ֣ בְסָ֑פֶק וְרׇב־כֹּ֝֗פֶר אַל־יַטֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Let anger at his affluence not mislead you;
Let much bribery not turn you aside.
Transliteration: khiy-chemah fen-yesiytekha vesafek verׇv-khofer al-yatekha

Hebrew: הֲיַעֲרֹ֣ךְ שׁ֭וּעֲךָ לֹ֣א בְצָ֑ר וְ֝כֹ֗ל מַאֲמַצֵּי־כֹֽחַ׃
Translated:
Will your limitless wealth avail you,
All your powerful efforts?
Transliteration: hayaarokhe shuakha lo vetsar vekhol maamatsey-khocha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּשְׁאַ֥ף הַלָּ֑יְלָה לַעֲל֖וֹת עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
Do not long for the night
When peoples vanish where they are.
Transliteration: al-tisheaf halayelah laalvot amiym tachetam

Hebrew: הִ֭שָּׁמֶר אַל־תֵּ֣פֶן אֶל־אָ֑וֶן כִּֽי־עַל־זֶ֝֗ה בָּחַ֥רְתָּ מֵעֹֽנִי׃
Translated:
Beware! Do not turn to mischief;
Because of that you have been tried by affliction.
Transliteration: hishamer al-tefen el-aven khiy-al-zeh vachareta meoniy

Hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֭ל יַשְׂגִּ֣יב בְּכֹח֑וֹ מִ֖י כָמֹ֣הוּ מוֹרֶֽה׃
Translated:
See, God is beyond reach in His power;
Who governs like Him?
Transliteration: hen-el yashegiyv vekhochvo miy khamohu mvoreh

Hebrew: מִֽי־פָקַ֣ד עָלָ֣יו דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּמִי־אָ֝מַ֗ר פָּעַ֥לְתָּ עַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Who ever reproached Him for His conduct?
Who ever said, “You have done wrong”?
Transliteration: miy-fakad alayv darekhvo umiy-amar faaleta avelah

Hebrew: זְ֭כֹר כִּֽי־תַשְׂגִּ֣יא פׇעֳל֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר שֹׁרְר֣וּ אֲנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
Remember, then, to magnify His work,
Of which men have sung,
Transliteration: zekhor khiy-tashegiy fׇolvo asher shoreru anashiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־אָדָ֥ם חָזוּ־ב֑וֹ אֱ֝נ֗וֹשׁ יַבִּ֥יט מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
Translated:
Which all men have beheld,
Men have seen, from a distance.
Transliteration: khׇl-adam chazu-vvo envosh yaviyt merachvok

Hebrew: הֶן־אֵ֣ל שַׂ֭גִּיא וְלֹ֣א נֵדָ֑ע מִסְפַּ֖ר שָׁנָ֣יו וְלֹא־חֵֽקֶר׃
Translated:
See, God is greater than we can know;
The number of His years cannot be counted.
Transliteration: hen-el shagiy velo neda misefar shanayv velo-cheker

Hebrew: כִּ֭י יְגָרַ֣ע נִטְפֵי־מָ֑יִם יָזֹ֖קּוּ מָטָ֣ר לְאֵדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He forms the droplets of water,
Which cluster into rain, from His mist.
Transliteration: khiy yegara nitefey-mayiim yazoku matar leedvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶֽׁר־יִזְּל֥וּ שְׁחָקִ֑ים יִ֝רְעֲפ֗וּ עֲלֵ֤י ׀ אָדָ֬ם רָֽב׃
Translated:
The skies rain;
They pour down on all mankind.
Transliteration: asher-yizelu shechakiym yireafu aley adam rav

Hebrew: אַ֣ף אִם־יָ֭בִין מִפְרְשֵׂי־עָ֑ב תְּ֝שֻׁא֗וֹת סֻכָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Can one, indeed, contemplate the expanse of clouds,
The thunderings from His pavilion?
Transliteration: af im-yaviyn mifereshey-av teshuvot sukhatvo

Hebrew: הֵן־פָּרַ֣שׂ עָלָ֣יו אוֹר֑וֹ וְשׇׁרְשֵׁ֖י הַיָּ֣ם כִּסָּֽה׃
Translated:
See, He spreads His lightning over it;
It fills the bed of the sea.
Transliteration: hen-farash alayv vorvo veshׇreshey hayam khisah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בָ֭ם יָדִ֣ין עַמִּ֑ים יִֽתֶּן־אֹ֥כֶל לְמַכְבִּֽיר׃
Translated:
By these things He controls peoples;
He gives food in abundance.
Transliteration: khiy-vam yadiyn amiym yiten-okhel lemakheviyr

Hebrew: עַל־כַּפַּ֥יִם כִּסָּה־א֑וֹר וַיְצַ֖ו עָלֶ֣יהָ בְמַפְגִּֽיעַ׃
Translated:
Lightning fills His hands;
He orders it to hit the mark.
Transliteration: al-khafayiim khisah-vor vayetsav aleyha vemafegiya

Hebrew: יַגִּ֣יד עָלָ֣יו רֵע֑וֹ מִ֝קְנֶ֗ה אַ֣ף עַל־עוֹלֶֽה׃
Translated:
Its noise tells of Him.
The kindling of anger against iniquity.
Transliteration: yagiyd alayv revo mikeneh af al-voleh

Hebrew: אַף־לְ֭זֹאת יֶחֱרַ֣ד לִבִּ֑י וְ֝יִתַּ֗ר מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Because of this, too, my heart quakes,
And leaps from its place.
Transliteration: af-lezot yecherad liviy veyiitar mimekvomvo

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ שָׁמ֣וֹעַ בְּרֹ֣גֶז קֹל֑וֹ וְ֝הֶ֗גֶה מִפִּ֥יו יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
Just listen to the noise of His rumbling,
To the sound that comes out of His mouth.
Transliteration: shimeu shamvoa verogez kolvo vehegeh mifiyv eitse

Hebrew: תַּֽחַת־כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֥יִם יִשְׁרֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אוֹר֗וֹ עַל־כַּנְפ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
He lets it loose beneath the entire heavens—
His lightning, to the ends of the earth.
Transliteration: tachat-khׇl-hashamayiim yisherehu vevorvo al-khanefvot haarets

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֤יו ׀ יִשְׁאַג־ק֗וֹל יַ֭רְעֵם בְּק֣וֹל גְּאוֹנ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יְ֝עַקְּבֵ֗ם כִּֽי־יִשָּׁמַ֥ע קוֹלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
After it, He lets out a roar;
He thunders in His majestic voice.
No one can find a trace of it by the time His voice is heard.
Transliteration: acharayv yisheag-kvol yareem vekvol gevonvo velo yeakevem khiy-yishama kvolvo

Hebrew: יַרְעֵ֤ם אֵ֣ל בְּ֭קוֹלוֹ נִפְלָא֑וֹת עֹשֶׂ֥ה גְ֝דֹל֗וֹת וְלֹ֣א נֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
God thunders marvelously with His voice;
He works wonders that we cannot understand.
Transliteration: yareem el vekvolvo nifelavot osheh gedolvot velo neda

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לַשֶּׁ֨לֶג ׀ יֹאמַ֗ר הֱוֵ֫א־אָ֥רֶץ וְגֶ֥שֶׁם מָטָ֑ר וְ֝גֶ֗שֶׁם מִטְר֥וֹת עֻזּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He commands the snow, “Fall to the ground!”
And the downpour of rain, His mighty downpour of rain,
Transliteration: khiy lasheleg yomar heve-arets vegeshem matar vegeshem mitervot uzvo

Hebrew: בְּיַד־כׇּל־אָדָ֥ם יַחְתּ֑וֹם לָ֝דַ֗עַת כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י מַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃
Translated:
Is as a sign on every man’s hand,
That all men may know His doings.
Transliteration: veyad-khׇl-adam yachetvom ladaat khׇl-aneshey maashehu

Hebrew: וַתָּב֣וֹא חַיָּ֣ה בְמוֹ־אָ֑רֶב וּבִמְע֖וֹנֹתֶ֣יהָ תִשְׁכֹּֽן׃
Translated:
Then the beast enters its lair,
And remains in its den.
Transliteration: vatavvo chayah vemvo-arev uvimevonoteyha tishekhon

Hebrew: מִן־הַ֭חֶדֶר תָּב֣וֹא סוּפָ֑ה וּֽמִמְּזָרִ֥ים קָרָֽה׃
Translated:
The storm wind comes from its chamber,
And the cold from the constellations.
Transliteration: min-hacheder tavvo sufah umimezariym karah

Hebrew: מִנִּשְׁמַת־אֵ֥ל יִתֶּן־קָ֑רַח וְרֹ֖חַב מַ֣יִם בְּמוּצָֽק׃
Translated:
By the breath of God ice is formed,
And the expanse of water becomes solid.
Transliteration: minishemat-el yiten-karach verochav mayiim vemutsak

Hebrew: אַף־בְּ֭רִי יַטְרִ֣יחַ עָ֑ב יָ֝פִ֗יץ עֲנַ֣ן אוֹרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He also loads the clouds with moisture
And scatters His lightning-clouds.
Transliteration: af-veriy yateriycha av yafiyts anan vorvo

Hebrew: וְה֤וּא מְסִבּ֨וֹת ׀ מִתְהַפֵּ֣ךְ בְּתַחְבּוּלֹתָ֣ו לְפׇעֳלָ֑ם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצַוֵּ֓ם ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֖י תֵבֵ֣ל אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated:
He keeps turning events by His stratagems,
That they might accomplish all that He commands them
Throughout the inhabited earth,
Transliteration: vehu mesivvot mitehafekhe vetachevulotav lefׇolam khol asher yetsavem al-feney tevel aretsah

Hebrew: אִם־לְשֵׁ֥בֶט אִם־לְאַרְצ֑וֹ אִם־לְ֝חֶ֗סֶד יַמְצִאֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Causing each of them to happen to His land,
Whether as a scourge or as a blessing.
Transliteration: im-leshevet im-learetsvo im-lechesed yametsiehu

Hebrew: הַאֲזִ֣ינָה זֹּ֣את אִיּ֑וֹב עֲ֝מֹ֗ד וְהִתְבּוֹנֵ֤ן ׀ נִפְלְא֬וֹת אֵֽל׃
Translated:
Give ear to this, Job;
Stop to consider the marvels of God.
Transliteration: haaziynah zot iyyvov amod vehitevvonen nifelevot el

Hebrew: הֲ֭תֵדַע בְּשׂוּם־אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝הֹפִ֗יעַ א֣וֹר עֲנָנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do you know what charge God lays upon them
When His lightning-clouds shine?
Transliteration: hateda veshum-elvoha aleyhem vehofiya vor ananvo

Hebrew: הֲ֭תֵדַע עַל־מִפְלְשֵׂי־עָ֑ב מִ֝פְלְא֗וֹת תְּמִ֣ים דֵּעִֽים׃
Translated:
Do you know the marvels worked upon the expanse of clouds
By Him whose understanding is perfect,
Transliteration: hateda al-mifeleshey-av mifelevot temiym deiym

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־בְּגָדֶ֥יךָ חַמִּ֑ים בְּהַשְׁקִ֥ט אֶ֝֗רֶץ מִדָּרֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Why your clothes become hot
When the land is becalmed by the south wind?
Transliteration: asher-vegadeykha chamiym vehashekit erets midarvom

Hebrew: תַּרְקִ֣יעַ עִ֭מּוֹ לִשְׁחָקִ֑ים חֲ֝זָקִ֗ים כִּרְאִ֥י מוּצָֽק׃
Translated:
Can you help him stretch out the heavens,
Firm as a mirror of cast metal?
Transliteration: tarekiya imvo lishechakiym chazakiym khireiy mutsak

Hebrew: ה֭וֹדִיעֵנוּ מַה־נֹּ֣אמַר ל֑וֹ לֹֽא־נַ֝עֲרֹ֗ךְ מִפְּנֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
Inform us, then, what we may say to Him;
We cannot argue because [we are in] darkness.
Transliteration: hvodiyenu mah-nomar lvo lo-naarokhe mifeney-choshekhe

Hebrew: הַֽיְסֻפַּר־ל֭וֹ כִּ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר אִֽם־אָ֥מַר אִ֝֗ישׁ כִּ֣י יְבֻלָּֽע׃
Translated:
Is anything conveyed to Him when I speak?
Can a man say anything when he is confused?
Transliteration: hayesufar-lvo khiy adaver im-amar iysh khiy yevula

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֤ה ׀ לֹ֘א־רָ֤אוּ א֗וֹר בָּהִ֣יר ה֭וּא בַּשְּׁחָקִ֑ים וְר֥וּחַ עָ֝בְרָ֗ה וַֽתְּטַהֲרֵֽם׃
Translated:
Now, then, one cannot see the sun,
Though it be bright in the heavens,
Until the wind comes and clears them [of clouds].
Transliteration: veatah lo-rau vor vahiyr hu vashechakiym verucha averah vatetaharem

Hebrew: מִ֭צָּפוֹן זָהָ֣ב יֶאֱתֶ֑ה עַל־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ נ֣וֹרָא הֽוֹד׃
Translated:
By the north wind the golden rays emerge;
The splendor about God is awesome.
Transliteration: mitsafvon zahav yeeteh al-elvoha nvora hvod

Hebrew: שַׁדַּ֣י לֹא־מְ֭צָאנֻהוּ שַׂגִּיא־כֹ֑חַ וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט וְרֹב־צְ֝דָקָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְעַנֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Shaddai—we cannot attain to Him;
He is great in power and justice
And abundant in righteousness; He does not torment.
Transliteration: shaday lo-metsanuhu shagiy-khocha umishefat verov-tsedakah lo yeaneh

Hebrew: לָ֭כֵן יְרֵא֣וּהוּ אֲנָשִׁ֑ים לֹֽא־יִ֝רְאֶ֗ה כׇּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵֽב׃ {פ}
Translated:
Therefore, men are in awe of Him
Whom none of the wise can perceive.
Transliteration: lakhen yereuhu anashiym lo-yireeh khׇl-chakhemey-lev {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעַן־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב (מנהסערה) [מִ֥ן ׀ הַסְּעָרָ֗ה] וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:
Transliteration: vayaan-yehovah et-iyyvov (mnhsrh) [min hasearah] vayomar

Hebrew: מִ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ מַחְשִׁ֖יךְ עֵצָ֥ה בְמִלִּ֗ין בְּֽלִי־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Who is this who darkens counsel,
Speaking without knowledge?
Transliteration: miy zeh macheshiykhe etsah vemiliyn veliy-daat

Hebrew: אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר חֲלָצֶ֑יךָ וְ֝אֶשְׁאָלְךָ֗ וְהוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Gird your loins like a man;
I will ask and you will inform Me.
Transliteration: ezׇr-na khegever chalatseykha veeshealekha vehvodiyeniy

Hebrew: אֵיפֹ֣ה הָ֭יִיתָ בְּיׇסְדִי־אָ֑רֶץ הַ֝גֵּ֗ד אִם־יָדַ֥עְתָּ בִינָֽה׃
Translated:
Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundations?
Speak if you have understanding.
Transliteration: eyfoh hayiiyta veyׇsediy-arets haged im-yadaeta viynah

Hebrew: מִי־שָׂ֣ם מְ֭מַדֶּיהָ כִּ֣י תֵדָ֑ע א֤וֹ מִֽי־נָטָ֖ה עָלֶ֣יהָ קָּֽו׃
Translated:
Do you know who fixed its dimensions
Or who measured it with a line?
Transliteration: miy-sham memadeyha khiy teda vo miy-natah aleyha kav

Hebrew: עַל־מָ֭ה אֲדָנֶ֣יהָ הׇטְבָּ֑עוּ א֥וֹ מִי־יָ֝רָ֗ה אֶ֣בֶן פִּנָּתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Onto what were its bases sunk?
Who set its cornerstone
Transliteration: al-mah adaneyha hׇtevau vo miy-yarah even finatah

Hebrew: בְּרׇן־יַ֭חַד כּ֣וֹכְבֵי בֹ֑קֶר וַ֝יָּרִ֗יעוּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
When the morning stars sang together
And all the divine beings shouted for joy?
Transliteration: verׇn-yachad khvokhevey voker vayariyu khׇl-veney Elohim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣סֶךְ בִּדְלָתַ֣יִם יָ֑ם בְּ֝גִיח֗וֹ מֵרֶ֥חֶם יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
Who closed the sea behind doors
When it gushed forth out of the womb,
Transliteration: vayasekhe videlatayiim yam vegiychvo merechem eitse

Hebrew: בְּשׂוּמִ֣י עָנָ֣ן לְבֻשׁ֑וֹ וַ֝עֲרָפֶ֗ל חֲתֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
When I clothed it in clouds,
Swaddled it in dense clouds,
Transliteration: veshumiy anan levushvo vaarafel chatulatvo

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁבֹּ֣ר עָלָ֣יו חֻקִּ֑י וָ֝אָשִׂ֗ים בְּרִ֣יחַ וּדְלָתָֽיִם׃
Translated:
When I made breakers My limit for it,
And set up its bar and doors,
Transliteration: vaeshevor alayv chukiy vaashiym veriycha udelatayiim

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר עַד־פֹּ֣ה תָ֭בוֹא וְלֹ֣א תֹסִ֑יף וּפֹא־יָ֝שִׁ֗ית בִּגְא֥וֹן גַּלֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
And said, “You may come so far and no farther;
Here your surging waves will stop”?
Transliteration: vaomar ad-foh tavvo velo tosiyf ufo-yashiyt vigevon galeykha

Hebrew: הֲֽ֭מִיָּמֶיךָ צִוִּ֣יתָ בֹּ֑קֶר (ידעתה שחר) [יִדַּ֖עְתָּ הַשַּׁ֣חַר] מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Have you ever commanded the day to break,
Assigned the dawn its place,
Transliteration: hamiyameykha tsiviyta voker (ydth shchr) [yidaeta hashachar] mekomvo

Hebrew: לֶ֭אֱחֹז בְּכַנְפ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיִנָּעֲר֖וּ רְשָׁ<sup>עִ֣</sup>ים מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated:
So that it seizes the corners of the earth
And shakes the wicked out of it?
Transliteration: leechoz vekhanefvot haarets veyinaaru resha<sup>i</sup>ym mimenah

Hebrew: תִּ֭תְהַפֵּךְ כְּחֹ֣מֶר חוֹתָ֑ם וְ֝יִֽתְיַצְּב֗וּ כְּמ֣וֹ לְבֽוּשׁ׃
Translated:
It changes like clay under the seal
Till [its hues] are fixed like those of a garment.
Transliteration: titehafekhe khechomer chvotam veyiiteyatsevu khemvo levush

Hebrew: וְיִמָּנַ֣ע מֵרְשָׁ<sup>עִ֣</sup>ים אוֹרָ֑ם וּזְר֥וֹעַ רָ֝מָ֗ה תִּשָּׁבֵֽר׃
Translated:
Their light is withheld from the wicked,
And the upraised arm is broken.
Transliteration: veyimana meresha<sup>i</sup>ym voram uzervoa ramah tishaver

Hebrew: הֲ֭בָאתָ עַד־נִבְכֵי־יָ֑ם וּבְחֵ֥קֶר תְּ֝ה֗וֹם הִתְהַלָּֽכְתָּ׃
Translated:
Have you penetrated to the sources of the sea,
Or walked in the recesses of the deep?
Transliteration: havata ad-nivekhey-yam uvecheker tehvom hitehalakheta

Hebrew: הֲנִגְל֣וּ לְ֭ךָ שַׁעֲרֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְשַׁעֲרֵ֖י צַלְמָ֣וֶת תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
Have the gates of death been disclosed to you?
Have you seen the gates of deep darkness?
Transliteration: hanigelu lekha shaarey-mavet veshaarey tsalemavet tireeh

Hebrew: הִ֭תְבֹּנַנְתָּ עַד־רַחֲבֵי־אָ֑רֶץ הַ֝גֵּ֗ד אִם־יָדַ֥עְתָּ כֻלָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Have you surveyed the expanses of the earth?
If you know of these—tell Me.
Transliteration: hitevonaneta ad-rachavey-arets haged im-yadaeta khulah

Hebrew: אֵי־זֶ֣ה הַ֭דֶּרֶךְ יִשְׁכׇּן־א֑וֹר וְ֝חֹ֗שֶׁךְ אֵי־זֶ֥ה מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Which path leads to where light dwells,
And where is the place of darkness,
Transliteration: ey-zeh haderekhe yishekhׇn-vor vechoshekhe ey-zeh mekomvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִ֭קָּחֶנּוּ אֶל־גְּבוּל֑וֹ וְכִי־תָ֝בִ֗ין נְתִיב֥וֹת בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
That you may take it to its domain
And know the way to its home?
Transliteration: khiy tikachenu el-gevulvo vekhiy-taviyn netiyvvot veytvo

Hebrew: יָ֭דַעְתָּ כִּי־אָ֣ז תִּוָּלֵ֑ד וּמִסְפַּ֖ר יָמֶ֣יךָ רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
Surely you know, for you were born then,
And the number of your years is many!
Transliteration: yadaeta khiy-az tivaled umisefar yameykha raviym

Hebrew: הֲ֭בָאתָ אֶל־אֹצְר֣וֹת שָׁ֑לֶג וְאוֹצְר֖וֹת בָּרָ֣ד תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
Have you penetrated the vaults of snow,
Seen the vaults of hail,
Transliteration: havata el-otservot shaleg vevotservot varad tireeh

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־חָשַׂ֥כְתִּי לְעֶת־צָ֑ר לְי֥וֹם קְ֝רָ֗ב וּמִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Which I have put aside for a time of adversity,
For a day of war and battle?
Transliteration: asher-chashakhetiy leet-tsar leyvom kerav umilechamah

Hebrew: אֵי־זֶ֣ה הַ֭דֶּרֶךְ יֵחָ֣לֶק א֑וֹר יָפֵ֖ץ קָדִ֣ים עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
By what path is the west wind dispersed,
The east wind scattered over the earth?
Transliteration: ey-zeh haderekhe eichalek vor yafets kadiym aley-arets

Hebrew: מִֽי־פִלַּ֣ג לַשֶּׁ֣טֶף תְּעָלָ֑ה וְ֝דֶ֗רֶךְ לַחֲזִ֥יז קֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Who cut a channel for the torrents
And a path for the thunderstorms,
Transliteration: miy-filag lashetef tealah vederekhe lachaziyz kolvot

Hebrew: לְ֭הַמְטִיר עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ לֹא־אִ֑ישׁ מִ֝דְבָּ֗ר לֹא־אָדָ֥ם בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
To rain down on uninhabited land,
On the wilderness where no man is,
Transliteration: lehametiyr al-erets lo-iysh midevar lo-adam vvo

Hebrew: לְהַשְׂבִּ֣יעַ שֹׁ֭אָה וּמְשֹׁאָ֑ה וּ֝לְהַצְמִ֗יחַ מֹ֣צָא דֶֽשֶׁא׃
Translated:
To saturate the desolate wasteland,
And make the crop of grass sprout forth?
Transliteration: lehasheviya shoah umeshoah ulehatsemiycha motsa deshe

Hebrew: הֲיֵשׁ־לַמָּטָ֥ר אָ֑ב א֥וֹ מִי־ה֝וֹלִ֗יד אֶגְלֵי־טָֽל׃
Translated:
Does the rain have a father?
Who begot the dewdrops?
Transliteration: haeish-lamatar av vo miy-hvoliyd egeley-tal

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֣טֶן מִ֭י יָצָ֣א הַקָּ֑רַח וּכְפֹ֥ר שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם מִ֣י יְלָדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
From whose belly came forth the ice?
Who gave birth to the frost of heaven?
Transliteration: miveten miy yatsa hakarach ukhefor shamayiim miy yeladvo

Hebrew: כָּ֭אֶבֶן מַ֣יִם יִתְחַבָּ֑אוּ וּפְנֵ֥י תְ֝ה֗וֹם יִתְלַכָּֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Water congeals like stone,
And the surface of the deep compacts.
Transliteration: khaeven mayiim yitechavau ufeney tehvom yitelakhadu

Hebrew: הַֽ֭תְקַשֵּׁר מַעֲדַנּ֣וֹת כִּימָ֑ה אֽוֹ־מֹשְׁכ֖וֹת כְּסִ֣יל תְּפַתֵּֽחַ׃
Translated:
Can you tie cords to Pleiades
Or undo the reins of Orion?
Transliteration: hatekasher maadanvot khiymah vo-moshekhvot khesiyl tefatecha

Hebrew: הֲתֹצִ֣יא מַזָּר֣וֹת בְּעִתּ֑וֹ וְ֝עַ֗יִשׁ עַל־בָּנֶ֥יהָ תַנְחֵֽם׃
Translated:
Can you lead out Mazzaroth in its season,
Conduct the Bear with her sons?
Transliteration: hatotsiy mazarvot veitvo veayiish al-vaneyha tanechem

Hebrew: הֲ֭יָדַעְתָּ חֻקּ֣וֹת שָׁמָ֑יִם אִם־תָּשִׂ֖ים מִשְׁטָר֣וֹ בָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Do you know the laws of heaven
Or impose its authority on earth?
Transliteration: hayadaeta chukvot shamayiim im-tashiym mishetarvo vaarets

Hebrew: הֲתָרִ֣ים לָעָ֣ב קוֹלֶ֑ךָ וְֽשִׁפְעַת־מַ֥יִם תְּכַסֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Can you send up an order to the clouds
For an abundance of water to cover you?
Transliteration: hatariym laav kvolekha veshifeat-mayiim tekhasekha

Hebrew: הַֽתְשַׁלַּ֣ח בְּרָקִ֣ים וְיֵלֵ֑כוּ וְיֹאמְר֖וּ לְךָ֣ הִנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Can you dispatch the lightning on a mission
And have it answer you, “I am ready”?
Transliteration: hateshalach verakiym veeilekhu veyomeru lekha hinenu

Hebrew: מִי־שָׁ֭ת בַּטֻּח֣וֹת חׇכְמָ֑ה א֤וֹ מִֽי־נָתַ֖ן לַשֶּׂ֣כְוִי בִינָֽה׃
Translated:
Who put wisdom in the hidden parts?
Who gave understanding to the mind?
Transliteration: miy-shat vatuchvot chׇkhemah vo miy-natan lashekheviy viynah

Hebrew: מִֽי־יְסַפֵּ֣ר שְׁחָקִ֣ים בְּחׇכְמָ֑ה וְנִבְלֵ֥י שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם מִ֣י יַשְׁכִּֽיב׃
Translated:
Who is wise enough to give an account of the heavens?
Who can tilt the bottles of the sky,
Transliteration: miy-yesafer shechakiym vechׇkhemah veniveley shamayiim miy yashekhiyv

Hebrew: בְּצֶ֣קֶת עָ֭פָר לַמּוּצָ֑ק וּרְגָבִ֥ים יְדֻבָּֽקוּ׃
Translated:
Whereupon the earth melts into a mass,
And its clods stick together.
Transliteration: vetseket afar lamutsak uregaviym yeduvaku

Hebrew: הֲתָצ֣וּד לְלָבִ֣יא טָ֑רֶף וְחַיַּ֖ת כְּפִירִ֣ים תְּמַלֵּֽא׃
Translated:
Can you hunt prey for the lion,
And satisfy the appetite of the king of beasts?
Transliteration: hatatsud lelaviy taref vechayat khefiyriym temale

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָשֹׁ֥חוּ בַמְּעוֹנ֑וֹת יֵשְׁב֖וּ בַסֻּכָּ֣ה לְמוֹ־אָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
They crouch in their dens,
Lie in ambush in their lairs.
Transliteration: khiy-yashochu vamevonvot eishevu vasukhah lemvo-arev

Hebrew: מִ֤י יָכִ֥ין לָעֹרֵ֗ב צֵ֫יד֥וֹ כִּֽי־יְ֭לָדָו אֶל־אֵ֣ל יְשַׁוֵּ֑עוּ יִ֝תְע֗וּ לִבְלִי־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated:
Who provides food for the raven
When his young cry out to God
And wander about without food?
Transliteration: miy yakhiyn laorev tseydvo khiy-yeladav el-el yeshaveu yiteu liveliy-okhel

Hebrew: הֲיָדַ֗עְתָּ עֵ֭ת לֶ֣דֶת יַעֲלֵי־סָ֑לַע חֹלֵ֖ל אַיָּל֣וֹת תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated:
Do you know the season when the mountain goats give birth?
Can you mark the time when the hinds calve?
Transliteration: hayadaeta et ledet yaaley-sala cholel ayalvot tishemor

Hebrew: תִּסְפֹּ֣ר יְרָחִ֣ים תְּמַלֶּ֑אנָה וְ֝יָדַעְתָּ֗ עֵ֣ת לִדְתָּֽנָה׃
Translated:
Can you count the months they must complete?
Do you know the season they give birth,
Transliteration: tisefor yerachiym temalenah veyadaeta et lidetanah

Hebrew: תִּ֭כְרַעְנָה יַלְדֵיהֶ֣ן תְּפַלַּ֑חְנָה חֶבְלֵיהֶ֥ם תְּשַׁלַּֽחְנָה׃
Translated:
When they couch to bring forth their offspring,
To deliver their young?
Transliteration: tikheraenah yaledeyhen tefalachenah cheveleyhem teshalachenah

Hebrew: יַחְלְמ֣וּ בְ֭נֵיהֶם יִרְבּ֣וּ בַבָּ֑ר יָ֝צְא֗וּ וְלֹא־שָׁ֥בוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Their young are healthy; they grow up in the open;
They leave and return no more.
Transliteration: yachelemu veneyhem yirevu vavar yatseu velo-shavu lamvo

Hebrew: מִי־שִׁלַּ֣ח פֶּ֣רֶא חׇפְשִׁ֑י וּמֹסְר֥וֹת עָ֝ר֗וֹד מִ֣י פִתֵּֽחַ׃
Translated:
Who sets the wild ass free?
Who loosens the bonds of the onager,
Transliteration: miy-shilach fere chׇfeshiy umoservot arvod miy fitecha

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי עֲרָבָ֣ה בֵית֑וֹ וּֽמִשְׁכְּנוֹתָ֥יו מְלֵחָֽה׃
Translated:
Whose home I have made the wilderness,
The salt land his dwelling-place?
Transliteration: asher-shametiy aravah veytvo umishekhenvotayv melechah

Hebrew: יִ֭שְׂחַק לַהֲמ֣וֹן קִרְיָ֑ה תְּשֻׁא֥וֹת נֹ֝גֵ֗שׂ לֹ֣א יִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
He scoffs at the tumult of the city,
Does not hear the shouts of the driver.
Transliteration: yishechak lahamvon kireyah teshuvot nogesh lo yishema

Hebrew: יְת֣וּר הָרִ֣ים מִרְעֵ֑הוּ וְאַחַ֖ר כׇּל־יָר֣וֹק יִדְרֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
He roams the hills for his pasture;
He searches for any green thing.
Transliteration: yetur hariym mireehu veachar khׇl-yarvok yidervosh

Hebrew: הֲיֹ֣אבֶה רֵּ֣ים עׇבְדֶ֑ךָ אִם־יָ֝לִ֗ין עַל־אֲבוּסֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Would the wild ox agree to serve you?
Would he spend the night at your crib?
Transliteration: hayoveh reym ׇvedekha im-yaliyn al-avusekha

Hebrew: הֲֽתִקְשׇׁר־רֵ֭ים בְּתֶ֣לֶם עֲבֹת֑וֹ אִם־יְשַׂדֵּ֖ד עֲמָקִ֣ים אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Can you hold the wild ox by ropes to the furrow?
Would he plow up the valleys behind you?
Transliteration: hatikeshׇr-reym vetelem avotvo im-yeshaded amakiym achareykha

Hebrew: הֲֽתִבְטַח־בּ֭וֹ כִּֽי־רַ֣ב כֹּח֑וֹ וְתַעֲזֹ֖ב אֵלָ֣יו יְגִיעֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Would you rely on his great strength
And leave your toil to him?
Transliteration: hativetach-vvo khiy-rav khochvo vetaazov elayv yegiyekha

Hebrew: הֲתַאֲמִ֣ין בּ֭וֹ כִּֽי־[יָשִׁ֣יב] (ישוב) זַרְעֶ֑ךָ וְֽגׇרְנְךָ֥ יֶאֱסֹֽף׃
Translated:
Would you trust him to bring in the seed
And gather it in from your threshing floor?
Transliteration: hataamiyn vvo khiy-[yashiyv] (yshvv) zareekha vegׇrenekha yeesof

Hebrew: כְּנַף־רְנָנִ֥ים נֶעֱלָ֑סָה אִם־אֶ֝בְרָ֗ה חֲסִידָ֥ה וְנֹצָֽה׃
Translated:
The wing of the ostrich beats joyously;
Are her pinions and plumage like the stork’s?
Transliteration: khenaf-renaniym neelasah im-everah chasiydah venotsah

Hebrew: כִּי־תַעֲזֹ֣ב לָאָ֣רֶץ בֵּצֶ֑יהָ וְֽעַל־עָפָ֥ר תְּחַמֵּֽם׃
Translated:
She leaves her eggs on the ground,
Letting them warm in the dirt,
Transliteration: khiy-taazov laarets vetseyha veal-afar techamem

Hebrew: וַ֭תִּשְׁכַּח כִּי־רֶ֣גֶל תְּזוּרֶ֑הָ וְחַיַּ֖ת הַשָּׂדֶ֣ה תְדוּשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated:
Forgetting they may be crushed underfoot,
Or trampled by a wild beast.
Transliteration: vatishekhach khiy-regel tezureha vechayat hashadeh tedusheha

Hebrew: הִקְשִׁ֣יחַ בָּנֶ֣יהָ לְּלֹא־לָ֑הּ לְרִ֖יק יְגִיעָ֣הּ בְּלִי־פָֽחַד׃
Translated:
Her young are cruelly abandoned as if they were not hers;
Her labor is in vain for lack of concern.
Transliteration: hikeshiycha vaneyha lelo-lah leriyk yegiyah veliy-fachad

Hebrew: כִּי־הִשָּׁ֣הּ אֱל֣וֹהַּ חׇכְמָ֑ה וְלֹא־חָ֥לַק לָ֝֗הּ בַּבִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
For God deprived her of wisdom,
Gave her no share of understanding,
Transliteration: khiy-hishah elvoha chׇkhemah velo-chalak lah vaviynah

Hebrew: כָּ֭עֵת בַּמָּר֣וֹם תַּמְרִ֑יא תִּֽשְׂחַ֥ק לַ֝סּ֗וּס וּלְרֹכְבֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Else she would soar on high,
Scoffing at the horse and its rider.
Transliteration: khaet vamarvom tameriy tishechak lasus ulerokhevvo {f}

Hebrew: הֲתִתֵּ֣ן לַסּ֣וּס גְּבוּרָ֑ה הֲתַלְבִּ֖ישׁ צַוָּאר֣וֹ רַעְמָֽה׃
Translated:
