Do you give the horse his strength?
Do you clothe his neck with a mane?
Transliteration: hatiten lasus gevurah hataleviysh tsavarvo raemah

Hebrew: הֲֽ֭תַרְעִישֶׁנּוּ כָּאַרְבֶּ֑ה ה֖וֹד נַחְר֣וֹ אֵימָֽה׃
Translated:
Do you make him quiver like locusts,
His majestic snorting [spreading] terror?
Transliteration: hatareiyshenu khaareveh hvod nachervo eymah

Hebrew: יַחְפְּר֣וּ בָ֭עֵמֶק וְיָשִׂ֣ישׂ בְּכֹ֑חַ יֵ֝צֵ֗א לִקְרַאת־נָֽשֶׁק׃
Translated:
He paws with force, he runs with vigor,
Charging into battle.
Transliteration: yacheferu vaemek veyashiysh vekhocha eitse likerat-nashek

Hebrew: יִשְׂחַ֣ק לְ֭פַחַד וְלֹ֣א יֵחָ֑ת וְלֹא־יָ֝שׁ֗וּב מִפְּנֵי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
He scoffs at fear; he cannot be frightened;
He does not recoil from the sword.
Transliteration: yishechak lefachad velo eichat velo-yashuv mifeney-charev

Hebrew: עָ֭לָיו תִּרְנֶ֣ה אַשְׁפָּ֑ה לַ֖הַב חֲנִ֣ית וְכִידֽוֹן׃
Translated:
A quiverful of arrows whizzes by him,
And the flashing spear and the javelin.
Transliteration: alayv tireneh ashefah lahav chaniyt vekhiydvon

Hebrew: בְּרַ֣עַשׁ וְ֭רֹגֶז יְגַמֶּא־אָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־יַ֝אֲמִ֗ין כִּי־ק֥וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃
Translated:
Trembling with excitement, he swallows the land;
He does not turn aside at the blast of the trumpet.
Transliteration: veraash verogez yegame-arets velo-yaamiyn khiy-kvol shvofar

Hebrew: בְּדֵ֤י שֹׁפָ֨ר ׀ יֹ֘אמַ֤ר הֶאָ֗ח וּֽ֭מֵרָחוֹק יָרִ֣יחַ מִלְחָמָ֑ה רַ֥עַם שָׂ֝רִ֗ים וּתְרוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
As the trumpet sounds, he says, “Aha!”
From afar he smells the battle,
The roaring and shouting of the officers.
Transliteration: vedey shofar yomar heach umerachvok yariycha milechamah raam shariym uteruah

Hebrew: הֲֽ֭מִבִּינָ֣תְךָ יַאֲבֶר־נֵ֑ץ יִפְרֹ֖שׂ כְּנָפָ֣ו לְתֵימָֽן׃
Translated:
Is it by your wisdom that the hawk grows pinions,
Spreads his wings to the south?
Transliteration: hamiviynatekha yaaver-nets yiferosh khenafav leteyman

Hebrew: אִם־עַל־פִּ֭יךָ יַגְבִּ֣יהַּ נָ֑שֶׁר וְ֝כִ֗י יָרִ֥ים קִנּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Does the eagle soar at your command,
Building his nest high,
Transliteration: im-al-fiykha yageviyha nasher vekhiy yariym kinvo

Hebrew: סֶ֣לַע יִ֭שְׁכֹּן וְיִתְלֹנָ֑ן עַ֥ל שֶׁן־סֶ֝֗לַע וּמְצוּדָֽה׃
Translated:
Dwelling in the rock,
Lodging upon the fastness of a jutting rock?
Transliteration: sela yishekhon veyitelonan al shen-sela umetsudah

Hebrew: מִשָּׁ֥ם חָֽפַר־אֹ֑כֶל לְ֝מֵרָח֗וֹק עֵינָ֥יו יַבִּֽיטוּ׃
Translated:
From there he spies out his food;
From afar his eyes see it.
Transliteration: misham chafar-okhel lemerachvok eynayv yaviytu

Hebrew: וְאֶפְרֹחָ֥ו יְעַלְעוּ־דָ֑ם וּבַאֲשֶׁ֥ר חֲ֝לָלִ֗ים שָׁ֣ם הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated:
His young gulp blood;
Where the slain are, there is he.
Transliteration: veeferochav yealeu-dam uvaasher chalaliym sham hu {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֶת־אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: The LORD said in reply to Job.
Transliteration: vayaan yehovah et-iyyvov vayomar

Hebrew: הֲ֭רֹב עִם־שַׁדַּ֣י יִסּ֑וֹר מוֹכִ֖יחַ אֱל֣וֹהַּ יַעֲנֶֽנָּה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Shall one who should be disciplined complain against Shaddai?
He who arraigns God must respond.
Transliteration: harov im-shaday yisvor mvokhiycha elvoha yaanenah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן אִיּ֥וֹב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply to the LORD:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov et-yehovah vayomar

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן קַ֭לֹּתִי מָ֣ה אֲשִׁיבֶ֑ךָּ יָ֝דִ֗י שַׂ֣מְתִּי לְמוֹ־פִֽי׃
Translated:
See, I am of small worth; what can I answer You?
I clap my hand to my mouth.
Transliteration: hen kalotiy mah ashiyvekha yadiy shametiy lemvo-fiy

Hebrew: אַחַ֣ת דִּ֭בַּרְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱנֶ֑ה וּ֝שְׁתַּ֗יִם וְלֹ֣א אוֹסִֽיף׃ {פ}
Translated:
I have spoken once, and will not reply;
Twice, and will do so no more.
Transliteration: achat divaretiy velo eeneh ushetayiim velo vosiyf {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעַן־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב (מנסערה) [מִ֥ן ׀ סְעָרָ֗ה] וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:
Transliteration: vayaan-yehovah et-iyyvov (mnsrh) [min searah] vayomar

Hebrew: אֱזׇר־נָ֣א כְגֶ֣בֶר חֲלָצֶ֑יךָ אֶ֝שְׁאָלְךָ֗ וְהוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Gird your loins like a man;
I will ask, and you will inform Me.
Transliteration: ezׇr-na khegever chalatseykha eshealekha vehvodiyeniy

Hebrew: הַ֭אַף תָּפֵ֣ר מִשְׁפָּטִ֑י תַּ֝רְשִׁיעֵ֗נִי לְמַ֣עַן תִּצְדָּֽק׃
Translated:
Would you impugn My justice?
Would you condemn Me that you may be right?
Transliteration: haaf tafer mishefatiy tareshiyeniy lemaan titsedak

Hebrew: וְאִם־זְר֖וֹעַ כָּאֵ֥ל <small>׀</small> לָ֑ךְ וּ֝בְק֗וֹל כָּמֹ֥הוּ תַרְעֵֽם׃
Translated:
Have you an arm like God’s?
Can you thunder with a voice like His?
Transliteration: veim-zervoa khael <small></small> lakhe uvekvol khamohu tareem

Hebrew: עֲדֵ֥ה נָ֣א גָא֣וֹן וָגֹ֑בַהּ וְה֖וֹד וְהָדָ֣ר תִּלְבָּֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Deck yourself now with grandeur and eminence;
Clothe yourself in glory and majesty.
Transliteration: adeh na gavon vagovah vehvod vehadar tilevash

Hebrew: הָ֭פֵץ עֶבְר֣וֹת אַפֶּ֑ךָ וּרְאֵ֥ה כׇל־גֵּ֝אֶ֗ה וְהַשְׁפִּילֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Scatter wide your raging anger;
See every proud man and bring him low.
Transliteration: hafets evervot afekha ureeh khׇl-geeh vehashefiylehu

Hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה כׇל־גֵּ֭אֶה הַכְנִיעֵ֑הוּ וַהֲדֹ֖ךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
See every proud man and humble him,
And bring them down where they stand.
Transliteration: reeh khׇl-geeh hakheniyehu vahadokhe reshaiym tachetam

Hebrew: טׇמְנֵ֣ם בֶּעָפָ֣ר יָ֑חַד פְּ֝נֵיהֶ֗ם חֲבֹ֣שׁ בַּטָּמֽוּן׃
Translated:
Bury them all in the earth;
Hide their faces in obscurity.
Transliteration: tׇmenem veafar yachad feneyhem chavosh vatamun

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִ֥י אוֹדֶ֑ךָּ כִּֽי־תוֹשִׁ֖עַ לְךָ֣ יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Then even I would praise you
For the triumph your right hand won you.
Transliteration: vegam-aniy vodekha khiy-tvoshia lekha yemiynekha

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֣א בְ֭הֵמוֹת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתִי עִמָּ֑ךְ חָ֝צִ֗יר כַּבָּקָ֥ר יֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated:
Take now behemoth, whom I made as I did you;
He eats grass, like the cattle.
Transliteration: hineh-na vehemvot asher-ashiytiy imakhe chatsiyr khavakar yokhel

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֣א כֹח֣וֹ בְמׇתְנָ֑יו וְ֝אוֹנ֗וֹ בִּשְׁרִירֵ֥י בִטְנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His strength is in his loins,
His might in the muscles of his belly.
Transliteration: hineh-na khochvo vemׇtenayv vevonvo visheriyrey vitenvo

Hebrew: יַחְפֹּ֣ץ זְנָב֣וֹ כְמוֹ־אָ֑רֶז גִּידֵ֖י פַחֲדָ֣ו יְשֹׂרָֽגוּ׃
Translated:
He makes his tail stand up like a cedar;
The sinews of his thighs are knit together.
Transliteration: yachefots zenavvo khemvo-arez giydey fachadav yeshoragu

Hebrew: עֲ֭צָמָיו אֲפִיקֵ֣י נְחֻשָׁ֑ה גְּ֝רָמָ֗יו כִּמְטִ֥יל בַּרְזֶֽל׃
Translated:
His bones are like tubes of bronze,
His limbs like iron rods.
Transliteration: atsamayv afiykey nechushah geramayv khimetiyl varezel

Hebrew: ה֭וּא רֵאשִׁ֣ית דַּרְכֵי־אֵ֑ל הָ֝עֹשׂ֗וֹ יַגֵּ֥שׁ חַרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He is the first of God’s works;
Only his Maker can draw the sword against him.
Transliteration: hu reshiyt darekhey-el haoshvo yagesh charevvo

Hebrew: כִּי־ב֭וּל הָרִ֣ים יִשְׂאוּ־ל֑וֹ וְֽכׇל־חַיַּ֥ת הַ֝שָּׂדֶ֗ה יְשַׂחֲקוּ־שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
The mountains yield him produce,
Where all the beasts of the field play.
Transliteration: khiy-vul hariym yisheu-lvo vekhׇl-chayat hashadeh yeshachaku-sham

Hebrew: תַּֽחַת־צֶאֱלִ֥ים יִשְׁכָּ֑ב בְּסֵ֖תֶר קָנֶ֣ה וּבִצָּֽה׃
Translated:
He lies down beneath the lotuses,
In the cover of the swamp reeds.
Transliteration: tachat-tseeliym yishekhav veseter kaneh uvitsah

Hebrew: יְסֻכֻּ֣הוּ צֶאֱלִ֣ים צִֽלְל֑וֹ יְ֝סֻבּ֗וּהוּ עַרְבֵי־נָֽחַל׃
Translated:
The lotuses embower him with shade;
The willows of the brook surround him.
Transliteration: yesukhuhu tseeliym tsilelvo yesuvuhu arevey-nachal

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן יַעֲשֹׁ֣ק נָ֭הָר לֹ֣א יַחְפּ֑וֹז יִבְטַ֓ח ׀ כִּֽי־יָגִ֖יחַ יַרְדֵּ֣ן אֶל־פִּֽיהוּ׃
Translated:
He can restrain the river from its rushing;
He is confident the stream will gush at his command.
Transliteration: hen yaashok nahar lo yachefvoz yivetach khiy-yagiycha yareden el-fiyhu

Hebrew: בְּעֵינָ֥יו יִקָּחֶ֑נּוּ בְּ֝מוֹקְשִׁ֗ים יִנְקׇב־אָֽף׃
Translated:
Can he be taken by his eyes?
Can his nose be pierced by hooks?
Transliteration: veeynayv yikachenu vemvokeshiym yinekׇv-af

Hebrew: תִּמְשֹׁ֣ךְ לִוְיָתָ֣ן בְּחַכָּ֑ה וּ֝בְחֶ֗בֶל תַּשְׁקִ֥יעַ לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Can you draw out Leviathan by a fishhook?
Can you press down his tongue by a rope?
Transliteration: timeshokhe liveyatan vechakhah uvechevel tashekiya leshonvo

Hebrew: הֲתָשִׂ֣ים אַגְמֹ֣ן בְּאַפּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְח֗וֹחַ תִּקֹּ֥ב לֶחֱיֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Can you put a ring through his nose,
Or pierce his jaw with a barb?
Transliteration: hatashiym agemon veafvo uvechvocha tikov lecheyvo

Hebrew: הֲיַרְבֶּ֣ה אֵ֭לֶיךָ תַּחֲנוּנִ֑ים אִם־יְדַבֵּ֖ר אֵלֶ֣יךָ רַכּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Will he plead with you at length?
Will he speak soft words to you?
Transliteration: hayareveh eleykha tachanuniym im-yedaver eleykha rakhvot

Hebrew: הֲיִכְרֹ֣ת בְּרִ֣ית עִמָּ֑ךְ תִּ֝קָּחֶ֗נּוּ לְעֶ֣בֶד עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Will he make an agreement with you
To be taken as your lifelong slave?
Transliteration: hayikherot veriyt imakhe tikachenu leeved volam

Hebrew: הַֽתְשַׂחֶק־בּ֭וֹ כַּצִּפּ֑וֹר וְ֝תִקְשְׁרֶ֗נּוּ לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Will you play with him like a bird,
And tie him down for your girls?
Transliteration: hateshachek-vvo khatsifvor vetikesherenu lenaarvoteykha

Hebrew: יִכְר֣וּ עָ֭לָיו חַבָּרִ֑ים יֶ֝חֱצ֗וּהוּ בֵּ֣ין כְּֽנַעֲנִֽים׃
Translated:
Shall traders traffic in him?
Will he be divided up among merchants?
Transliteration: yikheru alayv chavariym yechetsuhu veyn khenaaniym

Hebrew: הַֽתְמַלֵּ֣א בְשֻׂכּ֣וֹת עוֹר֑וֹ וּבְצִלְצַ֖ל דָּגִ֣ים רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Can you fill his skin with darts
Or his head with fish-spears?
Transliteration: hatemale veshukhvot vorvo uvetsiletsal dagiym roshvo

Hebrew: שִׂים־עָלָ֥יו כַּפֶּ֑ךָ זְכֹ֥ר מִ֝לְחָמָ֗ה אַל־תּוֹסַֽף׃
Translated:
Lay a hand on him,
And you will never think of battle again.
Transliteration: shiym-alayv khafekha zekhor milechamah al-tvosaf

Hebrew: הֵן־תֹּחַלְתּ֥וֹ נִכְזָ֑בָה הֲגַ֖ם אֶל־מַרְאָ֣יו יֻטָֽל׃
Translated:
See, any hope [of capturing] him must be disappointed;
One is prostrated by the very sight of him.
Transliteration: hen-tochaletvo nikhezavah hagam el-mareayv yutal

Hebrew: לֹֽא־אַ֭כְזָר כִּ֣י יְעוּרֶ֑נּוּ וּמִ֥י ה֝֗וּא לְפָנַ֥י יִתְיַצָּֽב׃
Translated:
There is no one so fierce as to rouse him;
Who then can stand up to Me?
Transliteration: lo-akhezar khiy yeurenu umiy huu lefanay yiteyatsav

Hebrew: מִ֣י הִ֭קְדִּימַנִי וַאֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם לִי־הֽוּא׃
Translated:
Whoever confronts Me I will requite,
For everything under the heavens is Mine.
Transliteration: miy hikediymaniy vaashalem tachat khׇl-hashamayiim liy-hu

Hebrew: (לא) [לוֹ־]אַחֲרִ֥ישׁ בַּדָּ֑יו וּדְבַר־גְּ֝בוּר֗וֹת וְחִ֣ין עֶרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I will not be silent concerning him
Or the praise of his martial exploits.
Transliteration: (l) [lvo-]achariysh vadayv udevar-gevurvot vechiyn erekhvo

Hebrew: מִֽי־גִ֭לָּה פְּנֵ֣י לְבוּשׁ֑וֹ בְּכֶ֥פֶל רִ֝סְנ֗וֹ מִ֣י יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
Who can uncover his outer garment?
Who can penetrate the folds of his jowls?
Transliteration: miy-gilah feney levushvo vekhefel risenvo miy yavvo

Hebrew: דַּלְתֵ֣י פָ֭נָיו מִ֣י פִתֵּ֑חַ סְבִיב֖וֹת שִׁנָּ֣יו אֵימָֽה׃
Translated:
Who can pry open the doors of his face?
His bared teeth strike terror.
Transliteration: daletey fanayv miy fitecha seviyvvot shinayv eymah

Hebrew: גַּ֭אֲוָה אֲפִיקֵ֣י מָגִנִּ֑ים סָ֝ג֗וּר חוֹתָ֥ם צָֽר׃
Translated:
His protective scales are his pride,
Locked with a binding seal.
Transliteration: gaavah afiykey maginiym sagur chvotam tsar

Hebrew: אֶחָ֣ד בְּאֶחָ֣ד יִגַּ֑שׁוּ וְ֝ר֗וּחַ לֹא־יָבֹ֥א בֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
One scale touches the other;
Not even a breath can enter between them.
Transliteration: echad veechad yigashu verucha lo-yavo veyneyhem

Hebrew: אִישׁ־בְּאָחִ֥יהוּ יְדֻבָּ֑קוּ יִ֝תְלַכְּד֗וּ וְלֹ֣א יִתְפָּרָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Each clings to each;
They are interlocked so they cannot be parted.
Transliteration: iysh-veachiyhu yeduvaku yitelakhedu velo yitefaradu

Hebrew: עֲֽ֭טִישֹׁתָיו תָּ֣הֶל א֑וֹר וְ֝עֵינָ֗יו כְּעַפְעַפֵּי־שָֽׁחַר׃
Translated:
His sneezings flash lightning,
And his eyes are like the glimmerings of dawn.
Transliteration: atiyshotayv tahel vor veeynayv kheafeafey-shachar

Hebrew: מִ֭פִּיו לַפִּידִ֣ים יַהֲלֹ֑כוּ כִּיד֥וֹדֵי אֵ֝֗שׁ יִתְמַלָּֽטוּ׃
Translated:
Firebrands stream from his mouth;
Fiery sparks escape.
Transliteration: mifiyv lafiydiym yahalokhu khiydvodey esh yitemalatu

Hebrew: מִ֭נְּחִירָיו יֵצֵ֣א עָשָׁ֑ן כְּד֖וּד נָפ֣וּחַ וְאַגְמֹֽן׃
Translated:
Out of his nostrils comes smoke
As from a steaming, boiling cauldron.
Transliteration: minechiyrayv eitse ashan khedud nafucha veagemon

Hebrew: נַ֭פְשׁוֹ גֶּחָלִ֣ים תְּלַהֵ֑ט וְ֝לַ֗הַב מִפִּ֥יו יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
His breath ignites coals;
Flames blaze from his mouth.
Transliteration: nafeshvo gechaliym telahet velahav mifiyv eitse

Hebrew: בְּֽ֭צַוָּארוֹ יָלִ֣ין עֹ֑ז וּ֝לְפָנָ֗יו תָּד֥וּץ דְּאָבָֽה׃
Translated:
Strength resides in his neck;
Power leaps before him.
Transliteration: vetsavarvo yaliyn oz ulefanayv taduts deavah

Hebrew: מַפְּלֵ֣י בְשָׂר֣וֹ דָבֵ֑קוּ יָצ֥וּק עָ֝לָ֗יו בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
The layers of his flesh stick together;
He is as though cast hard; he does not totter.
Transliteration: mafeley vesharvo daveku yatsuk alayv val-yimvot

Hebrew: לִ֭בּוֹ יָצ֣וּק כְּמוֹ־אָ֑בֶן וְ֝יָצ֗וּק כְּפֶ֣לַח תַּחְתִּֽית׃
Translated:
His heart is cast hard as a stone,
Hard as the nether millstone.
Transliteration: livvo yatsuk khemvo-aven veyatsuk khefelach tachetiyt

Hebrew: מִ֭שֵּׂתוֹ יָג֣וּרוּ אֵלִ֑ים מִ֝שְּׁבָרִ֗ים יִתְחַטָּֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Divine beings are in dread as he rears up;
As he crashes down, they cringe.
Transliteration: mishetvo yaguru eliym mishevariym yitechatau

Hebrew: מַשִּׂיגֵ֣הוּ חֶ֭רֶב בְּלִ֣י תָק֑וּם חֲנִ֖ית מַסָּ֣ע וְשִׁרְיָֽה׃
Translated:
No sword that overtakes him can prevail,
Nor spear, nor missile, nor lance.
Transliteration: mashiygehu cherev veliy takum chaniyt masa veshireyah

Hebrew: יַחְשֹׁ֣ב לְתֶ֣בֶן בַּרְזֶ֑ל לְעֵ֖ץ רִקָּב֣וֹן נְחוּשָֽׁה׃
Translated:
He regards iron as straw,
Bronze, as rotted wood.
Transliteration: yacheshov leteven varezel leets rikavvon nechushah

Hebrew: לֹא־יַבְרִיחֶ֥נּוּ בֶן־קָ֑שֶׁת לְ֝קַ֗שׁ נֶהְפְּכוּ־ל֥וֹ אַבְנֵי־קָֽלַע׃
Translated:
No arrow can put him to flight;
Slingstones turn into stubble for him.
Transliteration: lo-yaveriychenu ven-kashet lekash nehefekhu-lvo aveney-kala

Hebrew: כְּ֭קַשׁ נֶחְשְׁב֣וּ תוֹתָ֑ח וְ֝יִשְׂחַ֗ק לְרַ֣עַשׁ כִּידֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Clubs are regarded as stubble;
He scoffs at the quivering javelin.
Transliteration: khekash necheshevu tvotach veyiishechak leraash khiydvon

Hebrew: תַּ֭חְתָּיו חַדּ֣וּדֵי חָ֑רֶשׂ יִרְפַּ֖ד חָר֣וּץ עֲלֵי־טִֽיט׃
Translated:
His underpart is jagged shards;
It spreads a threshing-sledge on the mud.
Transliteration: tachetayv chadudey charesh yirefad charuts aley-tiyt

Hebrew: יַרְתִּ֣יחַ כַּסִּ֣יר מְצוּלָ֑ה יָ֝֗ם יָשִׂ֥ים כַּמֶּרְקָחָֽה׃
Translated:
He makes the depths seethe like a cauldron;
He makes the sea [boil] like an ointment-pot.
Transliteration: yaretiycha khasiyr metsulah yam yashiym khamerekachah

Hebrew: אַ֭חֲרָיו יָאִ֣יר נָתִ֑יב יַחְשֹׁ֖ב תְּה֣וֹם לְשֵׂיבָֽה׃
Translated:
His wake is a luminous path;
He makes the deep seem white-haired.
Transliteration: acharayv yaiyr natiyv yacheshov tehvom lesheyvah

Hebrew: אֵֽין־עַל־עָפָ֥ר מׇשְׁל֑וֹ הֶ֝עָשׂ֗וּ לִבְלִי־חָֽת׃
Translated:
There is no one on land who can dominate him,
Made as he is without fear.
Transliteration: eyn-al-afar mׇshelvo heashu liveliy-chat

Hebrew: אֵֽת־כׇּל־גָּבֹ֥הַּ יִרְאֶ֑ה ה֝֗וּא מֶ֣לֶךְ עַל־כׇּל־בְּנֵי־שָֽׁחַץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He sees all that is haughty;
He is king over all proud beasts.
Transliteration: et-khׇl-gavoha yireeh huu melekhe al-khׇl-veney-shachats {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן אִיּ֥וֹב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֹּאמַֽר׃
Translated: Job said in reply to the LORD:
Transliteration: vayaan iyyvov et-yehovah vayomar

Hebrew: (ידעת) [יָ֭דַעְתִּי] כִּי־כֹ֣ל תּוּכָ֑ל וְלֹֽא־יִבָּצֵ֖ר מִמְּךָ֣ מְזִמָּֽה׃
Translated:
I know that You can do everything,
That nothing You propose is impossible for You.
Transliteration: (ydt) [yadaetiy] khiy-khol tukhal velo-yivatser mimekha mezimah

Hebrew: מִ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ מַעְלִ֥ים עֵצָ֗ה בְּֽלִ֫י־דָ֥עַת לָכֵ֣ן הִ֭גַּדְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אָבִ֑ין נִפְלָא֥וֹת מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי וְלֹ֣א אֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
Who is this who obscures counsel without knowledge?
Indeed, I spoke without understanding
Of things beyond me, which I did not know.
Transliteration: miy zeh maeliym etsah veliy-daat lakhen higadetiy velo aviyn nifelavot mimeniy velo eda

Hebrew: שְֽׁמַֽע־נָ֭א וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר אֶ֝שְׁאָלְךָ֗ וְהוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Hear now, and I will speak;
I will ask, and You will inform me.
Transliteration: shema-na veanokhiy adaver eshealekha vehvodiyeniy

Hebrew: לְשֵֽׁמַע־אֹ֥זֶן שְׁמַעְתִּ֑יךָ וְ֝עַתָּ֗ה עֵינִ֥י רָאָֽתְךָ׃
Translated:
I had heard You with my ears,
But now I see You with my eyes;
Transliteration: leshema-ozen shemaetiykha veatah eyniy raatekha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן אֶמְאַ֣ס וְנִחַ֑מְתִּי עַל־עָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Therefore, I recant and relent,
Being but dust and ashes.
Transliteration: al-khen emeas venichametiy al-afar vaefer {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶל־אִיּ֑וֹב וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־אֱלִיפַ֣ז הַתֵּימָנִ֗י חָרָ֨ה אַפִּ֤י בְךָ֙ וּבִשְׁנֵ֣י רֵעֶ֔יךָ כִּ֠י לֹ֣א דִבַּרְתֶּ֥ם אֵלַ֛י נְכוֹנָ֖ה כְּעַבְדִּ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃ {ס}
Translated: After the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken these words to Job, the L<small>ORD</small> said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “I am incensed at you and your two friends, for you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.
Transliteration: vayehiy achar diver yehovah et-hadevariym haeleh el-iyyvov vayomer yehovah el-eliyfaz hateymaniy charah afiy vekha uvisheney reeykha khiy lo divaretem elay nekhvonah kheavediy iyyvov {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה קְחוּ־לָכֶ֣ם שִׁבְעָֽה־פָרִים֩ וְשִׁבְעָ֨ה אֵילִ֜ים וּלְכ֣וּ ׀ אֶל־עַבְדִּ֣י אִיּ֗וֹב וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֤ם עוֹלָה֙ בַּעַדְכֶ֔ם וְאִיּ֣וֹב עַבְדִּ֔י יִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֧י אִם־פָּנָ֣יו אֶשָּׂ֗א לְבִלְתִּ֞י עֲשׂ֤וֹת עִמָּכֶם֙ נְבָלָ֔ה כִּ֠י לֹ֣א דִבַּרְתֶּ֥ם אֵלַ֛י נְכוֹנָ֖ה כְּעַבְדִּ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃
Translated: Now take seven bulls and seven rams and go to My servant Job and sacrifice a burnt offering for yourselves. And let Job, My servant, pray for you; for to him I will show favor and not treat you vilely, since you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.”
Transliteration: veatah kechu-lakhem shiveah-fariym veshiveah eyliym ulekhu el-avediy iyyvov vehaaliytem volah vaadekhem veiyyvov avediy yitefalel aleykhem khiy im-fanayv esha leviletiy ashvot imakhem nevalah khiy lo divaretem elay nekhvonah kheavediy iyyvov

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ֩ אֱלִיפַ֨ז הַתֵּימָנִ֜י וּבִלְדַּ֣ד הַשּׁוּחִ֗י צֹפַר֙ הַנַּ֣עֲמָתִ֔י וַיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשָּׂ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃
Translated: Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the L<small>ORD</small> had told them, and the L<small>ORD</small> showed favor to Job.
Transliteration: vayelekhu eliyfaz hateymaniy uviledad hashuchiy tsofar hanaamatiy vayaashu khaasher diver aleyhem yehovah vayisha yehovah et-feney iyyvov

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֗ה שָׁ֚ב אֶת־[שְׁב֣וּת] (שבית) אִיּ֔וֹב בְּהִֽתְפַּֽלְל֖וֹ בְּעַ֣ד רֵעֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֧סֶף יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאִיּ֖וֹב לְמִשְׁנֶֽה׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> restored Job’s fortunes when he prayed on behalf of his friends, and the L<small>ORD</small> gave Job twice what he had before.
Transliteration: vayhovah shav et-[shevut] (shvyt) iyyvov vehitefalelvo vead reehu vayosef yehovah et-khׇl-asher leiyyvov lemisheneh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֵ֠לָ֠יו כׇּל־אֶחָ֨יו וְכׇל־אַחְיֹתָ֜יו וְכׇל־יֹדְעָ֣יו לְפָנִ֗ים וַיֹּאכְל֨וּ עִמּ֣וֹ לֶ֘חֶם֮ בְּבֵיתוֹ֒ וַיָּנֻ֤דוּ לוֹ֙ וַיְנַחֲמ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ עַ֚ל כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֥יא יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו וַיִּתְּנוּ־ל֗וֹ אִ֚ישׁ קְשִׂיטָ֣ה אֶחָ֔ת וְאִ֕ישׁ נֶ֥זֶם זָהָ֖ב אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: All his brothers and sisters and all his former friends came to him and had a meal with him in his house. They consoled and comforted him for all the misfortune that the L<small>ORD</small> had brought upon him. Each gave him one kesitah and each one gold ring.
Transliteration: vayavou elayv khׇl-echayv vekhׇl-acheyotayv vekhׇl-yodeayv lefaniym vayokhelu imvo lechem veveytvo vayanudu lvo vayenachamu otvo al khׇl-haraah asher-heviy yehovah alayv vayitenu-lvo iysh keshiytah echat veiysh nezem zahav echad

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֗ה בֵּרַ֛ךְ אֶת־אַחֲרִ֥ית אִיּ֖וֹב מֵרֵֽאשִׁת֑וֹ וַֽיְהִי־ל֡וֹ אַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר אֶ֜לֶף צֹ֗אן וְשֵׁ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ גְּמַלִּ֔ים וְאֶלֶף־צֶ֥מֶד בָּקָ֖ר וְאֶ֥לֶף אֲתוֹנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> blessed the latter years of Job’s life more than the former. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and one thousand she-asses.
Transliteration: vayhovah verakhe et-achariyt iyyvov mereshitvo vayehiy-lvo arevaah ashar elef tson vesheshet alafiym gemaliym veelef-tsemed vakar veelef atvonvot

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֛וֹ שִׁבְעָ֥נָה בָנִ֖ים וְשָׁל֥וֹשׁ בָּנֽוֹת׃
Translated: He also had seven sons and three daughters.
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo shiveanah vaniym veshalvosh vanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א שֵׁם־הָאַחַת֙ יְמִימָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית קְצִיעָ֑ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖ית קֶ֥רֶן הַפּֽוּךְ׃
Translated: The first he named Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.
Transliteration: vayikera shem-haachat yemiymah veshem hasheniyt ketsiyah veshem hasheliyshiyt keren hafukhe

Hebrew: וְלֹ֨א נִמְצָ֜א נָשִׁ֥ים יָפ֛וֹת כִּבְנ֥וֹת אִיּ֖וֹב בְּכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֧ם אֲבִיהֶ֛ם נַחֲלָ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Nowhere in the land were women as beautiful as Job’s daughters to be found. Their father gave them estates together with their brothers.
Transliteration: velo nimetsa nashiym yafvot khivenvot iyyvov vekhׇl-haarets vayiten lahem aviyhem nachalah vetvokhe acheyhem

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֤י אִיּוֹב֙ אַחֲרֵי־זֹ֔את מֵאָ֥ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה (וירא) [וַיִּרְאֶ֗ה] אֶת־בָּנָיו֙ וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֣י בָנָ֔יו אַרְבָּעָ֖ה דֹּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: Afterward, Job lived one hundred and forty years to see four generations of sons and grandsons.
Transliteration: vayechiy iyyvov acharey-zot meah vearevaiym shanah (vyr) [vayireeh] et-vanayv veet-veney vanayv arevaah dorvot

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת אִיּ֔וֹב זָקֵ֖ן וּשְׂבַ֥ע יָמִֽים׃
Translated: So Job died old and contented.
Transliteration: vayamׇt iyyvov zaken usheva yamiym
